1.content:
Welcome everyone. Today is time for yet another story.

Now, this story is a little bit different. While it has a main story to be told, options will be available to branch out in to other stories for the sake of variety. Our main story follows 15-year old Sam Landry on an adventure in Japan with a considerable amount of ups and downs. He finds himself in the middle of a sinister plot, unable to do much about it. Just how will this turn out?

Well, we'll just have to see. The first option here starts off the main story, while the others will go on into alternates. Please enjoy.
1.title: Introduction

choices: Visit a museum to learn about the country's history
11.content:
Wake up, Sam! You awaken from your slumber to see your buddy Jackson standing over you. You're still half asleep, and you were just having a great dream.
"Come on, Sam! We're here! We're in Japan!" You jolt awake. You're finally in another country for the first time.
After an intense screening process in March, you're school has chosen for you and Jackson to go to a Japanese boarding school for the year. Today is April 3rd, 2016: the first day of school in Japan this year is tomorrow. You have just one day to tour the city of Tokyo before you have to check into your dorm tonight. What do you decide to do?
11.title: Our Main Story

111.content: Do they really visit a temple?
111.title: Visit a temple

1112.content: Do they go to a Japanese mall instead?
1112.title: No

11121.content: Do they end up going near a Japanese Beauty Salon?
11121.title: Yes

111211.content: Do you and Jackson get separated before you get to the salon?
111211.title: Yes

choices: A beautiful geisha (that is 18 years old).
1112111.content:
As you both wander through the mall, at some point you lose sight of Jackson and you are now alone in this maze-like building. After a lot of aimless searching for your friend, you get distracted by the flashy sign of a beauty parlor. Right underneath the brightly colored entranceway, you see a bunch of Japanese women wearing the same style of uniform that are having an intense conversation about something. By the look of their attire and name tags, it is visually obvious that they work there. You don’t know what they’re talking about due to the conversation being in Japanese and they are too far away from you. Then one of those said employees notices that you are observing them and quickly walks over to you. You decide to wait and see what she has to say, hoping that she might give you some directions. When she gets within reaching distance of you, she starts enthusiastically asking you something in Japanese. Once again, you don’t understand her but this time you begin to recognize certain words and phrases that you learned from your travel book the other day. You definitely recognize two specific phrases in particular that sound like, “do you want help with” and “very special offer” (in reality, she’s actually saying: “Do you want help with making yourself look absolutely gorgeous? If you accept this very special offer, we can turn you into the bombshell of your wildest dreams free of charge.”). Even though you still don’t know their true intentions, you simply nod your head in agreement. The employee then suddenly injects you with some sort of serum that makes you unable to move or speak. Then two other employees pick you up and carry you into the salon. Once you’re inside, they sit you down on a salon chair and begin their services.

What do they transform you into?
1112111.title: Yes

choices: Feeling the chair rise back, you see your reflection in the mirror.
Slowly it penetrates, they're giving you hair extensions.
Drumming your fingers in the bowls, you feel nail extensions, long ones!
11121112.content:
Overwhelmed by your ignorance, and needing a rest. You smile and agree to the procedure. Whatever it is. You jump, as the chair reclines until you're almost lying in place.

The heat and stress of the day fade as you feel them go to work on you. A mani-pedi wasn't on your list of things to do, but you have to admit you are enjoying the attention. It's easier to lie there and relax. Eyes closed, you try to focus on what they're saying.

It's so rapid, and interspersed with giggles, that you can't be sure what's being said. Only the vaguest of terms penetrates your mind, kawaii - cute, kirei - pretty and utsukushii - beautiful sink in. Your breathing is slow and regular, as you listen. The soft shuffling feet over the floor is hypnotic, and you suspect you might have fallen asleep a couple of times.

Hoping, that's not bad manners, and aware that most western behaviour can be seen as poor manners, you try to frame an apology once you're ready to talk again.

Feeling your fingers soaking in bowls, you assume that's some skin softening technique. But they all seem to be working on your face at the moment. Afraid to spoil their work, you can't speak. All questions will have to wait, and any overdue apology too.
11121112.title: You submit to the procedure.

choices: Rising from the chair, you race to flee the shop, and that reflection.
The girls giggle and surround you, their fast paced Japanese mocking you...
Erupting from the seat, you stand eye to eye, with all the 'other' girls!?
A huge figure looms nearby, ready to ensure you'll pay for the treatment.
111211122.content:
Slowly that penetrates, even with your eyes closed, you can feel them working attaching them to your original roots, bonding them in place. Opening your mouth to ask a question, you gurgle an objection. Gurgling being the only option you have, as your mouth is held wide by fingers.

You hear the huff-huff, as something is sprayed into your open mouth. The taste is bitter, a slight flavour of lemon added to make it more palatable.

Feeling the fingers withdraw, you open your eyes. Looking up to the circle of surrounding faces, you're startled to realise there are four girls working on your look. Your voice momentarily gone, as you struggle to wash that taste from your mouth, you indicate you want back up.

They look disappointed, offended and sad. But you feel the chair rise back into the sitting position. You see a fifth girl has been helping! Five not four girls to work on your look. At least she appears to understand, answering your apologetic smile with her own.

Planting your hands on the arm rests, you see her move too. Your world shatters as you realise the fifth girl is you! That's a mirror reflecting your smile back at you.

https://i.pinimg.com/564x/18/06/d9/1806d...

You rage, or at least try to. Your throat now coated in that hideous spray keeps you voice low and soft. Any efforts to raise your it hurt, forcing you to speak in a high, trilling girly voice.
111211122.title: They're giving you hair extensions.

choices: Follow him and drag Jackson with you
113.content:
As soon as you get off the boat, you tell Jackson that you're heading to center city Tokyo, and that he can come with you if he wants.
"Sounds fun. I'm starving, though. Let's stop and get some food on the way."
"Sure." You say. You're pretty hungry too. You both stop at a nearby restaurant and get some food, and then you head to center city. There are a couple of historical statues on display that you get pictures with. You both stop at a store to get English to Japanese dictionaries. That's when you see a suspicious looking man in a cloak carrying some strange device.
113.title: Go to center city Tokyo

1131.content:
Curious, Sam decide to follow him as he walked briskly off the main drag. The mysterious stranger entered one of the hole in the wall shops that populated the city center. Careful to not alert him, Sam blended into the crowd, until he was shoved out by a drunk man and into the stranger. Angrily, the stranger turned around to face him.
"Why are you follow me, gaijin? You follow wrong man today!"
With that, the stranger shot a beam out of his device, leaving Sam to collapse on the shop.



Now then, what happens to poor Sam?
1131.title: Follow him on your own

choices: Go after the man who did this.
Get some shrimp from the food stall!
11311.content:
Nothing about Sam's body felt right as he woke up. It felt like someone had stuffed him in an overly large fatsuit and left him to sweat on the street.

Sam clambered to his feet sluggishly, his arms and legs seconds behind his mind. Something on his chest jiggled incessantly.

Oh, man, what did that guy do to me?

He ran a hand through his hair only to come up with a lot more than he was expecting. His eyes shot wide-open to see incredibly long black hair twined between his fingers. There were two problems with that: one, his hair hadn't been that long that morning, and two, his hair wasn't black.

Sam gasped. It came out incredibly breathy and high-pitched, nothing like his own voice. His chest jiggled again.

He glanced down into a valley of deep, sweaty, cleavage. He was still wearing the Atari T-shirt he'd put on before getting off the plane, but it was stretched by the massive breasts beneath.

Sam couldn't help it. He screamed, as loud and as long as he could manage. A few pedestrians turned his way, but not many, and not for long.

I'm a girl? How am I a girl?

He took a step forward and instantly ripped the seat of his pants. Whatever he looked like now, he was far too corpulent to fit into his own clothes. For some reason, that seemed really funny.

I have to see what I look like. I have to...

He waddled forward towards a shop window, every inch of his body wobbling as he did so. What he saw in the reflective surface of the glass made his jaw drop.

Not only was he a girl, he was a fat Japanese girl who looked a little bit older than he had just been. Twenty, at least. Her hair was stringy and unkempt-- she looked like a slob. Surprisingly, that didn't upset Sam as much as he thought it should.

What do I do now?

That old dude had done this to him with whatever he'd pulled out of his pocket. Maybe he should go after him....then again, that might be dangerous. He could call his friends and see if they might be of any use...but would they believe him?

Sam caught a whiff of something delicious and turned towards a nearby food stall. Mmm...they were deep-frying shrimp...his favorite. His tummy rumbled loudly as he patted his stomach. Doing something about this could wait...he needed food and he needed it now.

No! That was this body talking. He had to do something now before he lost himself! But then again, that food smelled so tempting...it was enough to make his mouth water.

What should Sam do?
11311.title: Tg Wg slob

1132.content:
You grab Jackson by the collar and drag him with you out the door as you start chasing the man in the cloak, trying to be as secretive as possible. Jackson instinctively follows behind you.

The figure leads the two of you into a dark alleyway where he seems to be meeting up with a couple of others. You pull Jackson behind a dumpster as you both listen in on their conversation.

"Did you get it?" One of the men says with a thick Japanese accent.
"Of course I did, Yamada!" Responds a second man. This person sounds Australian.
A third fellow chimes in. "That device is key, but we need to know more. Once we have enough information, we'll be able to overthrow this pathetic country. Hand it over, Blake."
"Why should I, Reginald?"
Reginald calls out for Yamada to grab hold of Blake.
"I didn't come all the way from Australia for this!" cries Blake as he audibly struggles.

Jackson turns to you, his face has fear plastered on it. "This doesn't sound like something we should get wrapped up in."
"Well," you start, "we can't easily escape right now."

Then, you hear silence. The three men walk over to where you're hiding.

"Looks like we've caught ourselves some spies," Blake smiles. You're trapped. There's nothing you can do. Jackson grabs you and screams, "Why'd you have to drag me in to this?" You're frozen. You just stare up at fate.

"Kill them!" Yamada shouts.

"I've got a better idea..." Blake pulls out the mysterious device you saw earlier, turns a knob, and zaps you and Jackson with it.
1132.title: Follow him and drag Jackson with you

11321.content:
You wake up on your dorm bed, relieved to find yourself still alive. You stand up slowly, not surprised to find an ache in your back. You begin a check for your vitals. You first check your pulse: normal. You then check to make sure you've got all your ligaments: you do. Afterwards, you check to see if you can still experience all your senses. You can see. You touch the bed, and find that you can still feel. You clap your hands and hear it. You open the window and smell the air outside. Finally, you reach into your pocket, pull out some gum, put it in your mouth, and discover that you CAN still taste.

"That's a relief," you think aloud. Hold on: your voice sounds different. It's higher. You walk into the bathroom and look in the mirror to see a fifteen-year-old JAPANESE GIRL?

You've got everything: the long hair, the voice, the boobs, EVERYTHING. You wake Jackson up, and he, too, is a full fledged female.
11321.title: Wake up

choices: A girl in a maid costume
12.content:
It was a nice Saturday so far in Tokyo, though Penn Madson wondered if it was worth having to constantly look over his younger brother, Brad. The two tourists were currently on their own, having just left their hotel room.

“So, what can we go see, big bro?!” Brad smiled up at his brother. “I don’t want to miss anything!”

“I’m sure you don’t.” smiled Penn.

They had come here to Tokyo on a family vacation, though it was really more of a celebration of their parents’ anniversary. At the current moment, their parents had decided to go out on a little romantic stroll, leaving the two boys by themselves to do whatever they should please. Normally, Penn would rather just rest at the hotel, but his parents urged them both to get out for some air.

Well, in any case, Penn managed to acquire a map he could finally read, given his less than fluent Japanese. Turns out being an anime fan didn’t exactly count as preparation. Still, he had done his research into the many attractions within Tokyo. There was the Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden, or even the Imperial Palace for a slice of history. That wasn’t even to mention the Asakusa and the Senso-ji Temple. There was no shortage of places to see!

Unfortunately, Penn couldn’t access most of them, considering they would probably need a car to get to and they just had their own two feet. They needed something closeby. Right now, they were near a big park, simply enjoying the sights and seeing all the children play around with their parents.

“Okay, what else is there…..” Penn mused to himself as he inspected his map for nearby attractions. As he did though, Brad was suddenly pulling at his brother’s sleeve, causing him to look over at him.

What does Brad see?
12.title: A Tale of Two Brothers

121.content:
“Hey, where does that go?” Brad asked as he pointed to a trail through the trees nearby. Penn looked at it himself before looking back at the map, trying to see if the trail was there. To his slight surprise, there wasn’t any evidence of such a trail existing.

“Huh, that’s strange. There isn’t anything,” Penn noted curiously, which only seemed to brighten Brad’s face even more.

“Oooh, then we get to explore!” Brad cried, his interest peaked now more than any other point in their trip. He then suddenly sprinted down to the trail through the bushes. “Last one to the end is a rotten egg!”

“Brad! Dang it!” Penn cried as he ran after Brad, against his better judgment in all honesty. That boy could be a real pain when he tried, which he always seemed to.

The good news was that it was pretty early in the day, so at least the path and everything that made it up was not all that hard to see. Still, they were still straying farther and farther from civilization, judging by the more unkempt the trail gradually became. However, as Penn made his way through, he began to see a structure just beyond the trees. Brad’s laughter began to die down a bit as he simply stood near the end of the trail, allowing Penn to quickly catch up to him finally.

“Got you!” Penn cried out as he grabbed his younger brother. “Don’t you ever do that again! Do you realize how Mom and Dad would have felt if you got hurt?!”

He ended up saying that a bit more harshly than intended, which was apparent in Brad’s rather hurt expression. Penn could only sigh. “Look, I’m sorry I yelled...just, please try to be more careful, okay?” he asked as nicely as he could. Brad’s face brightened just a bit.

“I’ll try to. Sorry, bro….” Brad sincerely apologized.

“Apology accepted!” Penn smiled a bit, letting the issue pass. He then looked back up at his surroundings and observed them. “What is this?”
121.title: A mountain trail

1211.content:
Upon first glance, it looked like an old Japanese dwelling, with an older house and what seemed to be a small shrine of some kind. The house had it’s front door wide open, though Penn supposed that even if anyone lived there, they didn’t have much for burglars to steal or anything. There was a little fountain like he had seen in some anime, complete with little statues around it. All in all, was the quintessential Japanese setting.

“Bro, can I just have a look around?” Brad asked his older brother in all eagerness. “I won’t go far. I promise!”

Penn had many good reasons to turn him down, but they had already gone out this far. What was the harm in exploring further? “Okay, you can look...but stay within earshot, alright?”

“Yes, sir!” the boy responded with a mock salute, before laughing as he jogged through the little trails.

With a sigh, Penn decided to walk through at his own pace. With the sound of the little fountain nearby, the entire place seemed quaint and peaceful, it not a bit eery. Penn almost felt like something could pop out at him if he so much as touched anything. In all honesty, he was starting to wonder if he should even be here.

“Then again, I don’t think anyone is owning this place. They’re doing a crappy job if they are,” he smirked to himself in an effort to calm himself down.

In any case, he passed by the house, opening the door on the other side. Nothing within the house stood out too much besides the dust. However, upon further inspection, there was a little something that stood out.

“Hmm? What’s this?”

If this was part of the shrine, it was pretty small. There seemed to be a number of blocks scattered around the little area. As Penn got closer though, these blocks actually seemed to have some kind of Japanese runic characters. At least, that’s what he guessed.

“Did they play building blocks in ancient Japan?” he chuckled to himself.

Still, he couldn’t help but look them over even more. There were about a dozen of them in all, though he obviously couldn’t understand what they actually meant. As he was holding them in his hands though, he couldn’t help but feel a strange feeling, like….well, he couldn’t describe it honestly. When he looked in front of him, there seemed to be an indention in the little shrine, probably just enough for these 12 blocks.

“I feel like every movie I’ve ever watched is telling me to not do it,” Penn mused with a half-smile, not sure if he was being ironic or just tempting fate even more.

Then again, since when did anyone turn down whatever stupid thing they were doing in movies? With a shrug, Penn kind of messed around with the blocks. Boy, would Brad ever give him some flak if he saw him playing around like this. Testing out his theory about the blocks fitting into the shrine indention, he carefully placed them into the appropriate looking places, until all 12 of them were nearly fitted inside.

“And now we have….something!” Penn said dramatically like he was trying to look smart, and failing. Nothing seemed to happen, as if Penn was expecting something like in anime.

“....What am I doing?” he slapped his forehead. “What was I expec…..”

Just as he said that though, the runes on the little shrine began to glow, shining brighter each second before there was a burst of light! Penn cried out a bit as the light blinded him completely. He wasn’t sure what was going on and frankly, he wasn’t sure he wanted to find out.
1211.title: An abandoned shrine

12111.content:
The flash lasted for a few seconds before Penn could start to see the outline of trees and the little shrine coming back into his vision. However, just as they were about to register, there was something else! It looked like...a little girl, dressed in traditional Japanese clothing with long dark hair, skin as pale as light.

“What are you doing….here?” Penn squeaked out at the very end. At first, he just assumed it was just a normal girl, until he found out that he could somehow see the shrine behind her translucent body.

“What am I doing here?” the girl asks with an inquisitive look before simply giggling to herself. “Silly stranger, this is my land that you have treaded upon.” The girl then began to spin around while flying up to Penn’s face, before putting her fist on her hips in a typical commanding pose, albeit a much more adorable one.

“MY NAME IS SENGEN, THE PROTECTOR OF THIS MOUNTAIN!” she proclaimed with an authoritative tone that greatly conflicted with her squeaky little voice. “YOU HAVE MESSED WITH MY SACRED ORNAMENTS! PREPARE TO DIE!”

As squeaky as the voice was, Penn’s face was still pale. Was this a real ghost? Or was it a spirit? Was there a difference? Well, whatever it was, Penn hastily took a couple steps backwards, which only succeeded in him falling on his rear-end.

“I-I was just messing around!” he cried out. “A-As you might tell, I-I’m kind of not from around here!”

Sengen only stared down at the heretical tourist with a look of great anger. Then, she immediately went into hysterics, floating all around as she lost control of her laughter.

“HAHAHAHAHAHAHA!” she laughed and laughed before finally manage to compose herself just a little. “You really thought I was going to smite you, didn’t you? Oh, that’s adorable~! But you should already know that us spirits cannot cause death. We can only create life.”

Penn seemed to be able to get his breathing under control once he was at least convinced enough that she wasn’t going to kill him.

“Well...that kind of depends honestly...” he finally managed to say. “Some people might believe that spirits could do just about anything, be it life or death. Not to mention….you’re kind of the first spirit I’ve ever met.”

Once Penn finally got to his feet and dusted the dirt off of his jeans, he looked up at Sengen. “So...have you always lived here?”

“Still do, always will,” Sengen responded simply with a small smile. “Still, nobody’s ever had the smarts, or at least the attention span, to put those blocks in the right places before you. So…” She raises the the sleeves of her translucent robe, causing physical confetti to shoot out of it, with accompanying sound effect.

“Congratulations!” the girl cheers with a large grin. “You, uh…” She looks down at the boy. “What’s your name again?”

“Uh, Penn. Penn Madson,” he replied after smiling at the confetti effect. How anime. “And are you saying those blocks had a point to them? I didn’t know what I was doing half the time. Not like I could read them. In case you couldn’t tell, I’m not exactly from Japan.” He gave off a small smile.

“There wasn’t really a point, so much as it was a little game,” the spirit explained with a small giggle. “See, I get bored, so I like to give mortals the easiest challenge possible and just wait and see how long it takes them to accomplish it. Then, whoever accomplishes it gets three wishes!”

“So….this means I’m the first to ever get these wishes?” Penn asked with a raised eyebrow. Was this girl a genie now?

“No, you’re number eleven, honestly,” Sengen responded with a giggle. “But still, pretty cool, pretty cool! I’d be impressed if I were mortal!” She then swooped down to the ground and sat with her legs crossed. “So? Got a wish?”
12111.title: A strange girl appears

121111.content:
“You’re awfully casual about this,” Penn smiled in spite of saying that.

To be honest, he wasn’t entirely sure about believing this girl. Sure, he was pretty confident in her story of being a spirit, but wishing was quite out there. Heck, if he were to say, it would be like divulging his inner insecurities as well. Like one in particular….

“Well...I’d kind of...like a….girlfriend,” Penn said as his face went redder than a tomato. One of the more well-known things about Penn was his complete inability to get a girlfriend. It was really odd too, as he was a really nice, if not a bit quiet, guy.

“I’m sorry, what was that?” Sengen asked with an amused smirk while leaning in even closer to Penn. “I’m afraid your wish must be in the form of a wish!”

And now his face was a brand new shade of red, or purple at this point. Was this girl a spirit or a game show host?

“I wish for a girlfriend! THERE!” he practically bellowed, taking deep breaths as he looked at the little girl.

Sengen could only grin at the teenage boy before playfully patting him on the head. “There, there. That’s all I need to hear.” She then propelled herself into the air again, twirling all about as she did so. “So...is that it? I prefer to do at least two wishes simultaneously. Makes the game go by faster. Lots of people tend to wait years before making their second one.”

“I...guess that’s a good point,” Penn nodded when he calmed down. Getting patted on the head like a little boy urked him a bit, but at least she didn’t laugh at him like some girls did back at school. “Um…..”
121111.title: Penn wishes for a girlfriend

1211111.content:
In all honesty, what else could he wish for? He didn’t want to spend it on stuff like more manga or video games. That’d be pretty dumb to waste a once-in-a-lifetime wish. As he tried thinking harder, his thoughts eventually went to Brad. He had hoped that Brad was following his word and not going too far off, but what were the odds of that. Oh well.

But then he had a thought. Brad wasn’t as knowledgeable when it came to Japanese culture as he was. Okay, he didn’t know a lot either, but he would have liked Brad to share at least some of his interest.

“Well….” he looked at Sengen again. “I wish that my brother, Brad, could come to appreciate your culture as much as I do.”

“Oh~?” Sengen coos with a surprised, but nonetheless intrigued look. “A selfless wish for the education of another! Such a rare wish! So rare, in fact, that I shall grant it immediately!” She then looked back down at Penn with a large smile. “I shall return soon enough, Mr. Girlfriend! For now, I must teach!”

And after that, she just blipped out of existence. There was no evidence that she even existed after she disappeared.

“Wow….just like that,” Penn stared at the little shrine. It suddenly felt so empty with the little ball of energy not present.

He did wonder what she was really talking about. Was something like that really going to happen? Well, the fact that he actually met a spirit at all served to prove the fact that anything could be possible.
1211111.title: A wish about Brad

12111111.content:
Meanwhile, Brad was on his lonesome, exploring around the area. Out of curiosity, he was following the little creek that started at the fountain from the dwelling, trying to see where it went.

“That’s pretty cool,” he smiled.

Before he could admire the creek any further, however, Sengen, now looking to be a regular, solid Japanese girl, suddenly pops out of the water. She then looked over at Brad and gave him a large grin.

“Oh, heya!” she cheered before swimming closer to the shore.

“WOAH!” Brad cried as he stumbled backwards on his butt. “I didn’t know there were other people here besides me and Penn. Do you need help?” he asked while extending his hand out.

“Nah, I’m fine, thanks,” the girl giggled as she began to stand up out of the water. “I think you might need some help, though. You must be really imbalanced to just fall on your butt like that!”

“Well, I was surprised!” Brad retorted, though he chuckled a bit as well. “I didn’t expect to find a girl all the way out here. Do your Mom and Dad know you’re here? I know that my big bro always gets stern when I run off.” he added with a slight forlorn look.

“Eh, they don’t really care,” Sengen said with a shrug as she simply stood there, dripping wet. “My parents don’t really care about what I do. Never had for hundreds of years!”

Brad’s eyes widened just a bit, before they went back to normal levels and he just smiled. Maybe she was playing a game! He liked to imagine cool stuff too after all!

“So you just play whatever you want?” Brad chuckled a bit. “That’s pretty cool. You live here as well?”

“Eh, you could say that,” Sengen responded with a small giggle. “Then again, I live everywhere I go. I’m like a...traveler, if you will. An eternal tourist.”

“Wow, that’s pretty cool!” Brad smiled. “Is that why your English is very good? I’ve never seen a Japanese girl who talked as well as you. Not many can fully understand my brother and I here.”

“Well, I guess that’s a good enough explanation, yes,” Sengen answered with a smile of her own. “Though, I couldn't help but notice how...confused you seem by everything out here. Obviously, you have an interest in the stuff, but you can’t really understand the culture behind it, can you?”

Brad’s face looked a little less bright at those words. “Yeah...my brother kind of says the same thing. I don’t think I’m really all that smart when it comes to this stuff. Penn doesn’t seem to like it when I say that though. He says that I “shouldn’t limit myself” or something,” he added in air quotes.

The girl simply nodded at the boy’s words. “I see...well!” She began to walk around Brad with a childish smile on her face. “What if I told you that I could help you connect with the culture a bit more?”

Brad raised an eyebrow, but he was curious nonetheless. “Can you really? I mean, if I could somehow learn all this better, that would be great.” he added with a smile.

“Awesome~!” Segen cheered while suddenly taking Brad’s hands. “All I gotta do is recite the ancient incantation and you’ll be right on your way to knowing even more about Japan than your knowitall brother!”

“O-Oh, okay!” Brad smiled back, his hands limp in Sengen’s. He wasn’t quite sure what she was up to, but he was kind of liking this game of hers.

“Okay then, just hold on!” Sengen then closes her eyes and begins to recite an ancient tome. “このアジアの若いアメリカ人の男の子を作ろう！”

Brad suddenly felt like something entered his hands briefly, making them wiggle just a bit. Before he could think about it though, the feeling was already gone, like it was never there to begin with. Oddly enough though, just before the feeling faded, his face had felt a small sensation, like it was being gently pulled at. He looked at the wide smile on Sengen’s face. She seemed to be absolutely beaming, like she just did the happiest thing she ever did, which might not have been far from the truth.

“Look in the water,” was all she told him before suddenly letting go of the boy’s hands and running back into the creek she had appeared from.
12111111.title: Following Brad

121111111.content:
“Huh? W-Wait!” Brad cried as he reached out to her, running up to the edge of the creek but not walking in. He looked at her expectant face, as if urging him even more to look down. Oddly, he felt hesitant, but he found himself slowly looking down into the flowing water.

To the boy’s great surprise, he saw that not only was his blond locks now pitch black, but his eyes were...different. They were slanted, like he recalled one of his friends at school having. There was a word for the type of people with eyes like this, he just couldn’t quite put his finger on it…

Sengen suddenly popped out of the water, appearing right in front of Brad’s face. “Enjoying being Asian?!”

“Ah!” Brad cried out, though he didn’t fall over this time. It was a combination of Sengen appearing again as well as finding that word he was looking for. “Asian?! I-Is this real?!”

“Yep!” she cheered. “Told ya it’d work! Now you’re more Japanese than ever.”

Brad was absolutely stupefied. Even as he looked over himself, seeing the face, dark hair, the slightly different skin tone, it was hard to accept it as real. The girl in front of him seemed to be enjoying it a lot, though. Brad then got to thinking. Whether this was all fake or not, perhaps this was the chance he was waiting for to show Penn that he could learn about Japanese culture just as well as him.

“This..is pretty awesome,” Brad said as he cracked a smile. “You’re pretty talented!”

“Why, thank you,” Sengen responded with a proud bow. “I’m rather happy with the results myself. Heck, I even changed reality so that you’ve always been like this!”

Brad honestly didn’t get that last part, but he figured it wasn't worth worrying over. After all, it was all part of the game from what he could tell. Still, he was growing rather curious about her constantly going in the water.

“You know, my Mom said you could catch a cold if you stay in the water too long,” he told the girl.

“Eh, I’ll be fine,” Sengen insisted with a small giggle. “How about you go find your brother, though? Maybe show him your new understanding of Japanese culture?”

“Yeah, sure!” Brad smiled, quickly turning to try and find Penn again, before looking back at Sengen. “You coming along?”

“Uh...no thank you,” the girl declined with a nervous smile. “I...I don’t do that good around older boys. Don’t even tell him you found me, okay?”

“Uh, okay. Well, thank you mystery girl!” It took saying that for Brad to realize that he actually never got her name, but he was already running off back in the direction he thought he came from. Oh well, he could ask the next time he ran into her.

Still, he couldn’t help but hear an odd giggle in the wind as he ran back.
121111111.title: He looks in the water

1211111111.content:
Penn was pacing back and forth around the dwelling right now, just casually enjoying the sights. There was no whiff or sound of Sengen following that little event, making Penn somewhat question if it was real or not. Then again, he felt confident that it was real. He couldn’t have made that up. Still, it would have been nice if the little spirit girl actually told him something about what was going on.

“Well whatever,” Penn shrugged as he continued to look at the surroundings and the house. There wasn’t too much else left to see though, as the house was pretty empty aside from a few things covered in dust. “I kind of wonder if that girl lived here when she was alive.”

“Hey, bro!” Brad suddenly called out to Penn as he came back into his view. He then began to rush over to his brother at breakneck speed, catching up to him in no time. “What’s up?”

Penn took one look at Brad, causing his eyes to open in utter shock when he saw his brother. Wait, was that his brother? The attitude was the same, but the appearance?....Not even close!

“Is...something wrong, Penn?” Brad asked while looking up to his brother with a large smirk on his face. Looks like he was just now noticing his change in appearance. “You’re acting like you’ve never seen me before.”

Penn shook his head a bit after seeing Brad, just to get his head on straight. Looking at Brad seemed to be bringing up some new thoughts, which seemed to be making more sense to Penn by the second.

“It’s nothing,” Penn shook his head just a bit more. “Just didn’t expect to see you running so fast.” he added with a smile.

“Wait…” Brad’s smile began to droop. “Nothing? That’s it? Aren’t you going to ask about my face or my hair or anything?!” He just didn’t get it. A second ago, Penn looked downright flabbergasted at his brother’s new look. Then, all of a sudden...it just looks normal to him?!

“Well, I wasn’t sure from a distance,” Penn shrugged a bit. “But I don’t think I could mistake that face for anything.”

In all honesty, Penn did feel some confusion, but the more he tried to think about it, the more his mind said that nothing was wrong. Well, whatever the case was, he could figure that out some other time.

Brad could only glare at his older brother while folding his arms. “You’re messing with me, aren’t you? Trying to act like nothing’s weird. Or do you just not know who I really am?”

“Sure I know, Soma.” Penn said with a straight face. “What else is there that’s weird? I thought you said you were going to wow me with what you know of this place or something.” he added with a smile and shrug.

“So...ma…?” the little boy asked in total confusion. What was Penn calling him now?!

“Why are you calling me Soma?!” he suddenly shouted at him. “Is that some sort of Japanese insult?!”

Penn raised an eyebrow at him. “Uh, no it’s not an insult. That’s your name, right? I mean, I get that I’m just looking after you for your parents, but I surely wouldn’t forget your name.”

‘Looking after me for my-’ Soma’s eyes almost popped out of his head as he realized what was just happening. That mystery girl mentioned something about changing reality so that he was always like this. So that meant...he wasn’t even Brad anymore! He must be this...Soma guy!

“Quick, what’s my last name?!” he suddenly asked up to Penn.

“Um….” Penn put his hand to his head to remember. “It was...Akiyama, I believe. Pretty sure that’s it.” he nodded in confirmation, as if he was confirming that to himself as well. “You okay? You’re not usually this pale.”
“I...I’m fine,” Soma responded with a nervous smile. “I...I just gotta...go look around some more, ya know? See some more of my heritage?”

“That’s a good idea,” Penn smiled. “I know you wanted to learn more about it earlier, especially when we found out about this place.”

“Y-Yeah,” the boy responded with a nervous look before looking back over in the direction of the creek. “Why don’t you just...go on ahead. I’ll catch up to you at….place.”

Penn seemed a bit unsure at Soma’s behavior, but he nodded after a second. “Okay, that’s cool with me if you want to have a little time alone. Just make sure you take care to not go too far.” he added with a smile before starting to walk around a bit. He supposed that he might as well see more around the area if there was more than just the house and shrine.
1211111111.title: He finds his brother

12111111111.content:
Soma walked through the familiar path down the creek. It was funny how everything seemed familiar after just walking by it once or twice, but he was not in the mood for amusement right now. His own brother thought of him as someone completely different now. Up until that point, he had thought of it all as just a game.

But as he just learned, it was not a game. He really was actually Japanese, with even a new name to match. What did that mystery girl do to him? Was she still around? These were legitimate questions. Well, there was only one way to find out and after another minute or so, he was near that familiar opening to the creek.

“Um...mystery girl?!” he called out. “Are you still here?!”

There was a sudden rustling in a nearby tree, before Sengen suddenly popped out onto one of the branches. “Oh, hey, uh...you!” She giggled to herself a bit. “I don’t believe you ever told me your name.”

“Well, it WAS Brad! Brad Madson!” he said a bit more fiercely than intended. “But apparently it’s now Soma Akiyama or something odd like that!”

“Oh!” Sengen suddenly cheered with an awfully joyful look on her face. “So then my spell worked then! You are now 100% authentically Japanese! Congratulations!” She lifted her sleeve and let loose another batch of confetti.

“What’s with the confetti?” Soma said to himself before shaking his head. “A-Anyway, is this really alright? I-I mean, my brother doesn’t even think I’m his brother.”

“Well, why would your American brother have a Japanese brother?” the girl asked quizzically while leaning her back against the tree and slumping down on her branch. “That’d just be crazy.”

“Well….I guess that’s true,” Soma shook his head side to side a bit. “But now he seems to think of me as some kid he’s just looking after. And by the way, who are you anyway, mystery girl?”

“Oh, me?” she asked with a large smirk before suddenly jumping off of her branch. The girl began to plummet to the ground, before stopping just five feet above it and slowly floating down the rest of the way. “My name is Sengen. And I am a spirit.”

In other cases, Soma would be more surprised, but given what had happened to him so far, it didn’t seem all that weird at all. A stark difference compared to Penn’s first reaction.

“Well..um, Sengen…” Soma said a bit bashfully. “So..is this really supposed to help me learn better? I..don’t really feel all that different aside from my looks.”

“Oh, really?” Sengen asked with a curious look before putting her finger to her chin in thought. “Maybe I didn’t think this through entirely. Maybe I just needed to change your mind some!” She then excitedly turns over to Soma. “What if I made you think like a Japanese kid?!”

Soma was intrigued at least. “You think big bro...er, I guess Penn, would like that? He..really seemed to like the idea of me knowing a lot.”

“I’m sure he would like that,” Sengen responded with a soft smile. “But ultimately, it’s not his decision. It’s yours. I can only make you believe yourself to be Soma Akiyama if you give me permission.”
12111111111.title: Follow Soma

121111111111.content:
Soma tried to give it some thought. He did admit that he was a bit more interested in this. Perhaps if he was really good at this, then maybe Penn would be more impressed. Besides, against his better judgment honestly, it still sounded fun.

“Okay, I’ll do it!” Soma smiled. “Work your magic.”

“Okay then,” the spirit girl said with a quick nod and a large smile before placing her hand on Soma’s forehead. Soon enough, said hand begins to glow with a beautiful, ethereal light. “彼がでなければならない人にこの少年を作ろう！”

As Soma looked at the glowing hand on his forehead, his eyes suddenly widened, his rush rushing with all sorts of new information! New memories poured into his head, ones of a young boy hailing from Japan, only to move over to America, and finally return back to his home country with an older friend of his named Penn and his family. He could remember his past as Brad, but it all seemed much less clear and altogether unimportant at the moment. Right now, he was the one and only Soma Akiyama, and there wasn’t anybody else he’d rather be.

“Wow!” he cried out, partly in surprise and partly in glee. “That was actually really cool! Thanks, Sengen!”

“No prob, Bob,” Sengen giggled before picking up a small blade of grass. With one swift motion, the girl turned the grass into a small scroll with a message written in Japanese, which she then handed over to Soma. “Go ahead. Tell me what it says.”

Soma grabbed it, opening up the scroll. “Um….あなたはオタクです.....I am NOT a geek!” he cried out, feeling like he wanted to throw the thing at her before it dawned on him. “Hey, I read that perfectly!”

“Yep!” the spirit cheered before beginning to float in the air. “Congratulations, Soma, on your new life!”

“Yeah, thanks Sengen!” Soma cheered before turning. “Well, I should probably see how he’s doing again. You know, you should come. I’d love to see Penn’s reaction.”

“Nah, I’ll just watch from the shadows,” Sengen said with a large grin. “Though, you know what’d really be awesome? If you and Penn happened to be the same age! Then he’d probably be a bit more interested in what you have to say.”
121111111111.title: He gives permission

1211111111111.content:
Well, there was a bit of truth to that. Being a little kid did come with people thinking that you were cute when you trying to be smart. Not that Penn was like that, but he was curious. Heck, it was probably better then him being his babysitter of all things.

“That’s a good idea,” Soma nodded. “Does that mean you’re doing the lines again?” he added with a smile.

“Yep!” Sengen answered with a large grin before touching Soma’s forehead. “Well, here goes nothing then~! この少年時代の17年を作ろう！”

Once again, Soma felt a surge go through him. Except, instead of his mind, this one went through his body, causing a considerable amount of discomfort as he wrapped his arms around his body a bit, groaning as the pressure inside builded. Through his partially-closed eyes, he could see the ground slowly getting further away from him, all of his limbs growing considerably as puberty took place on him.

“Ugh...grr..” he grunted as the changes continued, his body still growing out until he mostly resembled Penn’s age of 17. And when the changes started to calm down, he was left sweating and taking deep breaths.

“Sorry if that got a little extreme,” Sengen said with a nervous smile while scratching the back of her head. “But if it’s any consolation, you look like a total hunk! I mean, look at yourself!” She touched the trunk of the tree, turning a small part of it into a full body mirror for her newly grown acquaintance.

Feeling good enough to get on his feet, Soma walked closer to the tree mirror, getting a good look. He gasped just a bit, seeing a much more mature version of what he looked like before. Looking over himself, his t-shirt and shorts simply grew with him, so no ripping.

“Wow….I didn’t think I’d get to see something like this for years,” Soma actually chuckled just a bit in spite of it all. “You know, it’s funny that you seem to have taken a huge interest in me of all people.”

“Well, you just seemed like an interesting kid,” the girl responded half-truthfully. “Besides, I really like helping you and that Penn guy become closer. It warms my heart!”

“You seem to really know him too,” Soma noted, but he shook his head. “Well, whatever the case, I can’t wait to see what he thinks now.”

“Then go on!” Sengen insisted with a large grin. “You know where to find me!”

Soma turned again, taking a few more steps to get used to the new longer stride of his legs. He looked back at Sengen again, all bouncing around as she always did. He kind of wished she would actually come long, but perhaps she didn’t want to. Oh well, perhaps he could convince her if he ever came by her again.
1211111111111.title: Soma agrees

12111111111111.content:
In the meantime, Penn had finally found another place to look at. Just a ways northeast of the dwelling was a little garden. Of course, it wasn’t food or anything, just a wide variety of native fauna. There were quite a few flowers he saw that were native only to Japan, like the Yellow Chrysanthemum and the Japanese Apricot. He had heard about these online, but it was amazing to see them up close and personal like this, even for someone like him who wasn’t the most outdoors kind of guy.

“These are pretty beautiful,” he smiled to himself as he looked through, trying not to crush any of the flowers. Heck, if Sengen looked over all of these, he doubted she would take kindly to flower trampling.

Eventually though, when he happened to turn around, he could see a figure emerging from about 30 yards away or so. “Ah, Soma! Over here!” he waved.

“Hey, man!” Soma called out while running over next to Penn. “Are you just looking at flowers right now?”

“Yeah,” Penn shrugged a bit but smiled all the same. “I was trying to see if there was anything else to the area and just found this place. Flowers aren’t usually my thing, but I have to admit that these look pretty nice. What do you think?”

“They’re pretty cool, I guess,” Soma responded while looking down at them as well. He still couldn’t get over how tall he was now! Still, he didn’t seem nearly as excited about the flowers as Penn. Still, he could understand how his friend may be intrigued by Japan’s exclusive assortment of plants.

“You know, my mother used to love Yellow Chrysanthemums,” Somo suddenly said as he started to reminisce about parents he had not even know had existed until gaining his new memories. “My dad gave one to her on their first date and he’s given her a new one on their anniversary each year. Even if he had to import them from America!”

“Wow, that’s pretty cool actually,” Penn smiled. “It’s cool that your dad actually went that far for such a thing. Guess it helps put things in perspective.”

“What do you mean by that?” Somo asked. Also, was Penn...philosophizing with him? Wait a minute...he knew what philosophizing was now! Awesome!

“Just that….” Penn actually blushed a bit when trying to find the words. “How something that small could mean everything to someone like your mom. I’m not exactly poetic in any sense, but it’s very….romantic.” he finished with a hard blush, as if he was one to speak about romance.

Part of Somo really wanted to tease Penn right now, but...he really couldn’t bring himself to. Ironically, becoming nothing more than a friend of Penn made him feel even more brotherly towards him, so when it came time to react, he could only pat his friend on the shoulder.

“Don’t feel embarrassed,” Somo told his friend with a small smile. “I get what you are saying. And yes, I suppose it is rather romantic. Sounds like my dad was just as much of a helpless romantic as you.” Truth be told, he still couldn’t resist some teasing. “But...maybe his method could work for you as well!”

“Heh heh heh!” Penn chuckled to himself, albeit with a bit of spite. “I’d need to find a girl first to do that. You know, one I can actually talk to without stuttering like an idiot.”

His words did bring up a tiny speck in his mind though, like something from the very deep parts of his mind. Like...he actually already talked to someone about his girl problems? Maybe even wished for help? Nah, that sounded kind of silly to be completely honest. Still, it was a thought.

“Well, luckily, you’re in Japan,” Soma noted with a chuckle. “Home to plenty of beautiful girls. All you have to do is find the right one, right?”

“Yeah, I guess so,” Penn chuckled again, feeling a bit better. “What’s better than Japanese girls after all?”

“That’s what I’m saying!” Soma responded with a good laugh. Funny how before all of this, he could care less about girls, much less of their ethnicity. Now, however, he had a pretty good idea of just why Penn loved them so much.

“So, what do you say?” he asked while picking a Chrysanthemum from the ground and handing it over to Penn. “How about you give this to the first Japanese girl you see and watch what happens?”

“Well, it’s not the worst thing that can happen,” Penn smiled as he took it. “Hopefully it doesn’t wilt before it finds a taker.” he added with a little chuckle. With that, he began walking off again, keeping the Chrysanthemum firmly in his hand. There was at least one more area in the vicinity that he hadn’t looked at yet.

“So!” Soma clapped his hands together. “Where to next, Mr. Tourist?”

“I think I want to head north,” Penn answered as he turned his head. “I think that’s probably the one place nearby that I haven’t really looked. Maybe there’s something there, too.”

“Well, only one way to find out,” Soma said with a small grin. “Let’s get going so we can head back to civilization.”

“True,” Penn nodded. “I think I’ve lost track of how long we’ve actually been in this property.
12111111111111.title: He finds Penn

121111111111112.content:
Soma followed closely behind Penn, taking in the scenery as they walked. He was really enjoying this so far. He and Penn had never talked like this before, and it was a lot of fun. Perhaps this was all for the better after all.

Eventually, with some more walking through bushes, Soma looked to see an indention in the mountainside. Looked like a cave from where he was standing. Huh, he didn’t know there was one here. He wondered if it was connected to this shrine as well. Penn seemed to think so, given how he slightly picked up his pace when he noticed it, leaving Soma further behind.

“Wait! Penn! Oh, come on!” Soma cried but Penn was already ahead by quite a bit. “Sheesh, was I like that when I ran off?”

“Problem keeping up?” Sengen suddenly chirps behind Soma while grabbing the boy’s shoulders.

“Woah!” Soma cried out with a slight stumble, eventually looking back at the floating girl. “You really like to do that, huh?”

“Kinda,” the spirit admitted with a small giggle. “I just couldn’t help but overhear your little chat. I never knew you two were such...romantics!” She gave a large smirk at Somo while beginning to float in the air again.

Soma blushed slightly at the remark of her listening in like that. “Well….I guess that’s true. Guess I know a lot more than I thought now. Still...it did feel kind of nice. Penn’s always been a great guy, if not a bit unlucky.”

“Yeah, it’s a crying shame,” Sengen agreed while shaking her head. “Then again, such is par the course for many a dogged nice guy. Not every girl can be as accepting of him as you.”

“Well….you’d think there would be at least one girl,” Soma shrugged. “I guess that’s why I’m hoping his luck changes, especially with that flower. Hopefully it’ll be a good luck charm or something.” he added with a little laugh.

“I doubt any girl he knows will understand just how much a flower like that means,” Sengen responded with a slightly sad smile. “Truth be told, I think only you would. Too bad you’re not a girl, though.”

Soma would normally just laugh something like that off, but he knew this was a girl that could apparently do just about whatever she wanted. He looked at Sengen with a somewhat off look.

“I suppose...that’s true in an odd way,” he said to her. “But..I don’t know if I can go that far. I mean, it’s probably odd saying that because I’ve already gone from a little American boy to a Japanese teenager...but a girl is really out there.”

“Is it?” Sengen asked with a small smirk. “Is it really? Imagine Penn’s surprise when he finds a beautiful Japanese girl hanging out in this supposed secret valley, one who actually understands him like none other could.” She gave off a soft smile. “I bet that’d just make his day.”

“Well, I have no doubt he would, and if he was happy, I certainly would be too,” Soma said while taking a step back. “But...me of all people?”

“What do you mean?” Sengen asked curiously. “Why not you? You seem like the perfect candidate. You said it yourself: if he’s happy, you’d be happy, right?”

“I……” Soma found himself almost at a total loss for words. “I...did say that didn’t I?....But I really don’t know if I can be someone like that, even with you around.”

“Someone like what?” the spirit asked while tilting her head.

“You know….a girl perfect for Penn,” Soma said, his face now completely red. What did he know about girls and romance anyway?

“But you understand how he feels, right?” Sengen asked with a weak smile. “The way no other person on earth does?”

“Y-Yes I do!” Soma acted a bit defensively. “Y-You’re right about one thing. No one knows him better than me!” he said, his face probably even redder. After a second, he couldn’t help but feel like he just got goated into admitting how he felt, judging by the cheshire grin on Sengen’s face.

“Well, you said it, not me,” was all the spirit had to say before dropping to the ground and smiling over at Soma. “You know what? How about just a trial? You can go into the cave your friend just walked into as a girl and, once you come out, I’ll let you decide about whether or not you’d want to change back. Sound fair?”

Going all the way to a girl sounded more extreme than anything else so far. Yet, she was offering it as just a trial so….was there really any harm? If anything, he could easily decide to just go back to normal once it was done.
121111111111112.title: Soma is suddenly distracted

1211111111111121.content:
“Okay….I’ll play the game,” Soma gave a little sigh. “So, do your thing.”

Sengen suddenly gave a happy squeal while levitating in glee. “Oh, you won’t regret this, I promise! Just gotta say the magic words…”

With that, she took a deep breath before chanting “この少年彼の友人の夢の女の子を作ろう！” and suddenly swooping in to kiss Soma on the cheek.

Soma’s face was already red enough when Sengen actually floated over to kiss him. “Hey, was that really…..”

Suddenly, his mouth clenched shut when a new feeling surged through him. It was somewhat similar to the feeling when he became a teenage boy, yet different at the same time. He wasn’t sure what to describe it. There was pressure, but it felt like it was slowly building.

Soma wrapped his arms together and shivered as his body grew colder. As he did so, he felt his shoulders cave in, causing his arms to slowly slink down, while the arms themselves became longer, more slender, and completely devoid of his newly earned bodyhair. Something similar happened to his legs, though they became shorter rather than longer, though his calves gained some much needed tone. Just as Soma began to notice this and started to stare at his altered limbs, he noticed both his arms and his legs undergoing a simultaneous rebirth, with his hands becoming as smooth as butter as his fingers and nails grew out slightly, while his feet became smaller but no less daintier than the rest of his new ligaments.

“This is too weird…” the boy muttered to himself in the rather sweet, harmonious voice of a teenage girl raised in Osaka while feeling his tingling face. Little could he see his skull’s very structure being molded like clay as his facial features softened enough to include larger, shimmering brown eyes, thin eyebrows, and pouty lips that he could detect a small amount of lip gloss on. In the meanwhile, Soma’s short, black hair began to lighten and eventually grow out, curling slightly as it rapidly grew down to his back.

Of course, the biggest changes were yet to come. The teenager’s hips gained more than a little meat, giving him a generous curvaceous figure, while also causing his butt to inflate to a cute bubble shape. Speaking of bubbles, slowly but surely, two orbs of flesh began to slowly inflate upon the Soma’s chest, causing him to moan a little bit as he felt them grow out and become more sensitive by the second. However, all of this pailed in comparison to the next change.

“Oh~oooooh…” Soma sighed while reaching down at the crotch area. Sure enough, she felt nothing.

However, before Soma could even begin to comprehend the changes to her body, she suddenly felt wiggling from her clothes, feeling as if they were shifting along the surface of her body. Her new sensitive skin began to notice just how different her shirt and jeans were feeling. They were much softer, almost like silk. The shifting continued, with her sleeves starting flow down his arms. Unlike most normal clothes, though, the sleeves continued to lengthen, draping over his arms and hands completely. Another interesting thing was that, after that, they actually split down the middle a bit, before recrossing over each other in a robe-like fashion. Off of the top of her head, Soma wasn’t sure what was happening to them, but the continued sensation indicated that it was far from done.

Suddenly, she felt a little tightness as the hem of her shirt and jeans were coming together, any space between them beginning to disappear, going against her curves. The changes caused more as they traveled further south. Her legs were forced together a bit, the individual leggings coming closer together until they touched. From that, they began stitching together, the difference going away as Soma could soon feel her legs beginning to touch each other. This continued all the way down, until her clothes were very much robe-like.

“Why am I wearing a robe?” she asked, the obvious answer not quite coming to mind yet.

Then, with the garment looking completely shifted, Soma watched it fade completely to white, looking pretty plain. Right as that did though, a wave washed over the robe, decorating it with a fascination of colors. Flowers of pink, blue, and yellow decorated it all of the way down, with a cute strawberry on the left breast. After that, Soma felt things forming underneath, causing her to peek underneath. A pink juban seemed to form underneath, forming another layer of clothing underneath. Another feeling formed underneath as something clenched around her breasts; a bra most likely.

Of course, it still wasn’t completely done. A little flash of light appeared around her waist; a rather large obi forming out of it. The obi clenched around her waist gently, certainly much closer than anything she could have worn before, finishing with a large bow in the back. The color and design was also quite lovely; being mostly black but decorated with large blue and pink flowers. To finish it off, and cause it to be a bit more tight, a light blue obi makura belt formed over the obi, tying itself right in the front. Right underneath that as it formed, she felt something form over her groin. It didn’t take a genius to know that it was a pair of panties.

With that, the changes flowed further down to her feet. Her socks changed texture a bit, with them changing properly into tobi socks. That wasn’t much on it’s own, but it was at the same time that his shoes suddenly lost their laces and the top and sides began to fade away, showing her feet. The material softened much, with the only tops of the shoes forming a small lace. The bottoms then rose about an inch or so, adding just a bit to her height. The color was a nice combination of pink and white.

And if that wasn’t enough, Soma felt one last change on her head. Her soft brown hair suddenly moved as if by magic, doing itself up in a nice style. Topping it off was a bright yellow flower decoration on the right side of her head, tucked in neatly with her hair.

That just left Soma completely dumbfounded, garbed in an absolutely gorgeous kimono.
1211111111111121.title: He chooses yes

12111111111111211.content:
“What…..in the world?” Soma couldn’t believe what she was seeing. This was quite the stunning garment, something she certainly had never felt before. It was much tighter than anything she had worn before. “Why...why am I in a kimono?!”

“Just thought you’d look cute in it,” Sengen explained with an amused giggle while starting to circle over her new creation. “Y’know, not to toot my own horn, but...I made you freakin’ beautiful! I couldn’t imagine a single boy that’d pass you down!”

Sengen’s praise actually made Soma’s face go just a bit red. The idea of being “beautiful” wasn’t exactly something she had been used to hearing. In any case, she took a few experimental steps in the shoes, hoping to get a feel for them. Supposedly, people from the West who had never worn such a thing would feel quite “restricted” when wearing one, and she could tell that that was pretty much true.

“It’s...kind of hard to walk in,” she said after a few steps. “Though, I guess this is what you probably wore most of time?”

“Back in my time of the living, yes,” Sengen answered with a rather bittersweet smile. “Especially around festival time. Oh...my grandmother would always make me the most intricate kimonos you’d ever see.” She then looks over at Soma’s clothes with a hint of pride. “Guess I was just trying to imitate her there.”

“Sounds like a lot of fun,” Soma actually smiled a bit, which only served to show off her newly feminine face. Wow, Sengen wasn’t really joking when she called her beautiful. “What kind of festival was it? Was it around this time of year or something?”

“If I’ve been keeping up with the lunar cycles, it should be around this time,” Sengen responded with a nostalgic smile. “And it was a wonderful festival of firework and...and food! Dances! Rituals! Romance! Oh, you would have loved it.” She let out a happy sigh as she merely laid down on the grass and closed her eyes serenely.

“Wow...so this is around that time,” Soma smiled a bit. “Well, I guess it’s no wonder you picked out something like this for me.” she added, feeling just a little bit more comfortable. “Sounds like a great time.”

“Believe me, it is,” the spirit said with a large smile. “You really should go. There’s a popular legend that if you kiss someone at the same second as the first blast of fireworks, your souls will be intertwined forever.”

“That’s quite a legend,” Soma said back. “Though, I’m not sure if said festival is really around now, or if it’ll really play any role in what I’m about to do.” she said, looking back to glance at the cave’s entrance. Penn was long out of sight by now.

“Well, the first rocket was always launched at sundown,” Sengen stated with a small smile. “So...why don’t you go find your man?”

“Oh...right,” Soma nodded a bit, turning to face the cave once again. However, she had only taken one step before she just realized something. “Wait...I just thought of this...but I don’t really look like a ‘Soma’ right now.” She smiled weakly, while moving her arms a bit in the elongated sleeves.

“I suppose you’re right,” Sengen said while starting to float back up to her feet. “You look more like a...Mariko to me. Maybe that could be your name for now?”

“Mariko….” the girl said the name to herself, as if trying it out. It sounded rather nice honestly, and it wasn’t like she had a better suggestion. “Okay, I think that’s a good one. Thanks, Sengen.”

“Anytime,” the spirit said with a large grin. “I’ll catch back up with you on the other side. Just let me know how things turn out between you and lover boy in there.”

“The other side? What’s…..” Mariko started, but before she could continue, she noticed that she was talking to nothing. Sengen had apparently vanished off. “Sheesh, couldn’t even wait to let me finish? We don’t even know if I’ll even be like this at the end of it.”

Still, with a sigh, Mariko turned back towards the cave. She had come this far after all, so it was best to keep on going forward. She started making her way towards the cave, getting a bit more used to the kimono and shoes with each step. It still wasn’t really easy, but it was manageable. Eventually, she reached the cave’s entrance, looking into the pitch-blackness of it.

“Well….here goes everything,” Mariko sighed as she took her first step inside the rocky interior, beginning to make her way inside. Who knew what really awaited her at very end?
12111111111111211.title: Reaction

121111111111112111.content:
On some level, Penn honestly wondered what it was he was trying to find here. For a cave that didn’t look all that big from the outside, it almost felt like some kind of labyrinth on the inside. He was thankful for the dim light inside, but it didn’t help much.

“At least the temperature is rather nice,” he said off-hand. It wasn’t too warm or cold, so it wasn’t as bad as it could be, he supposed.

Still, he wanted to see where the cave went. He had already seen the rest of the area so the last thing he wanted to do was call it quits now. Still, the silence was more than a bit creepy. The only things Penn could hear were his steps along the gravel and the occasional drop of water somewhere. A bit frustrated, he sighed.

“Augh, will anyone just give me some dang directions?!” he cried out, actually kicking a small pebble in his way.

Just then, after he calmed himself down, he happened to catch something in the corner of his eye, Curious, he turned to his right, seeing a little luminescent crystal on the ground. It didn’t look like something he had seen in textbooks or on the Internet before, which therefore got his curiosity. It wasn’t like he had anything better to do.

“So...what is this….” he got closer to the crystal, kneeling down to get a better look at it.

It was a nice shade of light green, looking rather pretty against the cavern walls. He could almost even see himself in the reflection. However, right before he could comment on that, what he saw against the crystal’s reflection seemed to change. Raising an eyebrow, Penn looked closer. Whatever the image was looked hazy, but he caught a flash of...pink...and white? Was that what it was?

“What was that?” he asked himself, no one there to answer. His curiosity was peaked, though. It actually gave him something to think about. It seemed like an unnatural phenomenon, and things of that nature always got him a bit hyped.

*****Meanwhile*****

“Dang it, where is he?” Mariko grumbled to herself while trying to make heads or tails of the stone labyrinth. No matter where she looked or how far she traversed the accursed cavern, she still couldn’t find even a glimpse of Penn.

“Well, this is just great…” she sighed as she began kicking a rock around with her foot. It was then that a small glimmer of light reflected off of her eye, causing her to look up. To much surprise, she found...light! Indeed, there appeared to be a chasm of light around the next right, which was enough to make Mariko suddenly regain a sort of spring in her step.

So, the girl began sprinting over to the end of her cavern, careful not to trip over her sandals or kimono. She barely even registered the wall of dull crystals she passed up on her way to our potential escape. However, upon finally making the turn, Mariko was immediately met with disappointment.

Instead of a proper way out, all she was rewarded with was a wall of sparking crystals refracting light from a hole in the ceiling twenty feet above her head. Mariko gave out another large groan, before suddenly noticing something strange about the wall. The shape was rather distorted, but she still knew it from anywhere: Penn! He must have been on the other side of the crystal wall. So, in an effort to maybe get the boy’s attention and see if her friend could notice her as well, she began banging on the wall.
121111111111112111.title: Penn's POV

1211111111111121111.content:
Penn was currently looking at a wall of crystals that he happened to see along his way. He couldn’t believe it at first; seeing all of these crystals in the same place. Needless to say, it was quite stunning to look at. He couldn’t help but smile as he looked at them shimmering.

“Amazing,” he said to himself while gently smiling at the natural beauty of it all.

That being said, about a few seconds or so after he started looking at them, a distorted shape seemed to appear in the reflection of the crystals. Penn turned around, trying to see if someone was behind him, but there was no one besides him there. It was pretty peculiar. When he turned back to see the figure again, he walked a bit closer, trying not to approach it too quickly. The figure immediately reminded him of that little flash he saw in the little crystal prior back. The flash of pink and white which seemed to match what might be clothes on the figure.

“Who is that?” Penn asked himself, only to receive no answer.

As he got closer to the image, he could make out some features, though not fully. The figure looked female, and upon a closer look, he could make out beautiful brown eyes clearly belonging to a girl of Japanese heritage. What seemed to be a flower or something on her head struck him as pretty cute for her. From what he could tell, she was very cute, even if he couldn’t see her fully.

That all being said, the figure didn’t seem still. It looked like it was moving a bit, and Penn felt like her mouth was moving too. Was she trying to say something, or was he just being crazy. He got closer until his face was right up against the flat surface of the crystals, even though he couldn’t make out any new features.

“Are you trying to tell me something?” Penn asked, moving his right hand up to the crystal’s surface, touching it.

It lined up perfectly with the girl’s outstretched left hand on the surface.

*****Meanwhile*****

“Damn it, he can’t hear me…” Mariko muttered to herself while watching Penn’s mouth move and remain just as silent as before. Still...amazingly, she could see almost every feature of the boy from this crystal wall, from his shimmering brown hair to his penetrating blue eyes…

Wait, what did she just think?! The girl shook her head as if trying to regain control of her own thoughts. She figured the cave dust was finally getting to her. Still, the two still needed to meet each other despite their current physical divide. Looking to her side, Mariko noticed a long passageway that eventually took a sharp turn to the right. Maybe, just maybe, that could lead to a potential intersection for the two teenagers.

Still, since Penn obviously couldn’t hear her right now, Mariko simply pointed over to her left before looking back at Penn with an inquisitive look. Luckily, she was rather adept in body language, but it was still up to the boy on the other side to decide if her question would be interpreted correctly or not.
1211111111111121111.title: Penn sees her

12111111111111211111.content:
Penn’s inquisitive look didn’t diminish when he saw the image move again. The blurry image seemed to be moving her left side, as if maybe trying to ask him to move in that direction. He looked over to his right, trying to see if something was there. There was just another long pathway, though there was a sharp turn to the left up ahead.

“Is she telling me to go that way?” he asked himself.

He looked back at the image again. The girl seemed to be still, though he couldn’t tell what look she had on her face. It was just probably as good as he was going to see out of this crystal. Maybe something up ahead would help him out more. With that in mind, he turned from the crystal, walking down the silent corridor once again. Whatever the case was, he hoped that it was worth it.

Though...he had to admit that parts he could make out of that girl seemed to linger in his mind. What little things he saw, like her eyes, her clothes, and even her hair. He couldn’t get them out of his mind. His face was even beat red as he was thinking about it. He shook his head all the same though.

“What am I thinking?” he said to himself. For all he knew, whatever he saw might not have been real in the first place.

Still, he couldn’t help but finger the Yellow Crysthanamum in his hand. He remembered Soma’s words, to just give it to the first girl he saw and see what happens. He chuckled darkly to himself at that thought. Well, he seemed to have seen a girl, but not really one he could give a flower too.
Well, one way or another, he made his way through the corridor, beginning to make the sharp turn.

*****Meanwhile*****

Mariko couldn’t help by wrap her arms together and contemplate as she walked down the empty corridors of stone. There was that moment whenever she looked back at Penn through the looking glass and just...froze. She just stared at him for a moment and noticed just how...mystifying he seemed from her new perspective.

With each change, her view of the boy seemed to change more and more, to the point where she could barely even recall what it was to be related to Penn or even live anywhere other than Japan. It felt weird, not to mention confusing. At first, Mariko only saw Penn as someone cheesy enough to hold onto flowers for a future romantic and stupid enough to go wandering into a giant cave by himself. But the more she wandered and thought about him, the more she started to think of him as...cute.

How else could she describe a boy naive enough to hold on to a flower and eagerly search an entirely unknown cave? He literally stopped to smell the roses! How more adorable could a guy be?! Maybe...Maybe her body was just making her feel this way with all sorts of new hormones and chromosomes and neurons and...science...but the more she thought about him, the more she seemed to fluster and mentally berate herself.

But...this is what she signed up for...right…?

Thankfully for Mariko, the turn was finally coming into view, causing her to gain some much needed spring in her step. So, at a nice jog, she began running off to the end of the cavern and took a harsh right.
12111111111111211111.title: Penn understands her

121111111111112111112.content:
With his thoughts still on the mystery girl, Penn made the sharp left at the end of the hallway. It almost felt as if the cave was getting stuffier the more he went inside. He just hoped that this cave even had an exit. Wouldn’t be worth it if he just got trapped here.

“So….what’s around here?” Penn made the sharp turn, looking down the path to see if anything was new.

Still, to his disappointment, there wasn’t much new, making him sigh again. He had no choice but to keep on going forward, even though his confidence seemed just a bit shaky. In any case, he kept walking in that direction, just hoping for something to tell him that he was on the right track.

Eventually, after walking a bit further, he slumped against a wall. Despite being just the same gravel as the rest, it seemed a bit lighter and dustier than the rest, but that didn’t seem to mean much.

“Ugh, how long does this place go on?!” his voice echoed a bit through the little hallway.

On the other side of the wall, Mariko’s ears suddenly perked up. That sounded just like...Penn! “Watashinokoegakikoemasuka?!” she called out before suddenly shaking her head. Did she just...instinctively use Japanese? It made sense, considering she grew up in Japan and all, but it just felt rather weird doing it by second-nature.

Nonetheless, she immediately cleared her throat and instead asked, in English this time, “Can you hear me?! I can hear you!”

Penn’s eyes immediately widened at the distinct female voice. He looked around briefly, until he pressed his head to that wall. He knocked on it a bit, and it made a tiny echo. It didn’t feel as solid as the rest of the cave. Perhaps this was how he could hear her.

Wait….so that girl he saw for real?!

“Y-Yes! I can hear you!” Penn called back. “Are you stuck in here, too?! My name’s Penn!”

Mariko couldn’t help smile at the boy’s immediate enthusiasm. The first thing he says upon hearing a girl is ask if she’s alright and then immediately introduce himself. The little dork was almost adorable.

“I guess you could say I am,” Mariko responded in a slightly softer voice, seeing as how yelling didn’t seem to be completely necessary in this situation. “My name’s Mariko. Happy to meet you, Penn-kun~!” She couldn’t help but giggle at her instinctive use of the friendly honorific. Maybe she was really becoming more Japanese by the second. Maybe that wasn’t such a bad thing either.

That little honorific with the giggle at the end brought a little blush to Penn’s face, making him kind of thankful that she couldn’t see him. Boy, all he did was hear a voice and he already introduced himself. He wasn’t sure if he was desperate or just a bit panicked when he said it. Well, whatever the case, it was established that he wasn’t alone.

“N-Nice to meet you as well, Mariko,” he smiled, lowering his voice as well. “I...I guess you’re stuck in this cave like I am?”

“I already told you yes,” Mariko responded with a small smirk on her face before laughing to herself a bit. She was starting to see just why her brother could never really attract much female attention. “Still, maybe if we work together, we can find a way out, right? Do you see anything up ahead?”

“Up ahead?” Penn repeated to himself as he turned back to look. There was absolutely nothing down the path he already came through. However, when he looked to his right, he saw something in the distance. “Um….I think I see a tiny light...or something like that. You see anything like that?”

“Yeah, something like that,” the girl said while bearing witness to a similar sight ahead of her. “Probably just another wall of crystals or something. Still, it’s something, right? Might as well keep moving.”

“Sure,” Penn nodded, backing up from the wall. “So...meet you over there?”
