“Sure,” Mariko parroted back with a small giggle. “Maybe I could see your handsome, undistorted face this time.” She smiled to herself in amusement of her own flirtatious nature, but truth be told, she was starting to have trouble figuring out in she was truly joking or not.

Penn tried to control the massive blush on his face when she called him handsome. Did that mean she saw him like he saw her? Well, that could wait. They had more important matters.

“W-Well then….I’ll meet you there,” he stuttered slightly as he turned from the wall completely.

With that, Penn gave a light jog towards the small light, it getting slowly bigger and bigger as he picked up the pace. It was easier to run with an objective in mind for once. In fact, it really wasn’t too long before what was glaring at him suddenly came into view.
121111111111112111112.title: Another hallway greets them

1211111111111121111121.content:
As Penn finally approached what light was glaring in his face, he finally got close enough to see just what it was.

“Hmm? What is….?”

There seemed to be some kind of mirror, though it almost resembled the crystals he had seen before. To say it was beautiful though would be an understatement. The mirror’s surface was so sleek and spotless, as if crafted by heavenly beings or something of that nature. Well, whatever it was, Penn pushed aside those thoughts, walking right over to the mirror. He wondered if it was like the crystals from earlier, and if he could see this girl. Yet, when he reached the mirror, he didn’t see anyone there.

“I hope she’s really there,” Penn said, feeling a bit longing for the voice he only heard just a minute ago.

Mariko casually walked over to the glistening wall, only to suddenly stop dead in her tracks upon seeing Penn’s reflection, clear as day, within the wall’s surface. For reasons not even she could quite explain, the girl began to fluster upon seeing a similar look upon the boy in the mirror. Still, she managed to give off a friendly smile and gave a casual wave at the boy.

“H-Hey, Penn-kun. N-Nice to see your cute face again.” Weirdly enough, those words felt surprisingly liberating. Her body grew slightly less stiff as she straightened herself out a bit and gave off a slightly more genuine smile. It looked as if she was finally gaining some much needed confidence around this...interesting boy.

Interestingly enough, her words seemed to have a somewhat relaxing effect on Penn too, making him smile and give a small wave back. Even he thought that it was odd that he was feeling calmer. This girl...there was something relaxing about her, not the usual gut-wrenching feeling he got around other girls. By now, both of them were at the mirror’s surface.

“And...it’s nice to see your beautiful face as well, Mariko,” he smiled at her, before scratching his head a bit.

“Sorry, was that too forward?” he asked with a small chuckle. He even seemed to be able to laugh casually around her. Whatever it was, he liked it.

Mariko felt like blushing a bit, but it wasn’t like he was flirting with him any more than she was. Still, it felt surprisingly nice being flirted with, especially from such a sweet boy like Penn. Considering how such a good judge of character he always was, maybe it was a good sign that he actually seemed attracted to her. She almost felt...flattered.

“No, it’s fine,” she answered back with a small giggle while beginning to play with her hands some. “So…” She began looking all around herself. “I honestly can’t think of much to talk about right now. Still kinda stuck in a cave. But…” She smiled back at Penn. “At least I know I’m not alone in here. So that’s comforting.”

“Same here,” Penn smiled back and nodded. “I was honestly kind of worried, just hearing the constant silence of this place. Maybe we can talk more once we get out? There’s gotta be an exit, I’m sure!” he said with a bit of returning confidence. Since seeing this girl, he was feeling more comfortable, and that seemed to serve as more motivation to find an exit for them both.

“Certainly sounds like a plan for me,” Mariko responded with a large smile. “Maybe we could find it together! You know, like Chīmuwāku! Er, I mean teamwork.” Wow, she really was turning Japanese…

“I like the sound of that,” Penn smiled a bit wider. “So, um, what do you think? Just continuing to walk down the corridors?”

“Sure,” the Japanese girl answered with her now naturally cheery disposition. “Just let me know whatcha find, okay, Penn-kun?” She strolled over closer to the mirror and smirked at him while putting her right hand against the glass.

Penn couldn’t help but chuckle as he got closer to the glass, raising his left hand. In all honesty, he wasn’t sure if he was doing this on his own, but his hand moved against the glass, lining up near perfectly with Mariko’s hand. He wasn’t sure what it was, but it almost felt as if a surge of electricity shot down his spine when he did that, giving him goosebumps all over. He wasn’t sure why, but for a brief instant, it almost felt like they were the only beings in existence, like nothing else mattered at the time.

Right after that instant, however, he removed his hand and the feeling was suddenly gone, but certainly not forgotten. Penn felt a fluttering in his chest like no other. This girl...she was stunning in every way. What would she be like when he finally got to see her in the flesh? The thought seemed to have him surging with adrenaline. Now, he was more motivated than ever!

“Well, I’ll see you then, Mariko,” he smiled one more time before beginning to turn. However, he ended up turning back briefly. “And...you know….that kimono is really beautiful. Almost as much as its wearer.”

And with that, he instantly ran off, face now a newly invented shade of red. He could NOT believe he just said that. What was he?! Some cliche anime protagonist?! The thought persisted in his head even as he began to run again.
1211111111111121111121.title: Reaching the end

12111111111111211111211.content:
Mariko felt a similar experience to Penn once her hand artificially connected with his. If she hadn’t known better, she’d say she had a heart attack, but no, it was just...well, she couldn’t really even describe the experience. For just a brief moment, there was no cave, there was no magic, no Soma, no Brad, no hormones, not even any glass separating the two. No, for just that one moment, there was just Mariko and Penn.

And once they let go, she wanted to be that again. She felt a renewed purpose in life, one she couldn’t recall ever having before. Mariko wasn't just wandering around for her own self-amusement anymore. Rather, she was now actively searching for a way to finally meet Penn as they should: in person and together.

So, after giving a bashful smile from the boy’s sudden compliment, Mariko rushed off to find the way out. Destiny awaited and it couldn’t be too far! Hopefully her choice of clothes wouldn’t slow her down too much.

*****On the other side*****

With his renewed determination, Penn was running as fast as he could through the cave. Well, with reason of course. He still had to take note to not run into the walls in his excitement. Still, with everything he had seen so far, he was sure there had to be a way out. Why would there be such things in here without an exit?

“Come on! Where are you?!” he said to himself. He wanted some kind of sign. An indication of….light?

As if answering his prayer, Penn noticed a dim light on the gravel around him. He looked straight ahead, seeing a somewhat stronger light around the corner. Was….was this it?! The very exit that eluded him?!

Barely able to keep himself from crying a victory yell, Penn ran as fast as his legs could, the sight of light becoming ever stronger as he rounded the corner. There were some Japanese ornaments around the end with some writing, but it wasn’t like he could read them anyway. He had better things in mind. He climbed up a small incline in the ground, before finally approaching its peak.

And there it was. In front of him was a gaping hole in the mountain.

“Yes!” he cried as he ran once more, the twilight of the setting sun came into view. The sunset, while only beginning, was incredibly stunning to the eyes. The sight in front of him bore some similarities to the other side, with a soothing creek and breathtaking trees and flowers.

Still, even as he looked around, seeing another hole in the mountain, he wondered about the even more stunning being he wanted to see.

*****Back Inside*****

Well, despite her newfound resolve, trying to run in a kimono wasn’t exactly working. Mariko had slowed down a bit, catching her breath after her brief jog. Yet, she still wore a big smile, for she could see in the distance her exit out of the cave.

“Finally! It’s so close!” Mariko smiled a bit wider, picking up her pace just a bit. Her feet were just a bit sore, as the sandals weren’t exactly ideal for cave exploration, but she was willing herself forward.

Though, as the small bit of light from the exit began to get bigger, Mariko got the feeling of a familiar presence, causing her to slow down and smile.

“Sengen...you’re there aren’t you?” she smiled, shaking her head left to right.

“Have I become that predictable?” a familiar voice rang from the ceiling. Like a chameleon losing its camouflage, Sengen showed herself hanging on the ceiling of the cave like a bat, before swooping down and landing gracefully on her feet. “Just thought I’d...check up on you before you left the cave. The exit’s right ahead, ya know.”

“I can see that,” Mariko nodded, sparing a glance at said exit. “And besides, I remember you saying that you wanted to meet me at the end. Have you been watching everything that happened?”

“Maybe a teensy bit,” Sengen admitted with a weak smile, visibly blushing of embarrassment. “S-Sorry, I...I should have asked.”

Instead of seeming angry at all, Mariko just smiled and shook her head. “Iya, soreha daijōbudesu,” she blurted out, causing another giggle at her near-subconscious use of Japanese. “That sounds so natural now. I think I like the feeling.”

“So then...I take it you’ve taken a liking to your new body?” Sengen asked with a slowly growing smile. “Have you come to a decision then?”

“Yes.” There was no hesitation at all. Mariko just smiled at Sengen. “I...I can’t deny how I feel now. When we touched back there..well, kind of...everything just felt clear to me. Penn...he is who I want to be with.”

Sengen could only smile back with certain warmness emanating from her heart. Having seen the small American boy blossom into a beautiful Japanese woman, it...it was one of her proudest moments in hundreds of years. She couldn’t help but tear up a bit. Before Mariko could even get another word in, the spirit swooped down to hug her around the neck.

“I...I’m so glad to hear that…” is all she can say with a soft smile as a single tear drips onto her creation’s neck. “So...ready to become little Mariko now and forever?”

Mariko was a bit surprised to see how she actually felt Sengen around her, but she happily pulled her arms around Sengen as well. The duo almost looked like two comforting sisters in a way. In any case, Mariko’s answer was definitive.

“Yes, I am,” Mariko looked straight at Sengen’s face. “I’m ready to be who I am forever.”

“Very well then,” Sengen said while letting go of the girl and simply smiling at her. “I’m afraid you’ll end up forgetting all about me after this is done, so...I guess this is goodbye. Thank you, though. This was...fun.”

Admittingly, Mariko’s smile dipped just a bit. Somehow, that wasn’t too surprising, but that didn’t make it feel good. She couldn’t deny that she had developed a bit of an attachment to the excitable young spirit as well.

“That’s….too bad,” Mariko sighed, though she tried to maintain her smile. “I kind of wish I could see you again somehow.”

“Maybe we will,” Sengen replied with a trembling smile as well. “We can only hope. Until then, though…” The spirit closed her eyes and spoke in a quiet whisper “Balse,” causing Mariko’s head to glow slightly, while she simply disappeared out of sight.

Mariko’s eyes slowly got their focus back, readjusting to the light coming from the end of the tunnel. Did she just blank out for a second there? Her hand briefly went up to her neck, feeling something small and wet before bringing it to the front of her face. Looking at the little teardrop in her hand somehow filled her with sadness, like something was just lost.

And yet, looking where the light was coming, she also knew what something warm and inviting was also awaiting her. Slowly, she took one step, and then kept going from there.

“Penn-kun….”
12111111111111211111211.title: Other Side of the Mountain

121111111111112111112111.content:
Penn was waiting around there for a good 10 minutes or so. It wasn’t like he had nothing to do though. The scenery around him was as breathtaking as it was on the other side of the mountain. Truth be told, there seemed to many wonderful places to see in Japan, and this was just the first stop after all.

It wasn’t long though that he soon heard gravelly footsteps from a ways behind him.

“Hmm?” he hummed as he turned his head back towards the twin exits.

“Penn-kuuuuuuuuun~!” Mariko cheered as she sprinted out of the cave and towards the boy of her dreams. Before Penn could even get a word out, the girl practically tackled him with a hug, squeezing him as tight as she could, as if making sure he was truly real. “Watashi wa saishūtekini anata o hakken! Oh, you’re so squishy!”

Penn’s arms instinctively wrapped around Mariko as soon as she hugged him, perhaps even tighter than he intended. Yet, the smile certainly hadn’t fallen from his face.

“And you’re so petite!” He laughed, noting the difference in height and size between them. It got a little laugh from both parties. “In any case, I’m glad to finally meet you. For real I mean.” he blushed just a bit.

“The feeling is mutual,” Mariko giggled a little bit while letting go of the boy’s neck, only to grab ahold of his hands and look up to the boy with the largest smile she could muster. “I...I really don’t know what came over me, but...as soon as we touched our hands together on that wall...I really wanted to meet you again so I could make sure you weren't just too good to be true.” She blushes a little bit as well, but keeps a steady smile as she looks down at their conjoined hands. “They’re almost as smooth as the glass, honestly.”

“I think yours are smoother..” Penn said with a smile, his cheeks very much red. “It’s...kind of strange. I’ve never seen you before...and yet when I heard your voice for the first time...I was immediately entranced. I wanted to see what you were really like.”

Right after he said that, a light went off in his head, making him want to slap himself. He quickly removed his hands from Mariko’s. “Give me a second.”

With that said, he reached his right hand behind him, bringing out the Yellow Chrysanthemum he had been carrying. To some extent, he felt as if he was forgetting something about it, but his mind was telling him one thing: give this to the first girl you meet.

“Um….I’d like to...give this to you,” he managed to say with a massive blush, holding out the delicate flower to the girl that had mystified him so.
121111111111112111112111.title: First Meeting

1211111111111121111121111.content:
Mariko could only stare at the flower in the boy’s hand. All of her life, she had seen thousands of the same kind, all physically identical to the one before her. Yet...this one just seemed to glow whenever she looked at it. If anything, she thought it to be just like Penn: maybe it was just one in a million, but there was just something so innocent and pure about it that made it the most beautiful flower she had ever laid her eyes on. Perhaps this boy was being more than a little cheesy, but...that only made him all the more genuine. So, needless to say, she happily accepted the flower, plucking it out of Penn’s hand with a massive smile that was bright enough to distract from the red that had overtaken her face.

Then, the girl leaned over and gave the boy a quick peck on the cheek.

Penn’s face didn’t get any less red when the girl pecked him on the cheek, though his smile didn’t decrease either. It was the first time he had ever received a kiss from a girl, and all he felt from it was bliss.

“I..I think it really suits you,” he smiled again. “It’s funny that I would think that, since I just met you. Yet...I can’t think of anything better.”

“I know the feeling,” Mariko responded before setting the flower in her hair. “Maybe...Maybe this all fate or something...I dunno…” She gives a nervous smile as she starts absentmindedly playing with her fingers. However, her focus begins to shift as she starts to see the sun slowly drop down. “Oh! I...I didn’t realize it was so late!”

She then looked over at Penn with a small smile before simply sitting on the ground with her legs crossed. “C’mon.” She patted on an area of grass to her right. “Watashitoisshoni suwatte imasu.”

“Oh, okay,” Penn nodded as he took the spot she patted for him, crossing his legs on the soft grass. He looked up and saw the setting sun. “Wow, this is a great view. You can really see the sun here.”

“You see the sun almost anywhere, silly,” Mariko responded with a giggle while playfully punching the boy, causing him to laugh a bit as well.. She then turned back to the sunset and let out a pleasurable sigh. “Y’know...considering all that happened this morning...I’m glad it ended up becoming the best day of my life.”

“Really?” Penn raised an eyebrow at her. “Was today rather eventful for you? I mean, before you were in that cave with me?”

“Well, I was trying to make it to the fireworks festival, honestly,” Mariko admitted with an embarrassed smile. “But it was apparently on the other side of the mountain. I’m apparently terrible with maps and ended up wandering down this mysterious path. I know I probably should have walked back hours ago, but...something just kept drawing me closer down this path.” She then gave off a warm smile over at Penn, both of their eyes glistening from the red sun. “Then I ended up finding you.”

Penn gave a small chuckle. “In all honesty, my story isn’t too different. I was just trying to find an attraction to see in Tokyo. Then I end up finding a path out of the park and down to that shrine on the other side of the cave. From then on, I was mostly exploring. Though, that little flower did stick with me. I did hope to maybe...give it to a girl.” His face slowly grew ever redder.

“Well, looks like you found that girl then,” Mariko remarked with a small giggle before taking the flower out of her hair and looking back down at it. “You know, it’s crazy. My dad gave my mom the exact same flower whenever he confessed his love to her. Guess goofy minds think alike.” She let out another small laugh before looking back up at Penn. “Thank you for this. I shall treasure it forever.”

Hearing those words made Penn’s face go a bit redder, though he felt extremely flattered. He never really believed he, as humble as he was, to really have an effect on someone. It felt nice in all honesty; a feeling he didn’t want to lose. Oddly enough, he felt as if he had heard a story similar to that once, but he couldn’t place that memory anywhere. Oh well, it wasn’t important.

“You’re welcome,” he smiled. “I...I think it looks really good on you.”

Suddenly, Penn felt as if he could feel her sleeve against his arm. He looked down, seeing that the distance between where they were sitting was smaller. Was he slowly moving closer to her? Or was she moving to him? Well, guess it didn’t matter, but it did surprise Penn just a bit.

“You...feeling cold at all? It is a little chilly here,” Penn said, as there were a few chill winds with the setting sun.

“I...I suppose I am,” Mariko answered with a large smile before beginning to lean her head on the boy’s shoulders. Despite barely even qualifying as contact, she felt warmer than ever before next to Penn. “Are you maybe offering something?”

Penn’s breath hitched a bit. “Oh r-right!” He cried a bit, using his right arm to curl around her shoulders gently, lightly grasping her right shoulder in the process. “How does that feel?”

Mariko could feel her heart flutter as she and Penn merged closer than ever. It was enough to make her close her eyes, blush a little, and just let the warmth that came from this wonderful boy just sink in…

“It’s wonderful,” she replied simply yet sweetly. “Thank you so much, Penn. You…” The girl began to curl her own arms around the boy’s shoulders. “You are a wonderful boy. Thank you...for everything.”
1211111111111121111121111.title: The Flower

12111111111111211111211111.content:
While Penn’s blush didn’t decrease, he was feeling more at peace as well. Mariko had curled both her arms around him, and he kind of moved as well until she was now sitting in front of him, making it easier for her to hug him. He smiled as he was able to curl his left arm around her as well in response, bringing close enough for their chests to touch.

In a way, he felt strange. He didn’t know this girl...and yet he did. He had just met her for the first time, but he had the feeling of knowing her forever. Even as he leaned back a bit, he kept thinking about that.

“It’s funny,” he started. “I just met you, but I feel like we’ve known each other for years. You feel like that at all?” he added with a little chuckle, as if he wasn’t sure if it was amusing or absurd, or perhaps both.

“The exact same, actually,” Mariko replied with a giggle before looking lovingly into his eyes. “I just feel this sort of...connection with you, I guess. Like, as soon as I saw your eyes through that crystal wall and heard those kind words with that innocent little face of yours...I just felt like I knew everything about you. I could see just how genuine you truly are just by that look.” She then blushes a bit, though her smile barely wavers. “Is that weird?”

“If it is, then I guess we’re both weird.” Penn didn’t hold in his laugh then, complemented by a giggle from Mariko as well.

After opening his eyes back up, Penn felt struck again. The sun was really setting now, with it’s orange haze practically making Mariko’s skin glow in his eyes. Oh, it was almost criminal how lovely she looked right now; the sun off her skin, her slightly parted lips showing pearly white teeth, how her brown eyes just bore into him. It just hit him all at once, so much to the point that he didn’t even really notice himself beginning to lean into her just a bit.

At that moment, Mariko couldn’t tell if she was leaning in on Penn, if he was leaning in on her, or both. All she knew was that they were leaning ever closer, their faces closer than ever before. After that, the next two seconds seemed to happen in slow motion.

First, the sun went down completely. Then, a mighty firework was launched into the sky. This was at the same time as when both Mariko and Penn’s lips began to pearse together, only to touch the next second. Upon their lip-to-lip contact, the firework in the dusky night sky exploded into a beautiful display. The same could be said for the new couple, as both felt a sudden wave of pleasure upon connecting, cementing their feelings forever.
12111111111111211111211111.title: True Fireworks

121111111111112111112111111.content:
Penn barely heard the sound of the fireworks coming from the mountain, only hearing the ones going off inside him right now. This moment felt unbelievable, certainly something he never thought would happen when he came to Tokyo, The kiss was simple, not much movement than simply connecting their lips, but that was all that was needed to convey everything.

It did not take long for the two to part lips. Luckily for the both of them, they chose to back off at the same time. Normally, this would only be met with disappointment, but the two knew that they were just as comfortable next to each other as when they were physically connected. The two then began to sit down and merely enjoy the fireworks while leaning against each other.

“Sore ga watashi no saisho no kisudeshita,” Mariko admitted with a blissful smile as snuggled against Penn’s shoulder. “Arigato.”

“Of course,” Penn smiled as he continued to hug her close with one arm. “Maybe I should actually try to learn to speak Japanese myself. I can understand what you’re saying, yet I can’t say it myself.”

“Oh, so you can understand me?” Mariko asked with an amused smile. “Anata wa tada no yumede wa arimasen ka? Anata mo kanpekina yō ni miemasu.”

“Um……” Penn gave it some thought, before just shrugging with a smile. “I’m pretty sure that was a compliment.”

“Not the best at it, are you?” Mariko asked with a giggle. “Eh, it’s fine.” She then gave a small smirk at the boy. “You’re just lucky I happen to be president of the Foreign Language Club at my school.”

“No kidding,” Penn smiled, before smirking. “Then perhaps you can be my Japanese teacher,
Miss….whatever your last name is.”

“It’s Akiyama,” Mariko responded with another giggle. “And they’re just called surnames around here. And you shall refer to me only as Akiyama-san, okay?”

“Oh...uh y-yes...A-Akiyama-san…” Penn said, suddenly feeling a bit flustered as a blush returned to his face. Boy, did he feel a little embarrassed from that. His lack of true knowledge about the culture seemed to be showing.

“I’m just kidding, silly,” Mariko laughed while lightly punching the boy’s shoulder before giving off a smirk. “You’re just lucky you managed to get a girl that knows English as well as I do.”

“Yeah…” Penn lightly smiled back, more at ease now. “Though...I was serious about the teaching part. I...would really love to learn more about Japan...and you as well, if it’s alright.”

“You have my blessing, yes,” the girl smiled back. “If you want to know anything about me or my country, just go ahead and...how do you Americans say it? Shoot?”

Penn just chuckled. “Yeah, absolutely.” he smiled while bringing her just a bit closer, his own head resting lightly on hers. There would be plenty of time to learn later. For now, it was enough to just enjoy tonight.
121111111111112111112111111.title: Aftermath of the Kiss

1211111111111121111121111111.content:
As the two lovers talked amongst themselves, a lone spirit watched from a nearby tree, completely invisible to the rest of the world. Needless to say, Sengen couldn’t help but feel proud of the love she allowed to bloom. Admittedly, there was the tiniest bit of remorse for sorta tricking the boy, but she didn’t do anything the boy didn’t agree to. After all, both seemed happier than ever before now, so it’s not like there was a lot to complete about.

Yet...Sengen couldn't help but feel bittersweet. As lovely as the new couple looked and as happy as she was certain they were...she was going to miss interacting with them. Unfortunately, the life of a spirit is a lonely one, and due to the nature of Penn’s wish, she was very reluctant to allow either of them memories of their encounters with her. Penn did still have one more wish, but...he seemed happy enough as it was. There was no need to remind the other of their former, lesser lives just so she could solve another wish. Maybe...Maybe it was just time to head back to the ruins…

“You know….” Penn started up again from their spot. “I still find it funny how both you and me were lead to this very spot, almost as if something was at work if that makes any sense.”

“Yeah, I get how you feel,” Mariko responded. “There’s no way I can just meet the best guy ever in a cave on a hidden path we both decided to go on, especially while you were just here for vacation.” She gives a weak smile as she looks back up at the fireworks in the night sky. “To be honest, I have the vaguest memory of some sort of mysterious force guiding me. Like...like a spirit.”

“Hmm….you know, I think I can relate,” Penn nodded. “I feel as if some force was guiding me too. I guess it can’t be coincidence if it was both of us. Though..if there was such a thing, then I’m grateful. I don’t know if I would have met the girl of my dreams otherwise.”

“Well, there was a shrine back there,” Mariko noted with a small smile. “Maybe we were really guided by the spirit of that shrine. If so, we have an awful lot to pay he or she back for.”

Sengen couldn’t help but stare at the couple even more than before. Did they...remember her?! No...no way, she...she was supposed to wipe all memories of herself, but...how were they remembering her?! The little spirit wasn’t sure if she should have been scared or excited.

In all of her time as a spirit, all those centuries...not once did anyone she wiped the memories of ever remember her. Apparently, Sengen ended up playing such a major role in these two’s lives that there was no way they could just forget her. They couldn’t quite remember her, either, but they remembered her presence, all because she actually meant something to them. Honestly, that broke Sengen’s heart.

“You’re right,” Penn nodded with a smile. “If there is such a spirit, then we both owe him or her huge thanks.” He paused for a second, feeling something warm as he thought about it. “Do you think the spirit might be lonely here? Must be a pretty selfless one to go through the effort of bringing us together.”

“Yeah, really,” Mariko responded with a small smile. “Most of the spirits I’ve heard of are simple tricksters that mess with humans for their own amusement. For one to go out of its way to bring true love together...well, I’d love to meet such a spirit and thank it. They do live a lonely existence.”

“Agreed,” Penn nodded once again. He felt a strange feeling inside, as if reacting to what he was thinking. Still, he didn’t exactly disagree with it. “In fact…...I wish I could meet the spirit...and repay the kind of love we’ve shared...if that makes any sense.”

If Sengen had a physical heart, it would have stopped. Did...did he really just wish for…? And...And he still had the last wi….sh…?

The girl suddenly jumped out of the tree in joy as she allowed herself to become visible to the mortals once again. “HEEEEEEEEEEEEEEY!!!” she called out before nearly landing on the ground on her head, only to stop in mid-air before hitting it. “Did somebody call for me?”

Penn suddenly jumped a bit, quickly turning behind him on the ground. His eyes met the spirit’s own, unsurprisingly surprising him.

“A-A spirit?!” he cried out. Oddly enough, he was hit by a case of deja vu, like he had already reacted like this somehow. Was his gut feeling about a spirit really true? Perhaps it was, because he oddly seemed to calm down a bit.

“Hontō no seishin!” Mariko gasped to herself while covering her mouth with her hands. Honestly, she wanted to be more scared, but...there was just something about the spirit that seemed familiar. Yes, once she looked into the spirit’s eyes, she couldn’t help but feel a familiar presence, one she remembered that guided her to the love of her life. She could even remember the name.

“Sengen…” the girl said with a soft smile. “It’s...nice to formally meet you.”
1211111111111121111121111111.title: Sengen reappears

12111111111111211111211111111.content:
“I could say the same,” Segen said with a courteous bow and a soft smile as she slowly descended down to the ground on her feet. “I heard Penn’s wish and...well, I decided to grant it. So…” She motioned to herself happily. “Here I am!”

Penn seemed to find himself more at ease as he heard Sengen talk. Even the name was coming back to him when he heard Mariko mention it. He smiled at the thought.

“Sengen…..” he muttered. “It’s….nice to see you. I feel like I should know more...but right now I just feel happy that you’re here...and for everything I know you’ve done.”

“As you should be,” Sengen responded with a prideful, but no less loving look. “I believe I did some great work on you two. Some of my greatest work, actually. You have the right to be impressed!”

All three of them shared a happy laugh at that, the sounds practically echoing across the peaceful landscape around them. Even back at the shrine, it didn’t sound so desolate with the sounds of laughter.

“Well, I certainly am!” Penn cried out, still laughing. Still, more bits were coming to mind for him. “So...I feel like...this is my last wish correct? Are...you just going to disappear again after this?”

“I...I’m afraid so…” the spirit admitted as her visible joy slowly melts away to bittersweetness. She was hoping to distract herself from their inevitable second farewell. “I...I’m just a spirit. I’m confined to my land, which happens to just be this little plot of land of mine. I’ll always be here, but…” She begins sorrowfully staring at the ground. “You won’t…”

“Well...that’s just horrible!” Mariko retorted with a very rare burst of anger, if only to try and direct her sadness of the situation somewhere else. “I...I mean…” She turned over to Penn. “You wished that we could repay her, right? How is leaving her to be alone for all eternity anything anyone would want?!”

Penn barely wasted a second with his response. “You’re right. No one deserves that. Certainly not someone like Sengen,” he said resolutely. “Even when our memories were more faded, we didn’t forget her. We can’t let that go.”

So, Penn stared directly at Sengen. “Sengen….I want to do exactly as I wished. I….We both would like to repay you.” After saying that, he looked at Mariko. “Right?”

Mariko looked back at Penn and gave an affirmative nod without any hesitation. “Of course.” She then looked back over at Sengen, who looked about ready to start crying. “You deserve a better life.”

Once again, Penn nodded. “So yeah, that’s what we think.” he said. At this, he even offered his hand out. “While it might seem a little selfish on our part...we’d like you to come with us.”

“C-C-Come with you…?” Sengen asked as she continued to tear up, even to the point of sniffling a bit. “H-How?! I’m...I’m a spirit! A spirit can’t just...leave! If I could, I would have done it centuries ago!”

“Well…..” Penn tried to think. “What if you weren’t a spirit anymore? Could you...perhaps make yourself human?” In a way though, the question sounded a bit silly. You’d think that if she could, she might have done so long ago.

“Turn...myself human?” Sengen asked with a shocked look. “I...I’ve considered it before, but...I’ve never been able to really do it on my own free will. I...I still think it’d be achievable if someone wished for it, though.” She then gave off a nervous smile. “But...you already used up all of your wishes.”

“......Frick!” Penn swore to himself. Was that really all he could do? After everything that happened, was he useless to change anything? He stared at the ground, his face barely even holding some budding tears of his own.

“Wait, Penn, wait…” Mariko started to say while comforting her boyfriend by putting one hand on his shoulder. “You...You wished we could repay her for all of the love she’s given us, right? After Penn solemnly nodded, she lifted up his chin and looked at him straight in the eyes. “Well, I think the only way we could properly repay her is by making her human, wouldn’t you say?”

Penn’s eyes widened when the realization dawned upon him. When she put it that way, it sounded so obvious. Almost immediately, his expression completely reversed, smiling and nodding at his girlfriend before turning to Sengen again.

“You hear that? She’s exactly right,” Penn said. “Giving you a better life like you did for us is the only fitting way to repay you. It’s the least you deserve. I’m sure you can twist the wish that much.” he added with a little smirk.

With that, he even took one of Mariko’s hands in his own. “Think of it as a wish from both of us. It’s only fitting that way.”

Sengen could only stare at the two humans before her with wide eyes, a gape of wonderment, and tears starting to flow down her cheeks. What these two were asking for wasn’t going to be easy to pull off, but it would still be the best thing she’d ever done. So, she simply smiled as she looked over at the ground as her entire being began to glow. Nobody, not even herself, would remember this spectacle afterwards, but if they had, the entire city of Tokyo would refer to it as The Great Lightning Bolt: a fantastic display of color upon the mountaintop as reality shifted one last time…
12111111111111211111211111111.title: Seeing each other once again

121111111111112111112111111111.content:
4 Months Later

Penn breathed a sigh of relief once he finally entered his room. Junior year high school was really a royal pain, as if he thought it could get any worse than last year. Well, at least he didn’t have too much homework tonight, and what little he had was already done. Good thing, too, because he had something more important in mind.

With a smile, he walked over to his laptop, quickly logging in and opening up Skype. It wasn’t something he used much long ago, but it had a great use now. He smiled again as he went to the video chat.

“Kon'nichiwa!” He smiled at what he saw. “So, how was that?”

“Well, congratulations!” Mariko giggled back from the other side of the video chat, clothed in a modest uniform, much different from the extravagant robes she wore upon their first meeting. “You know the only Japanese word that most natives of your country do. At least you got the pronunciation spot on!”

“That’s what I was going for,” Penn smiled. “I’ve tried continuing to pronounce all the words you showed me back then, and even the ones since we’ve able to talk through this.” He smiled again before adding. “Let’s try this then: Dono yō ni shite, utsukushī o shite iru nodesu ka?”

“Watashi wa totemo ī,” Mariko replied with a large smirk. “Motome itadaki, makotoni arigatōgozaimasu. And how are you, handsome?”

“Pretty good, aside from the usual,” Penn replied. “My grades are actually a bit better, so my mom and dad seem to be giving me a little slack. Mom is still getting on me about what I might study in after high school.”

“Oh?” Mariko responded with a small coo. “And have you still not decided yet?”

“Well...probably going to go into business. That’s the current idea in any case. Maybe into something like logistics. I am good with numbers after all,” Penn replied. “And what about you? I know you said a while ago that you were still thinking.”

“Well…” Mariko fluttered her eyes a bit as she gave her signature flightly look as she fiddled with the keyboard in front of her. “Honestly...I’ve been considering becoming a manga artist after graduating. It might not be the most lucrative job, but I’ve been told I have enough potential to at least land me an ongoing magazine job. Mr. Kotoro said I just need to send in a one-shot to one of them to land a job.”

“Wow, that would be amazing,” Penn smiled. “I remember those drawings you showed me back in June. They were amazing, so I have no doubt that you could be a hit.”

His girlfriend looked about ready to respond, only to suddenly be interrupted by a certain visitor on her side of the screen. “You should see the pictures she draws of you and her kissing and stuff!” Mariko’s little sister Sengen budded in with a mischievous smirk as she nonchalantly walked past her sister’s webcam.

“S-Sengen!” Mariko shouted at the girl, who merely giggled and ran away afterwards, before looking back at her boyfriend. “S-Sorry, about her. Please don't’ listen to her. Just...forget she said anything, alright?” The girl tried her best to hide her embarrassment under a nervous smile.

“I can’t help but feel like we’re in a manga ourselves whenever your sister shows up,” Penn chuckled, only to be delighted to hear a soft giggle from the other side. Still, he looked back at her. “...I do wish I was there to really give you kisses though...instead of always having to imagine them.”

“Well, I hope you don’t imagine them too often,” Mariko said with a small smirk before giving off the softest smile she could. “Look, we already talked about me coming over for Christmas. I know it’s still quite the wait, but we’ve made it this far, right? We can wait a couple of months.”

“In all honesty, I’m just glad your parents are okay with it,” Penn smiled. “At least it means I’ve made a good enough impression for a guy whose total experience in Japan totals 2 weeks.”

“Well, you made a pretty good impression as a guy I spent a couple of minutes in a cave with,” she noted with a small giggle. “No wonder they instantly took a liking to you.”

“Fair enough,” Penn chuckled. “Still, I can’t wait to show you around. Christmas is going to be a lot of fun, and of course, I believe you’re staying just long enough for New Year’s right?”

“Correct,” Mariko said with a nod. “Why? Got something special planned?”

“It’s a work in progress,” Penn laughed at that. He was getting better at this sort of thing, but he still needed some work getting things in order. “At the very least, the New Year’s fireworks would be a perfect cap to our year.”

“Must fireworks be deployed every time we meet?” Mariko asked with a playful smirk. However, her attention is suddenly turn over to a garbled voice from offscreen. “Oh poo.” She then turned back over at Penn with an embarrassed look on her face. “Say, uh...my younger cousin’s about to have a birthday party here right now, so...I sort of have to go…”

“Just one last thing!” Penn cried out. He had just one more thing to say. “I...I know I’ve said this before...but I want to say it again.” He took a deep breath before continuing. “I will get over to your side eventually. Where we’ll always be face-to-face.” he added, his face blushing a bit, but he meant every word.

“I...I know,” Mariko said with a small blush herself, but a nonetheless sweet smile. “I know you will. And then we’ll go right back in that cave and find each other once again. I know the drill.” She then began to move her hand over to the mouse. “Well...I’ll be seeing you then. Oyasumi!”

“Oyasumi!” Penn replied right back, his hand on his mouse as well.

And with two simultaneous clicks, they both exited the chat.
121111111111112111112111111111.title: Many Months Later

13.content: How about a story where 4 boys and 1 little girl becomes the girls of Persona 4?
13.title: Alternate Story

131.content:
On this Friday night, Tyler couldn’t have been happier right now. Of course, any 10-year old would after getting a package in the mail, even if it wasn’t addressed to him exactly. He didn’t really care, as it was what he and his best friend were looking forward to for the past week.

“Tyler, don’t break it now,” his mother told him. “That’s Billy’s game, remember?”

“Yeah, Mom…” Tyler sighed but regained his step after that, immediately turning upstairs and back towards his big brother’s bedroom. “Hey bro, it finally came!”

“About time,” Billy sighed as he got up from his desk, leaving his latest Geometry homework laying down on it. Being four years the elder of his brother, he naturally had to look down to see his little brother with a square paper package in his hand. After weeks of waiting, he couldn’t help but smile down at fruit of his patience.

“Lemme see that,” he said before quickly snatching the package out of Tyler’s hands and already starting to tear it open.

Tyler watched as he watched his big brother tearing the package open, not taking too long to reveal it’s contents. He saw the yellow and black casing of a game, something he had known his brother to want for a while, and what little he described intrigued him, hence why he was curious. He leaned over to get a better look.

“Shin Megami Tensei…..Persona 4?” Tyler questioned as he read it out loud. “That name’s a lot wordier than when you told me about it.” He added with a smile.

“Most people just call it Persona 4,” Billy explained as he happily opened up the case and observed the perfectly reserved game manual and disc, just as the seller on eBay had promised. “Keith has been ragging on me to get it ever since he downloaded the game on his Playstation 3. Now that I can play it on my Playstation 2, maybe I can finally see what all of the fuss is about.”

“Me too. I’ve even heard some of my friends say some good things about it. Guess that M rating isn’t too bad if even Mom is letting me watch it with you,” Tyler said.

“Like Mom has ever cared about ratings on anything,” Billy replied with a chuckle before starting to uncover his long stored PS2. “Considering she brought us all to see Deadpool, I don’t think she would care either way. Now, how about you go get the others while I set this old dinosaur up?”

“Sure!” Tyler smiled, getting back up to run out of his room. His best friend, James, who was around his age, was visiting today while his parents were having a night out. His and Billy’s little sister Amy was there as well.
131.title: Yes

1311.content:
It didn’t take too long to find them down in the family room.

“Hey James, bro is about to start the new game. Better come up if you want to see,” he smiled before looking at Amy. “Come on Amy, I really think you’ll like to see this.”

“You always say that…” Amy pouted, holding her Pooh stuffed toy with her. She didn’t exactly object though.

“C’mon, I’m sure you’ll love this,” James tried to assure the six year old with a comforting smile. “I hear it has all sorts of pretty girls and romance. You like that, right?” Probably best to leave out the existential dread and serial murders out from his pitch.

Amy was hardly old enough to really know the meaning of romance, but judging by the smile, she was intrigued either way. “Oh, okay!”

“Just make sure you’re all down here for dinner, alright?” Their mother smiled as she walked by. “Don’t want to be calling you down for 10 minutes.”

With a confirmation, the three of them went back upstairs, following the path back to Billy’s room. Looking inside, it was funny seeing Billy still tinkering with his decade-old console.

“Still trying to get it to work?” Tyler smiled and laughed a bit.

“Wait…” Billy muttered before finally plugging in the red AV cable, only to hear a familiar hum from his TV. “That should do it!” He then brought himself back around before pressing the good old power button on the Playstation 2, only to hear yet another familiar hum. “Tyler, the lights!”

“Roger!” Tyler saluted before running over to do just that. It was just about sundown, so just a tidbit of light came into the room now. Like it mattered as Tyler and James ran over.

“This is going to work, right?” Amy asked as she came over to take a seat herself behind the boys. “Didn’t you have trouble with the last game you tried on that?”

“Eh, I’m sure it’ll be fine. Right?” Tyler replied.

“Yeah, I’m sure it’ll be fine!” Billy chuckled before the TV began to flicker slightly. “I’m...sure that was just a glitch. James! The remote!”

“Right!” James nodded before picking the remote off of his friend’s bed and changing the television’s input to AV2. Soon enough, everyone is greeted by the beautiful chimes of the PS2 logo.

“Perfect!” the eldest boy cheered before starting to sit down in his perfectly comfortable gaming chair with his controller in hand. Now let the fun begin!”

And so, everything seemed to be going the way most of them had seen on the Internet. After the Atlus logo came the anime-like intro movie, starring Shihoko Hirata’s “Pursuing My True Self” which was quite the catchy tune that matched the game’s mystery theme. Despite the great tune, though, Tyler couldn’t help but catch something. For one thing, the movie seemed to be interrupting a bit, even more than it was supposed to given the TV theme. But then, there was a really glaring issue.

“Um, Billy?” Tyler slowly turned his head. “Is it just me or some characters missing from the movie? Is this an unlockable kind of thing?”

“I...I don’t think so…” the older brother muttered as he kept on staring at the screen. “Probably just a glitch or some dust in the old disc reader. Nothing major, I’m sure. As long as it doesn’t affect gameplay, we should be fine.”

Tyler just looked at James, who looked about as suspicious about it as he was. He hoped that it was nothing serious, but at the same time, he had never heard of a video missing stuff like this in a game. Usually if a game had a glitch, it would be during the actual gameplay. This mostly passed over Amy’s head, who wasn’t entirely familiar with it.

Eventually, the yellow tinted main screen appeared, but it still seemed to be missing characters. Adding to that, the screen looked like it was going in and out. At one point, the screen went static for a while.

“Okay...I think something’s wrong,” Tyler sighed. “Either something’s up with the console or we really need a new TV.”

“Please be the console, please be the console…” Billy muttered as he darted over to the console. He honestly couldn’t afford his brand new TV short circuiting or something. He immediately went for the disc tray’s eject button, only to feel a painful shock emanate from it.

“Ouch!” he cried out before starting to suck on his shocked index finger. “Okay, this is not normal. This...This can’t be normal.”

“Guys…” James muttered as the screen started to violently flash what looked like waves of black and white rectangles. He wanted to look away, everyone did, yet...they couldn’t...and soon, the entire room seemed to become enveloped in a blanket of pure light.

Yet, once the light finally subsided and the TV shorted out entirely, there was no one to be found within the room.
1311.title: Meeting them

13111.content:
Sunlight trying to get through Tyler’s eyes was the last thing he was expecting to see as he slowly began to open them. What had just happened a few minutes ago? There was that flash of black and white and then the sensation of falling…

“What just….” He grumbled, moving his body slowly on the ground.

Funny, it felt like he was on a field or something. Definitely the feeling of lying in the grass, that’s for sure. Opening his eyes just a bit wider, as well as using a free hand to wipe them a bit, he blinked a few times,

“Where...am I?” he asked out loud, to no answer.

It was definitely a field, most likely a little park. There were some shaded tables to his left, and the sound of running water could be heard from a ways in front of him, ahead of a sidewalk. Certainly not a place he could recall off the top of his head.

“Could you maybe...lower your volume?” James grumbled beside the boy as he slowly came back into consciousness. His eyes creaked open, only to find the same unfamiliar surroundings as his friend.

“Wh-Where are we?” He started to ask over to Tyler, gaining more and more panicked by the second. “Did we fall asleep?! Were we kidnapped?! What...happened?!” Unfortunately, the boy had a rather prolific history of asthma attacks and it appeared this was yet another one of them. As he began hyperventilating, he barely managed to take his inhaler from his pocket and give a nice, long breath of it, almost immediately calming himself down. Still didn’t help with the current situation, though.

“I’m not sure…” Tyler trailed off a bit, getting up and helping James as well. “I can tell I’ve never been here before...yet I have this strange feeling I’ve seen it on the Internet somewhere.”

He wasn’t quite sure how though. He saw many things on the Internet, so what made this place stand out so much. It was also odd how the place seemed pretty bright, almost like it was out of a cartoon or something.

Though, before Tyler could speak another thought, he saw something that sent him for a loop. Two girls were walking into the park, casually chatting along. One being a girl with short brown hair and a green jacket. The other girl had long dark hair and a red-themed outfit it seemed.

“W-Woah!” Tyler cried now, not really caring if he was heard. He turned to James. “You see that?! Either those are the best cosplayers I’ve ever seen or they’re the real thing!”

“The real thing?” James muttered, still collecting his bearings from a moment ago. He eventually looked over at the two girls mentioned, though he couldn’t really understand what made them so special. “Are you talking about those girls over there? All because they’re Japanese and look nice doesn’t mean that they’re cosplayers, idiot.”

Tyler slapped his forehead. Guess that’s what he got for being so vague. James wasn’t as informed as he was regarding certain things.

“Okay...how about I say this clearer,” Tyler said with a slightly deadpan tone. “Those two girls look like Chie and Yukiko from the game Billy was trying to play. And it’s not even slightly. They look like they jumped right out of the game.”

“Wait, really?” James asked as he looked back at the girls. Actually, now that he got a good look at them...they did seem sort of more...colorful than most people. Almost...cartoonish? “Now that you mention it, something does seem a little off about them. Like they’re just slightly...unreal or something.”

He then turned over to look at his friend. “Well, you’re the fanboy here. What should we do?”
13111.title: Follow Tyler

131112.content:
“Uh...well….” He wondered how to really responded to that. Was this just some bad dream? Surely this kind of thing wasn’t real, right? Maybe...maybe it wouldn’t hurt to actually get some information? As a matter of fact, he couldn’t see Billy or Amy anywhere.Just to check, he reached into his shorts to find his cell phone. The whole thing looked out of whack.

“Maybe….we should try talking to them?” Tyler suggested, though he wasn’t too confident. “I know Mom told me about strangers...but I’m not sure what else we should do here.”

“Well, they’re supposed to be the good guys, right?” James asked as he looked over at the two slipping away. “So if they really are the real thing, maybe they could help us somehow!” It wasn’t much of a plan, barely even a concept, but it was the best the boy could think of on the spot.

So, of course he spent no time running after the two cartoonish girls, hoping to catch up to them while they were still within his sights. “Hey!” he cried out. “Can you help us, please?!”

Chie and Yukiko both froze a bit when they heard a voice, Chie in particular turning to see James coming with Tyler a little bit behind. She smiled softly at them.

“Oh hello,” she said while looking at them. “You need help finding your parents or something?”

“I...guess you could say that,” Tyler said shyly, not entirely sure what to say. Did the fact that they looked so cartoonish mean something? This situation just seemed to get weirder by the second.

“Well, do you live around here?” Yukiko spoke up, being as comforting as she could, offering her hand out. “We’ll help.”

“Oh, thank you,” James smiled as he shook his head in gratitude. “Thank you, thank you, thank you. I honestly thought we’d be left on our own.” He then gladly accepted the girl’s seemingly cell-shaded hand. “I can’t thank you enough, Miss…?”

Right as James had touched Yukiko’s hand though, a bright light emerged from the point of contact, not taking long to envelop her before she could even react. Both Tyler and James barely had time to disgust what they were seeing before Yukiko’s form started shapeshifting, shrinking and changing form until something small floated to the ground in her place, still shining until it eventually died down.

“What….did you just do?!” Tyler cried out at James.

“I-I...I didn’t do anything!” James defended as he started panicking. He didn’t right? This was just all one big coincidence, a dream, a shared hallucination, something! “She just...after I...I didn't do anything, okay?!”

Chie seemed rather confused at the moment, though. The two boys she had just offered to help were just suddenly bickering over something. Well, that’s just what boys do sometimes, she supposed.

“Are you two alright?” she asked down at Tyler and James.

“What?!” Tyler snapped back, a bit higher and rougher than he intended, given how wound up he was. “S-Sorry...just that...Wait, how did you not see that?!” he added emphatically towards the simmering object where Yukiko was originally.

“See what?” Chie asked in complete confusion before looking down at where Tyler was glancing as well. “Did you just drop your card or something?”

“Card? What….” Tyler started before looking at the spot again.

With the light dying down, it indeed looked like a card there, one that Tyler had never seen before. Chie had already reached down to pick it up, though right as she did, Tyler tried to reach for it himself.

“Wait! What if…” he tried to say before his hand brushed over Chie’s on the card.

Almost immediately, Chie began to glow a golden light just like her friend as her form began to shift and shrink until it became unidentifiable as a human at all! Soon, a small, flat paper rectangle was lying on the concrete before the light began to die down. All that appeared to remain of the girl looked to be a playing card.

“Y-You just did the same thing!” James shouted in horror.
“But..why is that?!” Tyler cried out just as much in horror.

What in the world was going on? Nothing made sense at all. Not just the fact that two girls had just changed in front of them, but also that Chie seemed confused about it and not even looking at Yukiko’s disappearance. Plus, how did no one else around them react? Were they the only ones knowing of this?

Tyler’s head felt like it was going to explode from everything going on. Yet, he tried to remember what Billy always told him to do whenever he was in a pinch. The first and most important step was to calm down and think things through.

“Okay….deep breaths…..” Tyler mumbled to himself, trying to calm himself down.

“Okay….okay….let’s just think this through, okay?” With that, he picked one up, holding the card Chie became to himself while handing Yukiko’s to James.

“Think...Think what through?!” James yelled back as he clutched the card to his chest. “We just turned two video game characters into playing cards! What else is there to think about?!”

This was just too much for the boy to handle as well. He was in a strange park where everything seemed to be right out of a video game, their only potential help just turned into inanimate objects, and...and what else is there even to say? It hurt just to think of everything wrong at the moment.

Clutching his own card, Tyler came right over and grabbed James’ shoulders, shaking him like he sometimes did back home.

“Hey, get a grip!” he raised his voice a bit. “We’re not going to get anything done by standing around and panicking. That’s what Billy always told me.”

“And where is Billy?!” James shouted back. “We don’t even know where we are! If we’re not just going to stand around, then what on earth are we supposed to do?”

“Well then I guess we’ll just have to find him ourselves,” Tyler replied resolutely. “Billy was with us in our room when this happened, so I bet he’s here somewhere. Let’s try looking around. If this really is a game, then maybe I’ll be able to find something helpful.”

“Something helpful that we won’t turn into cards?” the other boy asked dryly.

“You’re really not helpful, you know that?” Tyler replied equally as dry before just grabbing his wrist. “Come on, let’s just go.”

“Fine, whatever,” James conceded as he allowed himself to be dragged along. “Lead the way, almighty leader.”
131112.title: Look for help

1311121.content:
Needless to say, there wasn’t much conversation between the two boys, even as Tyler began leading them along the trail by the river. Both seemed to be too wound up to really start any conversation, though at least they weren’t yelling anymore. It was about that time that Tyler began looking over his card. It had a picture of a knight of some kind being carried with two lions in the front, with a giant VII at the bottom. Along the top, he could point out a name.

“The Chariot,” he mumbled to himself. “I wonder if this is supposed to be significant somehow. Makes me wish I had looked more of the game up yesterday.”

James didn’t really respond to his friend’s statement of curiosity, though he grew slightly more curious about his own card. Looking down, he saw little more than the heavily stylized head of a woman in some type of a veil inside of a hole and with a hollowed out circle over her forehead. Other than that, there a giant II, which the boy was able to identify as the numerals for two based various sequels he had played before.

“The Priestess,” he also read out loud as he looked down at the name.

Hearing James talk, Tyler spoke up as well. “Makes me wonder if there’s anything special behind them. I don’t recall touching people and them becoming cards being a thing in any game I’ve played.”

In any case, as they were walking along, they were starting to hear more and more voices. Looking up from their stupor, they saw what looked like a decently busy street, seemingly filled with many shops along the way.

“Wow...this place looks lively,” Tyler said.

“I guess,” James replied as he watched little more than five people walking nearby. “Depends on your definition of lively, really.” It would really help if he could read any of the signs around here. The two had to rely on context clues the entire time to make sense of the different shops, like the book store and...tofu shop…

“Tell me, why are we becoming even more lost than before again?”

“You think standing in place somewhere is any better?” Tyler snapped back.

Truth be told, Tyler wasn’t feeling too confident, but no way would he let James know that. Someone had to seem like they knew what they were doing around here. Still, it would have been nice if Billy was still here. He could always figure out the stuff he couldn’t, and that applied just as much to real life as it did to video games.

“Ugh, this is a real pain,” Tyler sighed, his hand moving up to twist a piece of his hair, a nervous habit he always had, especially in school.

If his attitude wasn’t so sour, he might have been able to recognize something, specifically how how his hair seemed just a tad longer, compared to a typical boy’s cut anyway. Even the naturally brown roots of his hair were showing some signs of lightening, beginning to mix in a bit with the rest of his hair. The opposite was happening for James, who was just shrugging at Tyler’s demeanor right now. His own brown hair was showing a couple signs of darkening.

…….*rumble*.......

Tyler’s face immediately went from frustration to slight embarrassment, getting a shaky laugh from him. “Heh…..heh heh...I just remembered that we never got dinner...heh.”

“Maybe we should find somewhere to eat and run then,” James chuckled a bit as instinctively pushed his bangs out of his eyes as he had plenty of times before, forgetting his haircut from just last Tuesday. One with a keen eye may have been able to notice how the boy’s hair started to slowly extend down to his neck in a significantly darker shade of brown than before. Then again, the two were already distracted by much more important matters, such as where to go and where to eat.

“Think dining and dashing may be worth the risk here?” James asked over to Tyler with a nervous smile, unable to decide on the moral quandary himself.

“Well, Mom would never like that,” Tyler said with a sigh. Sure, that was the morally correct thing to do, but did they have any other choice at the moment. If only these adult-like situations could be easier.

At that moment though, Tyler’s nose caught a whiff of something nearby. Something...definitely new and exotic as far as he was concerned, yet quite enticing. Turning his head from James for a bit, he began walking just a bit, following his nose until he looked back up to see what he guessed was a restaurant. Would have been nice if he could actually read the big red letters above the door.

“Well, I’m going to guess this place will work,” Tyler nodded to himself before turning back to James. “I really don’t like the idea of dashing, but we...well, we might not have a choice.”

“Does it really count if it’s a video game world, though?” James suggested with a weak smile before catching another whiff of the restaurant’s hypnotic aroma. “I mean...I’m sure we can think of something else to do...after we eat, of course.” Then, without even a second thought, he ran directly into the restaurant with Tyler right behind, no looking back.
1311121.title: Walking along the Path

13111212.content:
Falling...falling…

This wasn’t the first time Billy had experienced the spontaneous sensation of falling within his sleep. There had been many times before that he had attempted to sleep, only to feel as if he was slowly down a large pit. It was a surprisingly peaceful sensation, up to the part where he reached the sudden STOP!

Billy immediately woke up with a start, breathing heavily as his heart pounded within his chest. His breaths slowly became more manageable as he finally began to finally make sense of his surroundings. However, all he found were TVs and various other electronics within what looked like the Sears at the mall. Slowly but surely, his heartbeat started to rise again, no doubt accentuated by the various customers looking down at him with curiosity. Even more surreal, almost every onlooker looked Asian and the price markers had weird Ys with lines over the V parts.

The boy slowly crawled back on the floor, unsure how to even interpret his situation. However, his backwards crab walk immediately came to an end after accidentally bumping into something behind him.

“Ow!” Amy cried after her eyes suddenly jumped open at the contact. “What was that...for?”

The little pause came when she happened to see what he was seeing. At first glance it seemed like every shopping department she had been to in the past except...who were these people? And why did it look like some kind of cartoon?

“Billy, what’s going on here?!” she cried out as she got to her feet.

“I...I really don’t know,” Billy replied as he looked back at Amy, followed by what he could only assume to be customers, then back at Amy, then back at the customers, then back to Amy. Everyone else definitely looked different from the little girl, like they were being shaded by a different sun entirely or...or like they were in a cartoon…

“Wait...where are the others?!” the boy suddenly cried out as he started looking all around. “Crap, I bet they left us here! Wherever here is.”

“Well, what do we do?!” Amy cried out, perhaps a bit higher than she intended. “I don’t like being in a strange place, and I’m hungry!”

“W-Well...I’m sure there’s...something to eat here,” Billy responded with a nervous smile, trying his best to keep the girl appeased, as he always seemed in charge of doing. “But I think we need to focus on finding help first. We need to find out where we are right now.”

Amy just sighed. “Okaaaaaay.” she said not so enthusiastically. “So who do we talk to? Mom says strangers are bad.”

“Well, sometimes strangers can be nice and helpful,” he tried to assure the girl. “You just have to pick them out carefully. Like…that boy over there.”

Amy looked to where Billy was pointing, in the direction of a boy in a uniform of some kind just standing there with an indescribable look on his face. Somehow, he kind of stood out from the rest, but Amy couldn’t really figure out why. Oh well, guess it was something at least. She was about to follow Billy’s advice, until a girl seemed to approach the boy. Amy was close enough to at least hear them.

“Back already?” the boy asked quickly.

“Yeah, turns out they don’t sell my type of phone’s charger here,” the girl sighed in rather dramatic disappointment, though she immediately perked back up. “But hey! Not like this’ll impede on our little shopping adventure. How about we find you some new clothes? No offence, but your detective costume is starting to smell.”

“Excuse me?” the boy asked back with indignation. “I never asked to come on your shopping trip in the first place, Rise. Really, there are other things I should be tending to.”

“Then why did you agree to come with me in the first place, Naoto?” Rise teased. “Don’t act like you didn’t have a say in the matter.”

“More like you dragged me here before I could give an answer,” Naoto curtly replied, trying to ignore the slight tinge of red on his face.

“What are they talking about, Billy?” Amy asked up to him, before noticing the odd look on his face. “And what do you look so surprised about?”

“Those...those are two of the girls from the game…” Billy muttered as he stared at the pair, dark circles seeming to appear underneath his eyes. “Rise and N...Nato? Naota? I...honestly forgot her name.”
13111212.title: Coming upon someone else

131112121.content:
“Hm?” Rise’s ears seemed to perk up upon the boy’s utterance of her name. She looked over at Billy, only to cringe a little. She really didn’t feel like worrying about another hormone-addled teenage fan of hers. With no offense to her fans, she had started to grow weary of her male 11-14 demographic.

Naoto turned her head slightly at the boys, her face her usual indifference. “Do you need something?”

“Oh us?” Amy pointed to herself, which got the attention of both girls. “Um, well we’re kind of lost….” she trailed off near the end, not real used to be talking to someone she didn’t know.

“We...We’re sort of a little...lost,” Billy finally managed to speak up in front of the two girls. Though, wow, the blue-haired one really does look like a boy. Good thing he already read the game’s Wikipedia article, or else this would be especially awkward. “As in...we have no idea why where we are and how we got here.”

“How you got here?” Naoto seemed a bit confused by that. “You implying that you didn’t walk in here?”

“No, actually,” the boy tried to explain as he rubbed the back of his head. “We...We both just sort of...woke up here. We’re actually sort of from...America…” Oh boy, even in a world with an alternate dimension within TVs, that had to sound farfetched.

Needless to say, both girls looked perplexed. Granted, Rise had kind of written it off as a fan making something up. Naoto in most cases would have as well, except the boy and girl didn’t sound like they were lying. They certainly didn’t look like they were from around these parts for sure.

“Well...I suppose I have seen weirder..” Naoto mumbled to herself, speaking from personal experience there. She looked back up to the boy. “Well, if you really are confused, you’re right in the Junes Electronics Department in Inaba.”

“Junes...Junes…okay…” Billy muttered to himself. That name sounded...slightly familiar. Maybe the article mentioned the name a couple times. Still, it pretty much confirmed his theory: they were inside the game.

“Are you really falling for the kid’s story?” Billy’s ears suddenly perked up at Rise’s mention of him. “Not to sound cold-hearted or anything, but I’ve seen this sort of trick before. The guy probably just wants some sort of sympathy, maybe a pity hug or the ability to hold my hand like a little creep. Let’s just go, Naoto.”

With that said, Rise grabbed her friend’s hand and starting calmly walking away.

“Wait, no!” Billy cried out as he ran towards his only possible tickets to getting out of this situation. He threw his arm out, reaching out for Rise, yet as soon as managed to touch the girl…

FLASH!

The boy had to look away as he was assaulted by a near blinding light. Another glance, however, revealed not the teen idol that Billy had seen so much fanart of before even hearing about the game, but rather, a simple trading card. One that just floated in midair before just plopping onto the ground.

Appropriately, the boy was freaked. “WHAT THE HELL JUST HAPPENED?!” he shouted out while clutching his hand, ignoring the countless eyes laid upon him.

“B-B-Billy! W-W-What was that?!” Amy cried out, not quite as high, though still noticeable.

Naoto actually cringed a bit, though it seemed to be more from the yelling. “Could you mind not screaming? You’re drawing attention.”

Naoto’s complete calmness threw Amy off. “Huh?! B-But did you see that?!”

“See what?” Naoto asked with a confused look. She shook her head after that though. “Look, we should probably get moving if you really need to get some help. Here.”

She moved to offer her hand in help to Amy. The little girl was still shell-shocked from what just happened, even trying to back away a bit from Naoto. However, that proved fruitless as Naoto grasped Amy’s hand.

The very same flash that had engulfed Rise just a few seconds before engulfed her as well, immediately lighting her up and reducing her to a smaller size. Like before, a simmering card was floating down in her place, gently falling next to the card where Rise once stood.

Amy was sure her eyes were about to roll back into her head. She couldn’t even scream. “I think….I’m going crazy.”

“I...I saw the same thing, though…” Billy stated as he stared down at the very same card on the floor of the department store. “R-Rise...the...other girl...just went and POOFED! She...turned into a card, too…” He looked back over at what he could only guess was the former Rise on the ground. His hand began slowly traveling down over to the card, trembling slightly as he came closer and closer to it. It took all of his might just to pick it up and inspect it.

Adorned upon the card appeared to be a giant black heart surrounded by the silhouette of a tree, along with silhouettes of a man and woman beneath said tree. The Roman numerals VI were written under the image, while the words Lovers was written above it.

“What...even is this?” the boy asked as he started flipping the card all around, looking for some sort of clues as to its meaning.

Hesitant but following her brother’s que all the same, Amy slowly reached for the other card. Hers was strange itself. It featured a wheel-shaped object with a sword facing upwards in the middle. An image of an imp of some sorts was around the top of the card and a snake around the bottom. The Roman numerals X adorned the very bottom, similar to the other card.

“I’ve...never seen cards like this,” Amy mumbled, looking over the card, seeing a little something more at the top. “What does “Fortune” mean?”

“It’s a...game show, I think?” Billy replied, still dazed from his own experience. “Why do you ask?”

“It’s at the top of the card. See?” Amy replied, even showing the face of the card to Billy. “It says it right there.”

“I see…” he muttered as he looked over at the card. “Weird. Maybe these belong to some sort of trading card game then? Like Yu-Gi-Oh?”

“That doesn’t really explain why that happened when we touched them though,” Amy replied, somewhat calming down from the experience. At least it seemed like people were moving on from their little show. “I’m so confused.”

“Yeah, join the club…” Billy groaned before suddenly hearing a soft rumbling in his stomach. “S-Say, uh...maybe want to get something to eat first? I still have my wallet on me, thank goodness, so...maybe I can buy us something.”

News of that nature brought a small smile to Amy’s face. “That...sounds really good. I never got to eat dinner before this happened.”

That seemed to improve the mood a bit, enough to get the duo going. Luckily, despite the new location, directions towards a food area didn’t seem that hard, leading them towards an elevator to head to the top floor.
131112121.title: The girls notice them

1311121211.content:
“Hey Billy...what does your card say anyway?” Amy asked curiously while they were riding up.

“O-Oh, it said, uh...something weird,” Billy replied while starting to take out his card again and showing it to Amy. “Something about Lovers.”

Amy couldn’t help but stifle a giggle that was still rather loud. “Now that’s funny! Didn’t you say every girl turned you down in middle school?”

“Y-Yeah…” Billy conceded while looking away, visibly embarrassed and flustered. “No need to rub it in…”

“And I heard that high school is even worse than middle school,” Amy continued on. “Sounds kind of scary like that.”

“Y-Yeah, I’m still adjusting to the idea of going this year,” the boy stated as he quickly shoved the card back into his pocket and tried to hide his obvious unease with a smile. “Everyone expects you to do everything, from dating to going to the dances, prom, clubs, e-everything...all while my mom and dad expect me to keep my grades steady.” He gave a nervous cough. “It...It’s not going to be easy for them-ME! It won’t be easy for me.”

“Hmm…..” Amy thought as she pouted a bit, seeing the numbers on the elevator nearing the top. “At least people will probably take you seriously in high school. Most people like Mom and Dad still laugh when I try to say something seriously.”

“When would a little girl like you need to be serious, though?” Billy asked with a weak chuckle. “You’re still young and...well, what do you have to worry about?”

Amy’s pout got even bigger. “Because I’m not stupid. I actually read stuff, probably even stuff you don’t. It’s kind of frustrating.”

Even though Amy was only 6 years old, she already had developed quite the vocabulary, perhaps much more so than other kids in her grade. Not to say she was a prodigy of any sort, but certainly further along in some areas. Heck, she sometimes even watched things with their Mom and Dad, even if a lot of it still went over her head. Still, it hadn’t helped much when dealing with others. To most adults, she was still just a naive kid, and that frustrated her at times.

“I...I suppose I can relate a little,” Billy sighed.

Truth be told, he wished his parents had as little expectations for him as they did for Amy. According to his parents, he was nothing short of a prodigy, a genius that just had yet to exert himself, acting like he didn’t already do that enough. They expected the world out of Billy, only to end up disappointed when they got only the best the boy could muster, just always below par.

The conversation seemed to go silent at that point; neither sibling knowing what more to add to that. The oddity of their situation wasn’t helping either, nor was the sudden little itch Amy was getting in her head. She always hated this season for that very reason. Reaching up, she took care of that, not exactly noticing parts of her hair starting to slowly darken, with even a few turning deep black in the process. In addition, while her hair was normally a ways past her shoulders, the furthest edges were crawling upwards.

It didn’t matter much though once the elevator finally opened its doors (longest ride ever) and let the shining sun enter the once dark space. Amy had to shield her eyes in response.

“Woah!” she cried, taking a couple steps out into the sun. “It’s like a theme park up here!”

“No offense, sis, but it’s just an outside food court place...thing,” Billy responded, rubbing his eyes as they adjusted to the bright sun. “Not quite Disneyland. Hopefully a lot more affordable, though.”

“Yeah….” Amy shook her head. That last trip to Disneyland took quite a bit out of the family wallet, and not just for the plane tickets.

“C’mon, let’s go find something we can afford,” Billy smiled over at his sister as he started walking off, signaling for Amy to follow him. As he started looking over the different vendors, the boy began to scratch his head slightly, barely able to see his blond hair darken slightly to a more dirty blond, not unlike his sister’s case, though his began growing out past his ears. Billy barely acknowledged it, though. He was meaning to get a haircut soon either way.
