“This is starting to make me wish I had read more Japanese,” Amy spoke out, looking around what was assumed to be the main vendor around. “You know...is it just me or are all these Japanese characters starting to make sense? Maybe I’ve been looking at them too much.”

There was a special chemistry between Brandon and James. There were friends ever since they were just 5, and they grew together, becoming a sort of rivals if you could call them that. Aaron pouted, but accepted James' answer, while Tyler.... was busy playing with a piece of paper.

"Um, Tyler, what is that?"

"Oh... just some magic paper."

"What... do you mean?"

"A few days ago, me, Blake, Eric and Gabe went to this magician's booth we found in town. After he had shown us some tricks, he game us some paper, telling us that if we write our wishes on them, it will come true. We decided to have only two wishes, not to get too confusing, since we had to write down all the wishes on every paper, since it was a common thing. He then gave us some pens with invisible ink to write down what we desire. So what me and Eric wished us... to become ninjas!"

After that, the other three paused and sighed, before Brandon said:

"Aaron, don't take me wrong, but I think you got pranked."

"What do you mean?"

"Come on, it obviously was a trick. Only you and Eric would believe in this sort of thing. I am pretty sure Gabe accepted to play this game not to make you upset and Blake maybe thought of it as just a pass-time."

"And why ninjas of all things?"

"Because they are awesome! They can throw fireballs, create electricity and..."

"You got it wrong! It is not like that Japanese cartoon you told us about. Ninjas are all about.... you know, being stealthy, agile and quick on their feet. They are not superheroes."

"What did Blake and Gabe wish for?"

"They just wished for a great beach trip with a very modern resort-like features."

"Well, at least that sounds a lot more reasonable."

"Hey! When I told Miles about it, he seemed thrilled to become a ninja."

"You told Miles?! Great, the means he will make the same wish like you all did then."

"Why are you so upset? Don't you want to become ninjas?"

"And how is that going to work?"

"Easy. I think I just have to show you all then." Tyler then took the paper and put it in front of the sun. "Make the wish come true now!"

At that moment, a light flashed from the paper and covered the four boys, before fading alongside them. As for the paper, it just burned in the light of the sun.
15113221.title: Yes

151132211.content:
When the light faded out, the boys were completely speechless. In front of them was an endless patch of blue... Not a sea, but an ocean. They were on a very large and clean beach with a lush jungle behind them.

"Wow! This is amazing!", exclaimed Tyler.

"""No it's not!""", yelled the other three boys, which made Tyler flinch at the outburst.

"W-Why are you guys so angry...?"

"Because we are in the middle of nowhere, with no way to get help, with a jungle of wild animals behind us...."

"And guess what? We are not ninjas!"

"Whoa, calm down Aaron! It isn't so bad."

"How is it not bad?!"

"W-Well.... Oh! I know! We are not alone! In the wish we also wished for a resort. Maybe we are on an island resort afterall...."

"That.... kind of makes sense. I mean, we wouldn't be sent here for no reason. So it must be a resort on this island.", said Brandon calmly.

"Okay... But then why aren't we ninjas?"

"I am sure it will come to that part as well."

"More like it made real the wish that can be possible to accomplish Tyler."

"What do you mean James?"

"Now come on ... ninjas are something of.... let's say Japanese Middle Ages. They are like knights. For something of the past to be on the same page as a modern resort is really impossible."

Tyler pouted at the statement: "W-Well... Maybe they live among us...."

"Like I said... They are not superheroes."

Brandon then tried to get everyone's attention. "Guys, let's forget about that for a second. Tyler, do you still have the paper?"

"Um... No. The old man said it was a one time wish, so it disappears after we make it."

"I see. Then all we can do now is to find somebody here to help us. With a little bit of luck, if there is a resort on the island, maybe we can ask for their help."

"I agree", said James. "But I think we should split up. Maybe we can find somebody easier this way."

"Sounds like a plan. I will go with Tyler. James, you go with Aaron."

"Alright. Let's go now."

And with this the two groups headed to opposite directions, with James being somewhat grateful of the choosing. Not having Aaron and Tyler bickering with eachother was a really good idea, as the two would barely make 100 feet without starting arguing. Although he wanted to go with Brandon, he figured out this would be much more productive.

But there was something on both Brandon's and James' mind: If the resort wish is to become true, why wouldn't the ninja one also come true? James said earlier it would be impossible, but still...

Little would they know, it would actually come true as well.
151132211.title: On a beach

1511322111.content:
Brandon and Tyler were walking to the east, hoping that they might find somebody. However Tyler was still a bit too excited given their predicament.

"This is so cool! We are going to a luxury resort and we are going to become ninjas! Isn't that great?"

"We don't know much about the resort yet, or what it has, but as for the ninjas.... Do you think that part will come true?"

"Why do you ask?"

"It might be just me, but James makes a point with how things are at the moment. I don't see how we can become ninjas. You even said that in your show they had to learn how to do things, right? So how are we going to learn? Because obviously we are not ninjas."

".... That's true. But maybe someone will come to teach us. I mean, if half of the wish came true, why wouldn't this part come true as well?"

It was indeed true. They got sent to a remote island after all. Which meant that if the paper made the wish true, it means that a resort or a hotel should be on it. They don't know that yet, but it had to make sense.... It would be really unlikely for the wish to pull a prank on them. But as for the ninja part,... Brandon began thinking that maybe they will become like the modern ninjas he saw on TV. It wasn't as credible like the takes he herad of before, but it could work in theory... given the wish knows about this fact.

As they were walking, they didn't notice that they began to grow a bit in height. It was a subtle change for the moment, but was quite odd for a sudden growth spurt. Also, their feet grew a bit in size as well, but their toes actually became thinner and more delicate.

"But still, why did Aaron get so upset?", asked Tyler aloud. "This isn't so bad. I mean it is not like we are in danger or anything... And if we are to become shinobi on top it..."

"Shinobi? What's that?"

"Oh! It is another way to say ninja. I saw it being used in that anime show. Doesn't it sound a lot cooler?"

"Y-Yes. It does", replied Brandon. "He really doesn't feel alarmed by this. I don't know if he is just excited or just curious about this place. The again, it beats getting scared and wondering around...", said the boy to himself. But as he was ready to turn his head, he noticed something. "Huh? Did Tyler do something with his hair? It looks a bit lighter."

Normally both Brandon and Tyler were both blondes, only that Tyler's hair was a more dirty blond color, while Brandon's was more towards honey-blond. Currently, the two boys' hair color changed between them.
1511322111.title: With Brandon and Tyler

15113221111.content:
Just as he was about to question Tyler's hair, Brandon just thought something.

"Wait... it could be just the sun. Or could be just another shampoo he used.... But that isn't important."

"Hm? What is with the serious look Brandon?"

"I was just wondering why are you so calm. I mean... we are stranded here, and we don't know if there are people on this island."

"Well... to tell you the truth, I am just confident in what the old man told us."

"Why? Was he anything special?"

"Yes! He isn't like one of those magicians you see on TV, he could practically do real magic tricks: like making things levitate, making light from his hands and having objects disappear from just a twist of his wrist. And he could even make fire and ice from his hands! How cool is that?"

Brandon was indeed impressed from what he heard, but then again he could be just a professional at what he was doing. There was just one thing that was a bit odd..."

"Um... About the last part. How did he learn that?"

"I asked him, but he just said he learned it when he was practicing in Japan."

"Japan?"

"Yes, he said he traveled the world a lot to learn new tricks, but he said that most of them he learned them from a man in Japan named Hanzo. He didn't knew much about him other than him being sushi chef. But he told him so much that he even questioned how he knew all these things. But he denied being a magician from what I heard."

Now that was curious. A man who wasn't even a magician told him so much about "magic"? Brandon could feel that there was something wrong with this image, but couldn't point out how did know so much.

While thinking, their feet grew some more while staying delicate. Their calves also began to change as some muscle formed in them. This made the two grew in height a bit more as their legs grew a bit longer. But this time, they also aged up a bit, both growing to 11 years old.

"So did he said that the paper trick came from this Hanzo?"

"He didn't tell us exactly... but I think he did Brandan."

"I see- Wait. Did you misspell my name?"

"Huh? No. I don't think so. I think you just heard it wrong Brandan."

Just as Brandan was about to argue, he decided to let it slide for the moment. " Calm down. Tiyler is just joking with you. I should ask more about this Hanzo rather than worry with this.", he thought while putting his hand on his chin. He didn't notice that both of their hands slimmed down a bit as their digits grew a bit longer.
15113221111.title: About the problem

151132211112.content:
Meanwhile, going to the west, James and Aaron were too trying to find some sign of civilization, with the latter still fuming a bit about their predicament.

"I can't believe that Tyler sent us here without knowing what he is getting us into."

"Now, now be a little more understanding... You know that when it comes to magic he just becomes excited."

"But he could've at least try to test that paper to see if it really works."

"He got just one, though...And we were all sceptical about this anyways. We couldn't have believed him even if he told us."

"Hmph!"

No matter how Aaron wanted to be angry, he knew that James was right. The only way Tyler would've convinced them was only if he could show them the real thing. Accepting that, he began to regain his composure. James himself was also starting a bit relieved that his friend was starting to calm down. He didn't had as less patience as Aaron, but he couldn't withstand a whole walk with nothing but him complaining.

While they were walking, their feet started to grow slightly. This made in turn their legs to grow a bit as well. What was a bid odd however was that their feet were gaining a pedicure.

"Besides, he only wished for us to become ninjas. The resort thing came from Blake and Gabe."

"...Hah. I guess you're right.", said Aaron wih a sigh. "Although, what were the chances of sending us all the way to a tropical island?"

"You said it. I just thought we were going to a modern resort from the coast, not somewhere this far."

"At the very least, it looks more like the tropical paradise Matt told us about..."

"Yeah..."

"But I still want to go home! How are we going to explain this? We can't just tell them some magic paper sent us here. What are going to say?"

"Calm down. We will think of that when we find someone, then we ask what to do later."

"Fine..."

James knew he had to keep Aaron cool to not waste more time. It was tempting for him to just backtrack and get to switch with Tyler to be with Brandon, but he knew that doing that was wrong. He was a loyal friend after all, so he wanted to try and help Aaron get over his indisposition as quickly as possible. And maybe that will ease himself a bit as well.

While he was thinking, he didn't notice that his chestnut brown hair was starting to darken a bit. Also, Aaron's raven black hair also started to lighten a bit.
151132211112.title: With James and Aaron

1511322111121.content:
"Come on! Feel more relaxed! We are going to a resort after all!"

"I don't see why that should cheer me up. We don't know if there are people around here to begin with."

"But think about it. We were sent here because Blake and Gabe wished to go to someplace modern and well-equipped. There is no way we were sent to a remote island as a prank. And we got here from a wish as well. Surely there are to be people around here."

"And what are we supposed to tell those people if we are to find them? That we got here by magic?"

"We could say we got separated from a group of tourists or that we got lost."

"And what about our parents?"
"We could say that we got here by mistake and boarded another ship."

"I doubt that would work... This is not a movie..."

"Or could say we have amnesia..."

"That... does sound a bit more plausible... But all four of us?"

"It is possible!"

Aaron began to frown a bit as he began to think of the idea. James was really trying to make his friend forget about their problem and try to see the bright side. But he knew better that it would take a while...

They didn't notice that they once again grew in height. What was a bit curious was that their legs were the ones that seemed to grew the most. Their feet, delicate and pedicured grew one last time, while staying petite. Their calves also grew a bit stronger as well. They also aged up a bit, up to 11 years old.

"Come on. Relax a little bit. We will try to find an explanation later."

"I don't know Ames. It is still very problematic..."

"Believe me, Yaron. Everything will work out in the end. Just try to enjoy it. You said you wanted to go to one of those resorts Matt told you about anyways."

"... I will think about it."

It seemed that finally, Yaron was starting to let go of his tension a bit. But there was something else that caught caught Ames' attention.

"Did Yaron say my name wrong? Nah... I must be imagining it..."

As they continued walking, their calves continued to grow, gaining more muscle as time went by.
1511322111121.title: Trying to cheer up

15113221111212.content:
Meanwhile, walking on the opposite side of the coast, Brandan had quite a few questions on his mind, now knowing the source of this magic.

"So, did the old man say anything else about this Hanzo?"

"There really wasn't anything else to say. From what I understood, the guy seemed to know quite a lot about the Japanese lore and old shaman magic that they have there. He told him some stories about demons and all sorts of really confusing magic techniques."

So Hanzo was familiar with the lore... That wasn't actually too surprising given that he also was quite old and learned it a lot during his years. As for the magic knowledge... he probably just researched it somewhere. But it was weird that something out of those tales, like the magic paper actually EXISTED.

While pondering, their hands continued to change. Their nails grew a bit longer as the hand itself became quite dainty. But interesting enough, their grip strength actually increased.

"Anything else?"

"Well, he said that Hanzo looked quite well-built for someone who was just a mere chef. When he asked about him being an athlete in his youth, he was quite vaugue about his past. He said he had another job before that needed a lot of physical work, but he didn't disclose any more than that.
"I see... Wait a second. When did you learn words like "vague" or "disclose"? I heard them before, but they seem to be really complicated words."

While it was unusual for someone so young to use, let alone understand the meaning of those words, Tiyler just smirked at that. "Heh. I guess that I must be getting smarter then. I wonder if Yaron would play a little game to see who knows more words."

Brandan was really surprised of his friend's response. While it was true that Tiyler was at times taunted by his limited vocabulary, for him to actually propose a small challenge to prove that he is smarter was a bit... out there. He didn't notice however the new name that he called their friend.

Another thing he didn't notice was that their hair changed a bit more. With Brandan's getting a shade darker, while Tiyler a shade lighter. It also started to grow out, but while Brandan's was starting to cover his ears and grew a bit longer in the back, Tiyler's just became a little more unkempt.

"Is there something else?"

"No, that's all I think. Can we talk about something else now?", asked Tiyler with a slightly tired expression. " I don't remember much more anyways."

"Y-Yeah... Sure."
15113221111212.title: Talk about Hanzo

151132211112121.content:
Knowing that they shouldn't get bored, Brandan thought of another subject to talk about. Since the resort wasn't part of Tiyler's idea, there was only one subject to talk about...

"I can't believe I am saying this... Tiyler, tell me about the wish about nin- I mean shinobi."

"Hehe. Glad you asked.", replied the boy with a smile on his face. " I wished to be able to the amazing things shinobi do on the anime."

"I thought you said you wished just to become shinobi."

"I did. Weird. I think I forgot to mention."

"So what do they do on the show?"

"They can use the power of elements, they have guardian animals that they can summon..."

"Sounds more like sore sort of wizards rather than ninjas... But did you actually wish for these things?"

"Well, I just wished to be shinobi. I did mention that I would have some sort of powers... but I can't actually remember."

"What do you mean?"

"It is strange... Before I remembered everything about the wish... But now it seems a bit foggy for some reason."

"Maybe you still feel a bit dazed about the situation."

"I guess..."

In reality, his memory was starting to fade about the wish. Actually, both of their minds were starting to change, certain details about their lives starting to fade from their minds.

Also, they once again grew in height. Their legs became longer as their calves become more toned. Their thighs also began to thicken and gain some muscle as a small layer of fat was forming on the surface. This put some strain on their swimsuits as well, but they ignored the feeling. They also aged up again, but this time,there was a big difference between them. While Brandan grew to 13, Tiyler became 15, being slightly taller now.

"Anyways, I think I know why the wish couldn't come true."

"Really? Why?"

"In that anime you watched, were there resorts?"

"Well, I think there were hot springs and inns, but nothing else."

"Maybe because there was this modern resort that didn't fit in with the rest. You don't know any shows of modern shinobi, so I guess that is why it doesn't work."

"You think so?... Well I am not about to give up on my wish just yet Handan. We will see in the end what it will be of it."

Handan sighed as he thought: "He sure is obstinate, that Tiyli... Wait. Did he misspell my name again? Ugh. I really wish Ames was here right now.", whispered while putting his hand on his forehead.

He was that deep in thought that he didn't notice their arms growing a bit slimmer, but also more stronger as well.
151132211112121.title: Shinobi

1511322111121211.content:
Ames and Yaron continued to walk on the beach, with the latter still being a bit apprehensive of the whole situation. Ames knew that there had to be a way to make his friend ease up a little, so he thought of something.

"So... What do you plan on doing at the resort?"

"What do you mean? Get help of course."

"No, I mean other than that. If we are to wait for someone to get us, maybe we could have some fun until then."

"What do mean by that?"

"Come on, you know what I mean. Relaxing at the spa, swimming at the pool..."

"I don't think I am such a mood as to relax like that."

"Stop being so stiff. We are stuck here for a while regardless of what we do. We could at the very least enjoy our time here.". He then approached Yaron and gave him a small nudge. "Besides, you said you wanted to go to a place like this before, haven't you?", said Ames with a small smile on his face.

Internally, Ames was a bit surprised at himself. Usually, he wouldn't act so cheery, especially in serious situations. But he found himself compelled to act this way. It wasn't anything bad however. It was from his desire to make Yaron feel comfortable with the situation. This also calmed himself a bit, as it meant that he knew how to make something good of this without losing his cool.

Unaware of it, their hands grew more slimmer as their fingers and nails grew longer, and gaining a manicure in the process. Their arms grew a little longer as well before gaining some muscle, making them stronger.

With a sigh, Yaron replied back: "I guess I could... I need some way to relieve my stress after all. This whole situation really tensed me up."

"So does that mean we could spend time toghether at the spa?", asked Ames with a bit of excitement in his voice.

"Yes... But only after we find a way to explain how we got here."

"Hah... You never change, do you?"

He knew that Yaron was a bit of a order-loving guy, liking things when they were safe or advantageous, but he knew deep down that he only cared for their safety. He didn't notice that his hair grew a bit longer while Yaron's lightened up a bit more.

Just then, the two heard some noise coming from the front.

"What was that?"

"I don't know. It came from behind that rock in front of us."
1511322111121211.title: Easing the tension

15113221111212111.content:
When they looked over the rock, at about 50 feet in the distance, they saw a person on a dock who seemed to be trying to put some boxes in a motorboat.

"Look! A person!"

"Let's go talk to them!"

The two then began running towards the dock, hoping whoever was there wouldn't leave by the time they got there. As they ran, their legs changed further. While they were quite sporty, the muscles in their calves seemed to give them a little boost in their speed, almost like they would run daily. This further proven by their thighs which expanded quite a bit as muscle began to form in them. They began to feel their legs a bit sore from the running, but that feeling quickly disappeared as they grew in height again. This also made them age a bit more, but Yaron aged a bit more, given that he was now a little taller than Ames. The former was now 14, and the latter 13.

When they got close enough to the dock, Ames yelled: "Hey! Wait for us!"

"Huh?"

The person looked at the direction of the shout, seeing the two boys running up to them. When the boys stopped to catch their breath, they were a bit surprised to see a woman in her mid-twenties with long brown hair tied in a low ponytail with a white T-shirt and black shorts. When they regained their breath they figured out that judging by her clothes and boxes, she was most likely a worker.

"How did you two got here?"

"Um... We got a bit lost..."

"I see... From where do you come?"

"Um... not too far, like about 500 meters or so..."

Ames was trying to find for an explanation as to how they got there, but...

"Are you the guests that Hanzo-sama told us about?"

"Huh?"

"Hanzo-sama said that we are to expect quite a lot of guests today. He said that it was a way to have his students and their friends a little free time."

"Uh, yes! we are two of them."

"Great! I will take you to the main compound! But can you please help me with these boxes? They are a little heavy and some members of the staff couldn't come today."

"Sure, no problem."

"Oh! I almost forgot. My name is Natsumi. What is yours?"

Just as Ames was ready to talk, Yaron spoke in his stead.

"I am Yarin, and my friend is Amus."

"Yarin and Amus. Got it! Now shall we get started?"

The boys nodded and began to put the boxes in the boat. But here was something that Amus found a bit strange.

"That's weird... This lady seemed to accept that we are guests here without even asking how we got here.... And Yarin just stood quiet. I really thought he would object or panic... Is he trying to get in the role here?... And Hanzo... Why does this name feel so... familiar."
15113221111212111.title: A person

151132211112121112.content:
"So... about shinobi. Is there something else I should know about?"

Handan was continuing with the act of being interested in shinobi to try to pass more time. He was still a bit sceptical it would actually come true, but he found himself somehow starting to accept the idea...

"Well... they are divided into two groups. Good Shinobi and Evil Shinobi."

"W-What do you mean "Evil"?!"

"It's just a manner of speaking. In reality they are shinobi like all the others, the big difference being that they think a lot more flexible. They believe that it is actually better to commit certain sins if the goal you are to achieve is pure. Sure, there are some who use that excuse for money or fame, but not everyone is like that. Yhe Good Shinobi believe in the purity of one's deeds in achieving that which you want to accomplish. But they end up having more stiff believes as a result, so they deem the Evil Shinobi to be "sinful" because of their more ideas. But like the Evil Shinobi, there are also people who want to understand the thoughts of the ones called "evil". So to be precise, there are Good And Evil Shinobi who interact with eacother to understand their thoughts...."

During the explanation, their thighs continued to grow as more muscle formed in them. Also, their hips began to spread outwards as well. This made their swimming trunks become even more strained... Bu that quickly changed. They started to mend on their new proportions as they clung on them tighter then originally. Then, they started to shrink. Initially, they were just above their knees, but now they were around mid-thigh. Their color also started to change. The black lines on Handon's began to expand and cover the blue, while the white accents on Tiyli's also grew, beginning to swallow up the black.

After the explanation, Handon was with his mouth wide open, speechless belief at what he just heard. This made Tiyli a little surprised of his friend's reaction.

"W-What is it? Did I say something wrong...?"

"N-No! It's just that... you said it like you know this much already! Did you research it somewhere?"

"No... And don't try to flatter me. I only said what you asked me."

"I-I know...but still..."

Handon was certainly not expecting this. He heard Tiyli tell his nin-shinobi tales before, but he didn't know it was actually this deep. He just heard him tell about the action scenes, and not the actual plot, but... it really was impressive.

"By the way, which one do you think suits you better? A Good or Evil Shinobi?", asked Tiyli.
151132211112121112.title: Knowledge about shinobi

1511322111121211121.content:
"W-Why are asking that?", said a stunned Handan, not expecting such a question.

"Just to know. I am curious about what you think. I would personally go with Evil Shinobi. They seem to have more freedom of thought than the Good ones."

Handon was mentally trying to process a reply to the inquiry, but there were some other things that were on his mind as well."

"Why does he know so much?!... I mean, I know it is common knowledge, but... Wait... Is it?... Yeah, I think it is. I knew all that stuff already... But for him to know about it this good is really... In any case, I should think of an answer..."

Handon put his hand on his chin and began to think, while Tiyli was paciently waiting for his reply. as they were walking, once again they grew in height, this time quite a lot more. They became quite tall, with their legs being shapely and athletic as their thighs grew one last time, becoming really appealing. Their hips also grew as their rears began to expand as well. This put quite a lot of strain on their trunks, but they once again grew to accommodate their lower regions as they continued to shrink, now being at their mid-thighs. Their color kept modifying as Handon's as now mostly black, while Tiyli's was almost white, but in the case of the latter some yellow lines also formed on the sides of his hips. To finish it all up, they aged again: Handon to 15 and Tiyli to 19.

After a few minutes of thinking, Handon gave his reply.

"I think I would go with Evil Shinobi as well. I would go with Good, but having a little more freedom to what I can do is more appealing."

"I see. Very well Homdan."

"But if possible I would like not to have to work under someone. I want to find my won path at the end of the road myself, not with someone telling me what to do."

The answer stunned his friend a bit, but with an acknowledging nod and a little smile he said: " I see.. Thanks for telling me."

"No problem.". In his mind, Homdan thought:" I think he seems pleased. Wonder where that question came from however... Anyways, I am happy that we talked about this. It was a good way to say what we know about Shinobi... And I am glad that Tiyali finally said my name right."

As the two were walking, the sun shone brightly over them, which caused their skintone to change as well. Tiyali was gaining a yellowish tan, while Homdan's skin became tanned a bit more, like he was spending a lot of time in the sun. The only parts that didn't was the area around his crotch and surprisingly enough, his chest.

"The sun is very hot today."

"Yes... I am glad we were in our swimming suits today."
1511322111121211121.title: The answer

15113221111212111212.content:
On the dock, Amus and Yaron were helping Natsumi with putting the boxes in the boat. There were full of various sport sport equipment like volleyball or softball, some waterguns and so on.

"What are you going to do with these?"

"Oh, they are for you and the other guests. We took some extra just in case."

"I see. Thanks."

"There is no need to thank us. You came here to relax, right? We are doing our jobs for that. Besides, I am sure you all wanted a vacation.", said Natsumi with a smile.

Amus nodded and smile back, with Yaron also giving a small smile back. While they were working, the boys' skintone began to change. Amus' tanned a bit while Yaron's went the opposite route and paled a little bit.

When Natsumi left the two boys alone a bit, Amus whispered to Yaron: "Can I ask you something?"

"What is it?"

"Why didn't you said anything before? You seemed to be pretty calm given that we just went with the flow?"

Normally, Yaron would immediately panic when saying a lie, especially one of this caliber. While it was true that the wish was to have them spend time at a resort, they didn't knew anything about Hanzo or the group that was scheduled to arrive. So Amus expected some sort of nervousness from his friend.

Back with Yoali, Ichuaga and Mirakio, after about 15 minutes of relaxing in the mineral bath and talking with each other, they decided it was time for them to get out.

"That felt amazing. It sure was a long time since I last felt so relaxed."

"M-Me too... I-I think effects that Nozomi-san told us about are actually true... I-I was a bit doubtful a bit at first, but not anymore."

"This proves that the mineral bath is an efficient way to heal your body. I totally approve their idea to make more on the ship."

The three talked a bit more about the bath as they took out some towels to dry themselves up. They didn't thought it was odd for them to still have their shirts on and not be bothered by how wet they were. That was because they changed to match their bottoms. Their trunks finally lost their legs as they tightly held their large hips and their newly-formed bubble-shaped rears. Their color transition finished as well: pure black for Ichuaga, yellow with brown leopard prints on Mirakio and lime green with some darker green stripes for Yoali. The latter also gained an additional layer over the his swimsuit as a two-layered skirt that was the same material as the swimsuit strapped over it. Right now, they were without a doubt wearing bikini bottoms.

Their shirts, after losing their sleeves began to lose a lot of their material as they were now resting only below their pectoral region as the color started to change to match that of the bikinis. But that didn't happen for Mirakio as opposed to turning yellow, the shirt was actually turning a dark-blue with some patches of white still remaining.

Their hair has also grown longer in the time that passed. They were all at their mid-backs as their color finished changing: black for Ichuaga, light-blond for Yoali and dark-brown for Murakio. As Murakio was styling his hair into a side ponytail using a red ribbon he found on the counter next to the towels, he asked Ichuaga:

"I-I am sorry to ask so suddenly, but I-I was wondering... How are you and your brother these days?"

"Huh?"

"That's true... I haven't ask you that in a while myself. Do you two get along better?", asked Yoali, as he put a green hair clip in his hair.

"Well... me and Murasame... haven't talked with each other in a while... but last time I met him, most of the envy and distaste in his voice was gone... Actually, he seemed much more reserved than before..."

"Is he still upset about the whole family lineage thing?"

"I think he is angry more at himself rather than me... but he decided to let me go down the shinobi path as he had begun making preparations to take over father's company. He doesn't have the skill to become a shinobi... but he is really capable of leading the company.... I am happy for him."

At the moment, Ichuaga had now another family, with Murasame being his brother rather than Katsusari. Not that they could be seen as siblings given their really different appearances. He still cared a great deal for him... and he considered him like a sibling even if he wasn't one.

"Um... I-I am sorry to interrupt, but would you two come with me to my room a bit?", asked Murakio.

"I-Is something the matter?"

"I-I can't find something and I want your h-elp if I can to find it."

""Sure. Of course we'll help.""

Murakio smiled at his friends' reply. After Yoali turned off the jacuzzi, they all left the bath to Murakio's room.
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: Getting out of the bath

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
The three soon reached Murakio's room, but they realized something.

"I almost forgot, don't we need a key card for us to open the door?"

"I-I told Yozacua-san to let it open in case we need something. There aren't many people around, so I-I thought it wouldn't be a problem to let it open."

"I see. And it would be kind of problematic to take it with us while we are in our swimsuits. I left mine at the reception."

The three went inside to see two large beds one next to each other with a few organized stacks of clothes on one of them as well as some pieces of luggage that were half-done.

"So what exactly are we looking for?", asked Ichuaga while coughing a bit afterwards. He alongside his friends were feeling something in their throats as their voices started to rise in pitch.

"Y-You will see when you find it. I-I'll look under the beds. Y-You please look in the drawers and the closet."

His friends were a bit confused at what would they be looking for, but decided to look at what it would be first, seeing that Murakio was unwilling to tell them yet. As they were looking around, their waists compressed as their backs curved to better fit their anatomy. After 5 minutes passed, their waists were small and waspish with some muscle still being prominent as well. Soon, in a drawer, Yoali found something inside and gave out a sigh.

"Is this what you were looking for?", asked Yoali, showing the others a scary-looking mask with yellow horns and fangs, a monstrous face and a patch of black hair on the top.

"Ah! There it was!", exclaimed Murakio as he rushed over to Yoali and picked up the mask and put it on.

"Good. Now everything is fine.", said Murakio in a deeper, more threatening voice.

His friends sighed as the feeling of something clogging their throats was gone. As a result, all of them, even Murakio had now much higher-pitched voices.

"If you simply wanted us to find your mask, you could've sait it, but..."

"I... We thought you said you would try to leve it behind during the trip to try to boost your morale."

"I... said that. But I wondered: "What if something comes up and I will need my mask?" It could scare away people or animals that are getting too close."

"But the whole idea was to get others closer to you."

"Oh... Right... I... forgot about that..."

"Does Yozacua-san know about this?"

"She does... He sighed when I told him that I am bringing over the mask.... But I just... feel a lot more comfortable with it. I can't help it.", said a slightly dejected Murakio as he sat on his bed.

Seeing him down, Yoali and Ichuaga nodded to each other and decided to sat next to him on the bed.
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: A little search

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
"I understand that you feel safe with your mask on, but that doesn't mean you always have to wear it. It is true that you feel scared of others whenever you encounter them without your mask, but you fail to talk to them properly because you believe the mask in the only way to speak with them.", said Ichauga softly.

"That is true, but... This mask, it gives me courage... strength and confidence. I do not know if I can talk to others properly without it."

"I've been with you since the beginning. You've always hid your face to comfort yourself when others treated you badly. But whether if it was a paper bag or and ogre mask, you always gained more confidence if you covered up your face. Why is that? You are beautiful and strong. You don't need to hide anything."

As they were talking, their faces rounded up and became softer as their eyes changed color. Murakio's green eyes got a shade darker, but nothing more than that. Meanwhile, Ichuaga's brown eyes became dark blue and Yoali's blue became green.

"I know what are you saying Yoali, but... This mask is also a gift from Grandfather Kurogane."

"Oh, I see."

"When I was little, he gave me this mask to try to make me feel a lot braver when I wore it. Soon, I found that I had a lot of confidence just by wearing it, so from that day, except a few instances, I never walked outside the school without wearing it. It is something that came from grandfather, so I..."

"Then wear it as a charm instead."

"Huh?"

"If you do not want to part with it I understand. I would feel as well if it was something precious to me. But wear it not as a means to hide yourself, but as a reminder of what you have accomplished."

Murakio was amazed by Ichuaga's words. It is true, the mask is something he will never discard and he never had the courage to not to wear it... but what if he just had it as a talisman that have him hope and courgage. Kurogane told him before, that one day he would need to stop wearing the mask, but he never said he had to discard it.... It was something that never crossed his mind so far.

While pondering, they grew up to their final age: Yoali to 17 and Ichuaga and Murakio to 18. Their tops changed further as well as they lost their backs and were now clinging to them just by two small straps of material that held them on their shoulders. As the color was also near completion, Yoali's also gained a few fills at the edges specifically on the top part which gained a large patch of white material. His skirt bottom also finished growing, covering his bikini and the top of his legs before fusing with the swimwear.

"Icharuga is right Murakimo. You can't just deceive yourself that you need to wear it just to protect you. Like I said before, you do not need to hide yourself from anyone. If the mask is important to you, I understand, but don't wear it as an excuse not to fear others' rejection. We have spend our childhood togheter, so of course I know that you did the same before. It is time to move forward now..."

"I....I see.... Thank you, Icharuga, Yoli. I really appreciate what you just said. I feared that I will lose grandfather's memory by not wearing the mask. But in reality, I was just trying not to get hurt.... I will try not to wear it today. After we land, I will... try and take it off."

"I am happy to hear that."

"Yes... Me too."

The two then hugged Murakimo and shared a moment of silence before Murakimo remembered something.

"Oh, I almost forgot. Weren't we supposed to go and meet the others at the pool?"

"You're right... We should go now."

The three then left the room togheter and headed towards the pool. The three haven't changed too much in terms of personality, but whatever was happening to them, surely have made them a lot closer.
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: A little encouragement

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
In the arcade, Yozacua and Katsusari were playing the game the former chose as Hiyage was watching them play on the side. As they were playing, she continued changing. Her bottoms became a pair of bikinis as the top finished morphing, with a big black line serving as the ends of her top on the sides. The color also finished changing as it became dark-orange with brown spots all over it, almost like a giraffe pattern. Below the end of her top, a few more snake tattoos formed on her neck, but like the one on her breast it couldn't be seen at the moment. Her hair, which was now mostly green now barely touched her shoulders as two unruly bangs were now framing her face. Being a girl, meant that her tansformation was quicker, so she should finish up soon...

"Man, this game is more difficult than I thought...", said Katsusari, in a slightly higher pitched voice, as his character almost got hit by an enemy general. "I thought we just had to run on the battlefield and attack the enemy, but all these missions they give us makes it much harder..."

"Indeed... I am quite surprised they managed to make a game to keep you this focused on the task at hand.", continued Yozacua, again in a higher voice.

"It sure doesn't make you feel bored...", said Hiyage in agreement.

The two had to defend their base before launching a fire attack on a big group of enemy ships which had been tied together as a part of a plot. Then they ran along the hips defeating enemy generals as well as helping their allies. Katsusari managed by accident to unlock a secret winning condition by telling an enemy officer to retreat, which in a way scored a few more points for him. But the stage was nearly over as both headed to finish up the boss of the stage.

As they were playing, their trunks ended becoming bikkini bottoms: white with blue stripes for Katsusari and pink with white dots for Yozacua. Their shirts also lost their backs and were starting to shrink further, showing a lot of theri chest region as the color was starting to match that of their bikinis. Their hair also ended their transition. Katsusari's long blond hair flowed all the way to his mid-back as a blue headband with a ribbon on either side formed on top of his head. Yozacua's became dark-blue that was styled in a bob-cut as a cherry blosson flower formed on the left side of his head.

Just as they finished this session of changes, Katsusari managed to defeat the boss as a quick cinematic movie played after they finsihed the stage, with the officer Katsusari spoke to appearing at the end to meet the group.

"Well, who do you think won?"

"I think you did Yozacua. Wou had almost 100 more people KOed than me."

"Thanks, but... You defeated the boss and you were the one that unlocked the special condition, so I think you won."

"Are you sure?"

"Yes, I am."

"Woohoo! Great!", exclaimed Katsusari as Yozacua gave out a sigh.

Their personalities did a complete 180 degrees from what they once were at this point. Hiyage, who would often be much more energetic and perky became quite cool and downright calm person, who didn't show much emotion. Yozacua, who one would act childish and quite hyperactive was now not only well-mannered and pacient, but also seemed to act as the voice of reason. And Katsusari was now a lot more fun-loving and competitive as he decided to take a more direct appoach on things then he would ever have done before... and not to mention that at times would steal glances at Hiyage'chest from time to time. Not to mention, that right now, he and Icharuga were no longer siblings, but he didn't bother about this, since in his mind, they never were.

"So... are we going to play a game as well Katsusari?"

"You bet we will Hiyage! Game on!"
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: A game of wits

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
After completing the previous stage, they simply decided to go the next one in line. Like before, they had a few characters to pick from, all of them different than the ones from before.

"Huh... So we have three new guys, plus the one we recruited last stage... I think I will go with this wild-looking guy that wields a... Is that a polearm?"

"I think it is called a voulge. Grandfather Kurogane mentioned it in one of his lessons in weapons.", said Yozacua.

"Figures you would know something like that. So which one are going to pick up?"

Hiyage looked a bit at the screen before making his choice.

"I'll take this one." The character she picked was shorter man than the others with a big hat and his face covered up, with his weapon being a what looked to be some sort of fan.

"Huh? Why him?"

"He looks interesting.... And I want to know how he fights..."

"If you say so..."

"And he is the one that linked the ships in the previous fight..."

"Huh? Wait... Really?"

"Now that you mention it, he is... I never noticed."

"You see things differently when you are a spectator. And that doesn't apply just to games."

The boys were quite surprised at Hiyage perception and silently nodded to themselves to that as well... in games and training...

The stage began as the two began to fight the enemies near the camp. In this time, they all had to rub their eyes as they itched a bit. Unbeknownst to them, their eyes changed color Katsusari's brown eyes became a greenish-blue as Yozacua's light-blue eyes became dark-blue. Hiyage's was however the most prominent as her brown eyes not only became amber but also slitted. Also, on her left hip, another snake tattoo formed, but despite being visible, no one noticed anything being different.

As the battle progressed, Hiyage noticed something strange and decided to go on another path than the one he was instructed.

"Why are going the say way as me? Weren't you supposed to go the other way?"

"There is something that I must confirm..."

After defeating a few more enemies, they reached a garrison in which Katsusari went to the next section of the map as Hiyage looked a bit around... and saw a ladder on the side.

"Bingo."

After climbing the ladder, suddenly, an ambush unit appeared out of nowhere.

"W-Where did they come from?"

"As I thought... There was no way they would just leave a portion of the map so unguarded..."

The boys were amazed by her tactful insight, but Katsusari had to continue playing. After making short work of the ambush, Hiyage continued fighting with her unti on the side of the map as Katsusari continued the assault from the center.

During the fight, Katsusari stole a few glances towards Hiyage, especially towards her chest. Her breasts grew to a large and proud D-cup as the split section of her top became a square which revealed a fair amount of her cleavage. But Katsusari didn't notice that and was almost hit by an officer after looking too much in a different direction.

"Look at the game."

"O-Oh. Sorry."
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: The next stage

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
The rest of the stage went relatively easy. They had to rescue their commander and had to deal with a surprise attack in front of the enemy base, but their efforts combined really eased everything a lot. After defeating most of the enemies inside the enemy's castle they reached the final boss and the one who finished him off... was Hiyage. Afterwards, a small clip in which they shown the people accepting their commander as new ruler of their land with Hiyage's character, watching from behind.

"Well, I think it is obvious. You beat the boss and you unlocked the secret condition. You had definitely won, Hiyage."

"Thanks..."

"It sure was an entertaining game though. The others must get a load of it."

"Yes... I am sure Yumi-san would be interested in such a game as well."

"I know Homura would be...."

After complimenting the game, Katsusari took a look at Hiyage. But this time, he didn't look at her impressive bust, but rather admiring her. A single, simple earring appeared on her left ear as one last tattoo formed on her left shoulder. Lastly, her hair became completely green and her face gained a slightly sharper expression despite her stoic and emotionless behavior.

"You know, I've always envied you."

"Huh? Why?", asked the girl a bit intrigued by the question.

"To start off, you always keep your cool in battles. That is why you beat me so bad the first time we met. You were always calm, which made you a lot better that ever once before that. I know I told you need to put more passion and emotion when fighting, but you always look so collected that makes me think that being more observant than just rushing in, like what you do, should be the way to go..."

Katsusari looked down as he knew that he just said something that goes against his principles, but he decided to say it anyways. Yozacua was also silent after his friend's comment. The same thing happened during his battle with Katsusari, as he rushed in to end the fight quicker rather than being methodical, but he eventually defeated him in combat in their second fight. It was really close, but Katsusari won by a hair in the end.... But it seemed that he still doubted himself over his battles.

As they were pondering, the boys' faces changed, becoming more rounded and softer as their eyes also did the same. They also felt a tightening in ther necks, but ignored the feeling.

Hiyage gave out a sigh, as she put her hand on Katsusari's shoulder.

"Why are saying that as if it has relevance?". Katsusari immediately looked at Hiyage as she continued: "Being calculated in battle is one thing, but not taking action is something else... You always have been the first out the gate to fight, and have always given 110 percent when others would just enter the fray just to aid others instead of doing something themselves. And that applies to life as well. You enjoy every day with all your heart and never think that something is monotone and repetitive. I was bored of this world and only did what I was instructed what to do... but you ignited a flame in me when we fought that day... A flame which despite being small, still burns brightly."

The boys remained silent, letting her finish as Katsusari was now really eager to know what she thinks. In the meantime, the aged up one last time. Katsusari went up to 18 years old as Yozacua went to 17. Their waists slimmed down quite a lot as they became toned. Their backs also went into a permanent arch, giving them much better flexibility. Lastly, their vocal chords tightened as their voices became those which befitted girls their age.

Hiyage however, with her aging up to 18 years old, and her body growing a bit bigger in her chest and butt as well as tanning a bit more, finally finished her change.

"... And that is why I am grateful to you. Thank you for reminding me to live your life with passion, Katsusagi.", said the girl with a rare, small smile on her lips.

After taking a second to process the information, Katsusagi blushed a bit and scratched his cheek as he replied back: "T-Thanks Hikage... Although, all I did was to fight you."

"That was more than enough. And I would like to fight you again soon."

"You mean a sparring match? I'm in!"

On the side, Yozacua looked at the two interact and gave out a peaceful smile as he slowly closed his eyes.

"Why are you silent Yozakua? Are you feeling lonely?"

"H-Huh? No I'm not!", said the boy with a small accent in his voice.

"If you say so... Well, it's time we head back. As much as I would like to keep playing the game, we have to meet the others."

The others nodded as they turned off the console and left and arcade. Katsusagi got closer to Hikage and slyly asked her while performing a grabbing action with his hands. : "Well, if you are grateful to me, do you mind if I ask for a reward?"

In a monotone voice, Hikage replied: "Maybe later..."
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: Hiyage ends it

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
A few minutes ago...

Imy and Murasati finally got outside, with the latter being a bit reluctant to not stay in his room.

"The sun is very bright... We should return back to our room...."

"Murasati, you are not a ghoul or a vampire. Stop complaining, it is getting tiresome."

"I am sorry... If you are upset than I can leave...."

"I am not upset. But please understand.... I just want you not to be so secluded."

"I understand..."

Murasati meekly walked alongside Imy as the latter sighed and thought to himself: "Why is he so fragile? I have been harsh with him before, but he should know by know that I don't want to actually hurt him... I just wish not to feel like is a burden... I wish Miyabi would be here to support me on this..."

As the two were walking, their waists began to compress, Imy's much more than Murasati's. Their shirts have alos gone up to just below their pectoral region as their neckline plunged a bit on top of that. Lastly, their color and started to match that of their bottoms.

Soon, they reached the outside pool, which at the moment was empty.

"Come on Murasati, let's go for a swim."

"But I don't think Bebeby would want to take a bath yet..."

"Just leave him on the sunbed, nobody will take him."

"But..."

"Please Murasati, just leave him for a few minutes and swim a little."

"Okay..." Murasati was unwilling to let Bebeby out of his grasp but realized that he would make Imy upset if he resused. So he decided to make a compromise this time. After he carefully let Bebeby on a sunbed beneath an umbrella, he walked together with Imy, who put away his glasses to the edge of the pool.

Imy jumped in the water as Murasati went down using the pool's ladder. The pool wasn't too long or deep, but it was without a doubt longer than the one you would find at a regular school.

"The water isn't too cold is it?"

"No... it is all right."

"So is there something in particular wyou wan to do."

"Just the float stance... But using the arms as well this time..."

"Okay."

There weren't many swimming styles Murasati knew, so Imy decided to go with whatever choice he made. The two went into position and after pushing the wall with their feet, they began to swim. As they were moving, their hair, which was floating in the water finished changing. Imy's became a light-brown color, as the wair grew a bit through his scrunchies, as the portion that was not held grew to his upper back as two long bangs were now framing his face. Murasati's became completely purple as it continued to grow more and more. It finally stopped once it was at his rear's level, the boy now having a beautiful mane of hair.

While swimming, the two each wanted to ask the other some questions, but at the moment, neither of them knew what to say.
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: At the pool

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
After they both swam four times the length of the pool, Imy came next to Murasati and asked him:

"Do you feel more relaxed now?"

"Yes..."

"Do you want to do another style?"

"Maybe some front crawl if it is okay with you..."

"Sure."

The two went into position again and after kicking the wall, they began swimming. Imy was going much faster than Murasati who was now just slowly striding through the water. As they swam, their trunks finished becoming bikini bottoms: Murasati's were purple with white dots adorning them while Imy's was now a camouflage-green color. Also, as water splashed over their faces, they softened and rounded out as their eyes became bigger. Imy's became a few shades darker of green than his usual ones, while Murasati's blue eyes became a really dark purple, even more so than his eyes.

They however were lost in thought, and the changes went under their radar.

"Am I too stubborn?", thought Imy. "It is true that I am trying to make him more open to the others and less like a hermit, but... Is my approach too forceful? I can't really tell since he is constantly apologizing when he thinks he did something wrong and complaining about being outside whenever I try to get him out... There really is no reason to always stay inside on his computer and with his toy... But I haven't actually tried to put myself in his shoes, did I? Maybe this is just his way to feel comfortable. He became like this because of what happened that day... Damn my weakness..."

Murasati was also in deep thought: "Imy... I wonder if he is angry at me again... But I don't want to stay outside so much and he knows it. I speak more often now and I don't want to just stay alone in my room all the time anymore... So why isn't he happy? He knows I can't just change and become an outdoor person... And yet... He could be just trying to break the walls I made... For a long time I just wanted to be with only Bebeby and let Imy be with Miyabi instead of me... What should I do...?"

The two were going through some pretty deep matters right now regarding their relationship. Gone was that awkwardness between the two, now that their personalities pretty much reversed themselves. Murasati became now so shy, that even Murakimo wouldn't compare to him right now. And on top of that, he was really withdrawn and had really low self-confidence that made him really difficult to appoach. Only a few manged to get him to open up, one of them being Imy. Speaking of him, unlike before, when he just wanted to remain silent to escape the situations that he deemed uncomfortable or annoying, now became quite vocal in everything he did, speaking his thoughts in brutal honesty. He also admires Miyabi now a lot, and is a really good friend with her, as his memories changed to fit that.

Speaking of memories, they pretty much forgot about their whole initial predicament and was now just spending their day like any other day. As for the relationship between them, there was now more than a fraternal respect and care for one another... They were now siblings.
1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.title: Continue swimming

1511322111121211121212112112111111122112.content:
After a few minutes pass, they did 4 laps each, Imy finishing much quicker as he waited on the side of the pool for his new brother. Eventually, Murasati finished as well and went next to his sibling. There was an awkward silence before Imy decided to speak up.

"Murasati... There is something I want to say to you."

"W-What is it?"

"I wanted... to apologize."

"F-For what?!", asked a baffled Murasati, clearly not expecting such an answer.

"I always push you around, and try to get you out of your room to interact more with others.. without taking into account your feelings. I know I do what I do because I want to make up less secluded... but you always were so reluctant. Initially, I thought it was just because you grew accustomed to your way of living, but soon I realized that you are doing it because you feel scared of what could happen. I now you still blame yourself what what happened that day... And I am sorry for not noticing it..."

Imy was surely feeling quite guilty for being ignorant to his brother's turmoil for so long, and what was worse is that he never actually noticed it until recently.

As he was talking, both of them aged one last time: Imy to 21 and Murasati to 18. Their backs became arched as their shoulders rounded and their waists slimmed one last time, with Imy's being a couple of inches smaller than his brother's. Finally, they felt something in their throats, and they swallowed a few times to get rid of whatever it was. After a few gulps, the feeling was done as both of them had voices which belonged to girls their age.

Suddenly, Murasati shook his head and looked at Imy with a serious gaze.

"You are with nothing at fault big brother Imyu!" Imyu was really surprised at the sudden outburst as his brother continued. "It is true that you usually try to make me do things I don't like... But that doesn't mean I deny that they are good for me. Going outside, speaking with others, not spending so much time with Bebeby... I would've denied that I need such things before, but after I became an elite shinobi with you, I decided to give everything a try... At first, it was really uncomfortable, to the point I wanted to go back home, but in the end I started to accept all these new things... And I even enjoy them now. So I thank you for that!"

"Murasatki..."

"It's just...". He began to lose the confidence in his voice as he continued to talk. "You always seem so displeased or disappointed with what I do and how I act, so I thought that you might think I am just dead weight to the group... or that I am simply bothering you and-"

"That's not true!"

Not it was Murasatki's turn to remain wide-eyed as Imyu continued: "I could never thought of you as such! I push you from behind not because I want you to change or because I am annoyed of waiting for you to do something. I do it because I want you to stop this cycle of self-loathing that you fell in... I know that you have a low opinion in yourself, ...but how many would protect his friends in earnest the way you do? You are just like me and Miyabi, nowhere near inferior. I consider you to be as reliable as Miyabi... and not to mention that I am your brother... "Yes, Ikaruga-san. Me, Yagyu-chan, Minori-chan Shiki-chan and Haruka-san enjoyed our bath here. The feeling in there is amazing."

"But does that mean you already had one?"

"Yes. We went at the baths from the ship and we relaxed in there. We talked with some members of the crew. Apparently, it has a lot of benefits for your body.", said Yomi.

"You don't say... That explains why my skin feels so soft it glistens!"

"I think that is an exaggeration Haruka-sama."

"Still, if it really has rejuvenating properties, I say we should all go in there tomorrow. The bath is big enough for all of us I believe. It even looked like an Olympic pool in there."

"I want to go there with Ryobi-chan there right now! Can we go now please...?!"

"No! It's the middle of the day almost and I don't want to just stay inside on a sunny day. Besides, I think we should all go and pick some clothes. I know that the manager said it is okay to be in our swimsuits, but it feels kind of bare now. We must've been like this since morning."

"Speaking of letting things bare, after I talked with Yomi and Ikaruga..." Murakumo stopped talking to remove her mask which revealed her nervous but still determined face to everyone. "... I-I decided to not wear the mask that often..."

"Eh?! Really Murakumo-chan?!"

"Y-Yes... I-I want to talk with the others freely like you all do... I-I want to be closer to you all."

"I am happy... Finally someone I can relate to...", said Murakumo.

"I am happy for you Mura- Kyaaah!"

"While on the subject of being a bit more bold, what about some little fun right now Ikaruga?"

"K-Katsuragi-san! Let go of my chest this instant!"

Looking at the other talking and having fun, Asuka, Yumi, Miyabi and Homura looked with smiling faces at the rest.

"Looks like all the differences from before are still there, but they seem to finally get along, huh?"

"Yes Miyabi-san. I am happy that we manged to bury the animosity between us and moved forward together."

"Well, it was bound to happen. I mean, after everything we've been through lately, we had to get drawn to each other eventually."

Listening to their friends, Asuka jumped in front of them and declared:

"We are a shinobi family after all, aren't we? After all, this "family" exists based on the bonds between us, right? Then it's obvious that we are inseparable right now, right? As a "family" I mean."

The three replied back with a smile.

"I agree."

"Of course."

"Obviously."

The four then returned to the rest, ready for the feast Hanzo made for them tonight, celebrating their friendship and bonds along with the others. As if on instinct, Asuka held Homura's hand without even noticing, which caused Homura to blush on the way back.

The papers made the the wishes come true, despite not actually being what was originally intended. Still, The essence of the dreams was made reality, and everything was to the girls exactly as it should be... On the side note, Hanzo didn't know what the wishes did, nor did the fact that they were even made. For him, it was merely a day made for his granddaughter and her friends.

15213221211.content:
"I want to know what the game Jessie plays is all about!"

"Me too!"

Twins Brandon and Aaron Thomas were currently in their house, alone, waiting for their parents to come home to go together to the park and play. Both had blond hair and blue eyes and were both 6 years old. They were currently dressed in black T-shirts with a white jacket to go on top of them and they wore dark-blue jeans on. Since today was a little cold, they had to wear something that would make sure they wouldn't get cold. Still, this wasn't enough to break their enthusiasm, as they already wore their white sneakers, already prepared to get outside.

But there was something that bothered the two boys. Their older cousin Jessie, who was an avid gamer, bought game that drew the two's attention. It seemed to be called Persona 4 Golden according to him, and it was about a group of teenagers solving a mystery and fighting supernatural monsters, while the protagonist, a transfer student, gets to know his new friends, his caretakers and himself better, making close bonds with all of them. This intrigued the two boys, as most other games Jessie played were either fighting, hack and slash or strategy games, and they didn't appeal to them as much as this one. They wanted to play it themselves, but having an age restriction, their parents wouldn't let them, much to their disappointment.

But Jessie gave them a new ray of hope, as they revealed the series also had an animated series, which was airing on TV. However, since the show was after their sleeping time, and since their parents wouldn't let them watch on the computer, they had no choice but to try and get more information from Jessie. He told him a bit more about the story, as well as that the protagonist's name in the show was Yu Narukami, but he didn't want to get himself into trouble by disclosing too much about the game's darker themes.

"Why didn't he tell us more? I mean, I know the story is a bit scary, but still, a bit more info wouldn't have been a problem."

"He must be afraid mom and dad will get mad at him for telling us."

"Probably. But we didn't ask him for all the details."

"That's true as well..."

The twins had similar hobbies and personalities, making it hard at times to say who is who. Both liked to do sport, but weren't actually too open with the other kids either, as they preferred spending time with their family. They made a few friends at the kindergarten, but only a handful so far. They just liked spending time more with each other, but they still wanted to somehow make more friends.

"So what should we do? Can we ask Jessie to let us see an episode when we visit him next time?"

"I don't think he would want to. And I don't want to get him in trouble because of us."

"Me neither..."

The two were a bit at a loss here with their dilemma. They wanted to know more about the characters and the story, but on the same token, they didn't know how... And besides Yu, Chie and Yukiko, another two characters from the game drew their interest a bit. According to Jessie, they were best of friends and would do anything together, their relationship somehow mimicking theirs in a sense, almost wishing they would meet them in person.

"I didn't want to use this... But I am too curious.", said Aaron as he picked up a coin from his pocket.

"Isn't that the coin the old lady who we helped cross the street gave to us?"

"It is. Remember what she said? That if we wish for something, this coin will fulfill it, but just once or twice. Maybe we should wish to meet the characters."

"I don't know... It seems a bit of a waste.", said Brandon. "Shouldn't we wait for another idea to come to us? Maybe we could wish for something else."

"If we wait more, we might forget about the coin, or mom could take by accident, or who knows what other thing might happen... Besides, didn't you say you wanted to meet Chie? You said you liked her personality."

"True... But what exactly should we wish then? For us to be in their world alone? It could be dangerous."

Aaron took a second to ponder before figuring out an idea.

"I got this.", he said, with Brandon looking at him expectantly as he grasped the coin tight. "We wish we could be in the Persona 4 world, spending time with the group, as much as Chie and Yukiko would."

The two were a bit skeptical of the whole wish thing, as it seemed weird an old lady to give them a magic coin just like that, but much to their surprise, the coin shined brightly, the light enveloping both of them. Once the light faded away, the two were gone.
15213221211.title: Chie and Yukiko

152132212111.content:
As soon as the light came, it faded away just as quick. The two boys closed their eyes in case the radiance returned for about 30 more seconds before opening their eyes. They needed a bit to adjust their eyes after the light, but as soon as their sight returned, they were stunned by what they saw.

"What.. the..."

"No way..."

They were no longer in their living room. Instead they appeared to be on a street, but nowhere near their home town. They were on a small road which seemed to be in the countryside, with a few houses on their left and some crop fields to their right. The sky was slightly cloudy, and judging by the temperature, it seemed to be morning.

It wasn't the setting or the different hour that surprised the two boys, but rather a sign which was at a fork in the road. The writing on it seemed to be in a different language, and none of the letters seemed to look even remotely like the English alphabet they knew. But there was something about that seemed familiar to them when it came down to the letters.

"Is that...Japanese?!"

"You're right! It looks just like the writing that was in some of Jesse's games! Does this mean... We're in Japan?!"

"That's... awesome! The wish worked! And how doubtful you were about the wish!"

"Hey you were as well!", said Brandon with a pout. "So... This is the town the game takes place right? Yasoinaba... or something like that?"

"Yeah, I think that's the name of the place... You know, it's not that bad. It kind of looks like the places in the countryside we saw on vacation.", said Aaron, as he looked around.

"True... Maybe Jesse was exaggerating a bit with how remote this place is. I mean, there aren't any farms or anything like that... This just looks like the suburbs to me."

The two continued looking around, until they heard some footsteps coming their way. When they looked at the direction of the steps, they saw a boy wearing what appeared to be a high school uniform. He was carrying a fishing rod and a box, which they assumed it was for the bait and hooks, and judging by the size, even for the fish he would catch. But what surprised them was his appearance. His bowl-shaped silver hair and matching eyes were enough to recognize as the protagonist of the Persona game, Yu Narukami. When he noticed the two boys, he looked a bit confused and walked up to them.

"Hi there... Haven't seen you two before... Are you here to take a stroll?", asked Yu, who much to their surprise, they were able to understand him.

"Uh... In a way..."

"Where are your parents?"

The two kids looked at each other, as they began whispering with their backs turned to Yu, who could only watch in confusion.

"What do we do? Should we tell him about the wish?"

"No! He will not believe us regardless of how we try to say it. A magic coin? No regular person would believe it's real. And if we show it to him and he would want to try it, we won't have our way home anymore."

"So... What should we do then?"

"I have an idea..."

Aaron was a bit surprised upon hearing Brandon's plan, but thought it would still be better than nothing. After discussing a bit more, they turned to Yu.

"Actually... We aren't from here. We got a bit lost. We were with a group and we got separated."

"... Lost? You mean you are tourists?"

"Y-Yeah."

Yu pondered a bit as he looked the children in front of him.

"What should I do? My uncle is busy today and he told me he will not be free until the afternoon. I could take them to the police station, but I don't want to make them feel uncomfortable. They look like foreigners, so they couldn't know the policies and rules... I could leave them at home, but that would make Nanako uncomfortable, and maybe them as well... I could let them stay at the Amagi Inn until my uncle is free. Maybe there could actually have a place for them to stay until them... I hope Yukiko will not mind it."

With that, he told the boys: "Don't worry. I will take you somewhere to stay, until your situation could be solved. Do you mind?"

"No, not at all..", said Brandon, both he and Aaron, surprised and happy Yu bought their lie.

"Good. Can you come with me then?"

The boys nodded as they followed him. But then Yu noticed something.

"Oh, I almost forgot to introduce myself. I am Yu Narukami."

The two smiled a little, as they were now sure who he was.

"I am Brandon Thomas, and this is my brother Aaron.", smiled the two boys, as they followed Yu.
152132212111.title: They stay awake

1521322121111.content:
As they walked, there was an awkward silence among the three. Brandon and Aaron were a bit confused as to how they could understand Yu, as he was speaking English instead of Japanese. It was a bit strange how he managed to to speak their language so well, as they knew the English voices in the game were an option, not a necessity. But there was also the thing with the mystery Yu and his friends were trying to solve. The two wanted to ask him, as Jesse didn't gave them too many details regarding the whole story, but they couldn't just ask him out of the blue something like that without drawing suspicion that they know more than they seem. The problem was, they weren't exactly sure how to have a good conversation with him, as they didn't know too many things about him.

Yu was in a similar position. While he worked as a caretaker before, and the two boys looked a lot more polite than some of the kids he took care of, he didn't know what to talk about. The fact that they were foreigners made him a bit nervous, as he never talked with someone outside Japan before. Rise had a few meetings with people from abroad, and according to her, he just had to act natural, as any tourists would like people to not seem nervous or on edge. He knew he couldn't ask them about how they got lost or where their parents are, as they already seemed to be a bit flustered already when he talked about how they got lost. There also was something else that made him curious about the two, but for the moment, he decided to have a normal conversation with them.

"So what do you think of Yasoinaba? Do you like it here?"

"Yeah!", said Brandon. "It's looks great in our opinion. It is a pretty big town actually."

"We heard it was just a rural place in the boonies, but it looks more like the suburbs of a city."

"That's true... I guess people who come from the big cities think it's too quiet here. It's also a bit hard to get here. Only the train, and a few roads, one that leads to the highway pass through here."

"It still looks nice. I kind of like it here." Aaron's response put a small smile on Yu's face as he then asked: "By the way, is there a tourist attraction here or something like that?"

"Tourist attraction?"

Yu began thinking of places that might be popular they continued walking. However, without anyone's notice, something was happening to the two boys. They felt a bit of discomfort as their sneakers seemed to be getting tighter to their feet. They merely brushed it off, but in reality, the shoes compressed down, as their laces vanished without a trace. Their feet also were a bit cramped in the tighter footwear, but then, both the sneakers and the feet started to slowly grow.

"...Well we have a shrine. And on the hills, there is a popular picnic spot... But there aren't really any attractions here. But I guess a lot of people from the area come to Junes or the Amagi Inn quite often.

"The Amagi Inn?", asked Brandon as both he and his brother recognized Yukiko's family name.

"Yes, it is an local inn which offers quite a lot of amenities. Politicians, actors or artists sometimes go there to relax, as it is considered a good place for those who want to stay somewhere quiet. And that's where you two will stay until I can get some help for you."

"Huh? We aren't coming with you?"

"I am sorry, but I need to go to school and help with the school festival. That's why I am also wearing my uniform."

"But I thought you went fishing."

"I did. I just finished. I am wearing my uniform in case I would run late. I know it's early in the morning, but it's a hobby of mine. I even caught a few fishes... But I must decide whether I should cook them or sell them..."

The two boys were a bit impressed by Yu. He seemed like a polite, caring young man who also had a thing for fishing. They learned more from a few minutes of talking with him than what Jesse's generic description gave. They were still a bit sad that he would part ways with him, but they brightened up once they remembered that if they go to the inn, they might meet Yukiko.

In the meantime, their feet finished growing, becoming a bit larger than they were before. But what was curious was that they seemed more petite than how a boy's foot would look like, as their nails also seemed to have gained a pedicure. As for their sneakers, they began to darken, the white making way for a brownish color while the material began to change, starting to look more like leather.
1521322121111.title: On the way

15213221211111.content:
"Do you like it here?"

"To be honest, I really do", answered Yu to Aaron's question. "At the beginning, I was really uncaring of the setting. For me life would go on without much concern of what's around me. I really didn't care much, as I would be staying here for just a year and then return home... But many things have happened ever since my arrival here. And as time passed, I gained many friends here.
