I am still trying to discover, not just my friends, but myself as well. I feel like I couldn't be who I am right now if it wasn't for them."

The two were a bit impressed by Yu's perspective. They already knew from Jesse that Yu was in the game, starts off as someone without a real personality, but he develops himself as a person after interacting with many people from the town. And according to him, the show pretty much confirms his evolution, While he was just a fictional character, currently, he was as real as they were, and the brothers had to admit Yu was indeed a really nice person.

During Yu's monologue, their hair began to grow a little. But while Aaron's hair grew only to the point it touched his ears, Brandon's were already almost covered, as his hair seemed to grow a bit faster.

"It sounds like you really care about your friends."

"I do.", said Yu with a smile.

"Can you tell us about them?"

"Sure. If you would like to, I would be happy to tell you a bit about them."

The boys nodded as Yu began describing his friends. He talked about Yosuke and how he was the son of Junes's manager, as well how great they understand each other, calling themselves "partners" at time. He then told them about Rise and their career as idol before coming to Inaba, admiring her bright personality, an that despite being a year younger than him, she would usually be the one who would bring the group's morale up. He then talked about the rest of his friends, about Kanji's hobby to knit and how caring he could be at times despite his appearance, about Naoto's work as a detective and how much he respected her knowledge over a lot things and about Teddie's memory loss and his comedic antics.

And then came the highlights for the two.

"And then there is Yukiko. I kept her and Chie last as we are now going to Yukiko's place and the two would often be together most of the times.

"The two are best friends then?"

"Very much so. Even of they have such different personalities, they get along perfectly. This is the result of a friendship that developed over the years. It is safe to say the two know each other inside out by this point.", said Yu as a joke.

He then told them about the two. Chie's was a complete tomboy who loved eating meat, kung-fu movies and doing any sort of physical activity. She would usually speak her mind openly and would be the first most of the times to voice her opinion.She would often go to the Samegawa Flood Plain to train and would invite Yu at times to spar together. Yukiko was pretty much her opposite. She was refined, usually calm and was quite smart as well. She is next to inherit the local inn, thus she would often help the employees from time to time as well. There was also a slightly weird side of her, as she would break into random laughing fits at times.

The two listened intently, wanting to know as much as possible about their favorite characters. But there was something that was budding inside them. Brandon was starting to have a small desire to be more like Chie in a way, as he would want to be as strong both mentally as well as physically as her, while Aaron started to admire Yukiko's more polite behavior as well as her drive to help others out, even it would be time consuming, rather than focusing only on personal development.

Meanwhile, their calves began to vibrate a little as their muscles began altering. They seemed to change into a more shapely form, as they got more flexible as well. But while Brandon's gained a bit more muscle, Aaron's were actually started to get more toned.

"So is any of the girls your girlfriend?", asked Brandon, which caught Yu off-guard.

"Huh? No, I am not in a relationship with anyone yet."

"Really? I mean, you sound really close to the girls."

"I am, but I would rather have more time before deciding on someone. It's complicated, but you two will understand when you become older."

The two were a bit surprised, as in the game, he had quite a few options to choose from. And the fact that he knew Chie and Yukiko for this long without being in a relationship with neither them or anyone else was actually hard to believe. They accepted Yu's answer, but wondered who would become Yu's girlfriend if he was to choose someone.
15213221211111.title: Still talking

152132212111111.content:
Eventually the three arrived at the inn, and the two younger boys were surprised to see how traditional it looked. They only caught a few glimpses of some screenshots of the interior, but the outside truly looked like a place you would put on a postcard. They certainly didn't mind staying there for a few days if they could.

Once inside, they saw a few people walking around before going straight for the reception desk. There was a woman in her twenties with black hair tied in a bun and wearing blue kimono with a red sash holding it. She was ready to welcome them when she recognized Yu.

"Oh, Narukami-san! I didn't expect you to come here so early. If you came to go with Yukiko-san to school for the festival, she already left with Satonaka-san."

"She already left to the school?", asked Yu as the two other boys seemed a bit disappointed that they wouldn't see Yukiko anytime soon.

"No, they actually went to Junes. They said they wanted to go and look around at a few things before going to school. They told me that if you come here or call for them to pass this message to you."

"I see. Thanks for telling me Kasai-san."

"By the way, who are they?", asked the lady. "Are they friends of Nanako-san?"

"No, actually it is a bit complicated..."

Yu then told Sakai about how the two boys got separated from the group they were, with Brandon or Aaron adding a few more details to make the story more believable. It was a bit of a stretch to say they were with a group to tourists that passed the town and forgot them here, but somehow Yu and Sakai somehow managed to swallow the whole explanation.

"That's terrible... I am sorry for your troubles. Did you call the police?"

"No. I don't want to overcomplicate things. They are a bit uncomfortable with the whole situation, and I don't want to cause a commotion with this. I will just talk with my uncle about this and tell him to look for their guardians. Besides, I am sure others must have noticed they were missing by now."

"I see. And you brought them here to stay until someone came for them. That's really good thinking Narukami-san. If the police or anyone else calls here I will tell them that the boys are safe."

"That's right. And sorry if it's that much of a request."

"Don't be. I am sure here they will feel perfectly comfortable until someone arrives to pick them up."

The siblings were a bit nervous now, as they watched the exchange. They thought they will spend time with Yu or Yukiko, but the current situation wasn't advantageous at all for them. They knew that going to school with Yu was a bit of a stretch, but they expected to be in a situation where they wouldn't be put on the spot, as they now even regretted coming up with the whole story they came up with.

The two were playing a bit with their hands, to try to calm themselves down a bit. As they did, their fingers started to thin down and become a bit longer as the whole hand started to turn a bit slimmer as well.

Yu then talked a few other things with Sakai, including briefing Yukiko and Chie in case they were to return about the situation, before getting ready to leave.

"Now, please stay here with Nakai-san and please listen to her until someone comes to take you back."

"Will you come back?", asked Aaron.

"Maybe. If I can, I would like to see you leave safely."

""Okay..."", replied the two boys a bit dejected.

"Now don't be sad. I am sure we will meet again if possible. After all, as long as you believe in the possibility, anything is possible."

The two boys smiled a little at that comment, as Yu waved then and Sakai goodbye before leaving. As he left, their calves, continued morphing as they took a more shapely, and in Aaron's case, also more toned. But it didn't stop there. Their legs than grew a bit longer, as they started to age up. Their changed feet and hands also grew with them, despite looking a bit weird on their now 9 year old bodies.

After Yu left, Sakai turned to the boys and told them follow her, as she would take them to an empty room for them to stay. The two nodded, with no one noticing their increased height.
152132212111111.title: Arriving at the inn

1521322121111112.content:
Sakai led the two boys along the corridor, up until they reached an empty room. Once she opened it, they saw the room was decorated with traditional Japanese ornaments and contained a kotatsu, a couple of futons and a bit surprisingly, a wide-screen TV, giving the room a little modern feel.

"Okay, now please wait here until I finish some work I have to do. You can watch TV if you like and later if you would like, I could ask the chef to make something for you. Until then, please stay here and if you would, please take out your shoes."

The boys complied, taking out their footwear as they became fully brown as their material changed completely into leather. They also started to grow a small heel in the back as the bottom portion became dark-gray.

"Oh, before I left, I didn't ask for your names. Can you give them to me to know what should I say in case someone calls for you?"

"Sure thing. I am Randon Tomas, and this is my brother Aaren Shomas.", said Randon, with Sakai nodding in acknowledgment. Neither boy thought their names sounded strange at all, as Aaren raised his eyebrow for a second before shaking his head.

Sakai then left the boys to their own devices as she went back to the front desk, telling the boys one last time to behave themselves. On the way back however, there was something that made her curious about the boys.

"That strange... For someone who is from another country, they seem to speak Japanese really well, especially for their age. Maybe they came to Japan before... Or maybe they took some classes. I wonder if Narukami-san found it odd too..."

The reason why the boys understood Yu so perfectly from the start, wasn't because he was speaking English, but rather they could understand and speak Japanese, with the boys not even noticing. Yu also found it weird that they knew Japanese so well, but like Sakai , didn't think too much and simply believed they were just knowledgeable in terms of their language, despite their age.

Back with the two, they were siting on the tatami mat, as they analyzed the situation.

"This sucks. I thought we were going to spend our time here with Yu's group, not to be stuck here.", said Aaren a bit frustrated.

"I agree. This place looks nice, and it's Yukiko's house, but it's not too fun without anyone here....", continued Randon. "But I am more concerned what should we do with our lie?"

"Well, it's pretty simple. We just wish to go back home and we leave a note that we remembered a meeting spot for our group to meet in case we got lost. Pretty simple, right?"

"I doubt it will be so easy. It is not as though they wouldn't panic if we were to go missing. And also, I am pretty sure if that light is to appear again, it will draw attention to this room, and how to people just vanished."

"That's... true..."

Their speech patterns were now developing as their vocabulary increased. And while Aaren spoke pretty much like he would usually do, except maybe a tad louder, Randen seemed to speak in a more calm and polite manner. As they talked, their skin started to tan a little, deviating form their original color, with Aaren's skin tanning a bit more than Randen. Lastly, their white socks also started to change. Firstly, they became less ill-fitted for their bigger feet before clinging to them better, and then they started to get longer, now covering their ankles, while Randen's also started to darken a little.

"But you know what... This place is pretty neat."

"What do you mean Randen?"

"I mean, don't you want to explore this place a little? I haven't been at an inn before, and this one looks great. Plus, isn't the atmosphere inviting?"

"I guess it is... But weren't we told to stay here?"

"That's true... Maybe we could ask someone to give us a tour maybe."

Before the conversation could continue, they heard some footsteps, before the someone slided the door open.
1521322121111112.title: In the room

15213221211111122.content:
While they expected Sakai to return, they were a bit surprised to see another woman coming in, also wearing a kimono, who was equally surprised to see the two boys in the room.

"Oh, are you the two boys Sakai-san talked about? The ones that got lost?"

" Indeed, that's us. Did she tell you about us?"

"Yes, she told me and a few others about you just a couple of minutes ago. I am so sorry for interrupting you. I came here to take the sheets and the pillow cases to the laundry room, I didn't know you were here."

"Its no problem really.", assured Aaren as she bowed a little in thanking him before she went to the futons.

As she was collecting the things that needed to be washed, Randon had an idea.

"Do you mind if we help you take these to the laundry room?"

"I don't mind it, but are you sure? You are supposed to be staying here."

"We'll have you watch over us and we'll follow your instructions. And we kind of wanted to check this place a bit if it isn't a problem."

"Hmm... I guess I could have you join me. Just wait until I'm finished here so that you two could help me carrying the cloths."

"Thanks.", beamed Randon as the lady smiled a bit at his enthusiasm. Meanwhile, Aaren, who listened to the conversation really confused at his brother's request, came closer to him to ask him about the request.

"What are you doing? Didn't we agree to find a way to leave this place?"

"Don't you want to see this place first? It's our only time when we are going to be here. Aren't you even a bit curious to see Yukiko's home a bit more?"

"I guess I wouldn't mind it..."

"Besides, I am pretty sure that Sakai lady would be happy if we could help the employees if we can."

"...Okay, we'll do it.", sighed Aaren in defeat, as he also wanted to look around a little. "But put the coin somewhere in here. We don't want to somehow lose it and then search the inn like crazy for it."

As they talked, their hands slimmed down considerably, having now a more dainty appearance, but in Aaren's case, they also seemed to get stronger, having now a much better grip strength than before. Their nails also got a bit longer and got trimmed as well, with Randon's also gaining a manicure.

"Can you please help me a little with the folding if you would want?", asked the lady, with the two boys just finishing their discussion. Randon put the coin from his pocket next to the TV, so that it wouldn't be visible if someone else would come to the room before he and his brother went to help out with the folding.

While Aaren was almost as clumsy with he always was, his new age, making him slightly better at folding, Randon was doing it almost as good as the lady. Their memories were now starting to warp as well as new thoughts were starting to form. While they still saw each other like before, the sceneries in their memories where they were playing now slowly changing, the parks now looking a lot bigger and the tall buildings around them were now vanishing. They also got a memory of themselves at the inn and with Randon spending quite a bit more time there, as weird as it would be, as they never went there ever before. But they didn't question it as they continued their job.

Also, while their hair didn't grow at the moment, apart from making their manes a bit thicker, their usual blond color was now changing as well. While Aaren's only got a shade or two darker, Randon already was starting to become a dirty blond color, as the darkening stopped for the moment.

After they finished, they then started carrying the cloths, with the woman carrying a bed set, Aaren carrying the sheet of a bed and Randon the pillow cases and a cover.

"Thank you. I forgot to bring the laundry basket with me and I was concerned I wouldn't wrinkle them."

"No problem."

"Yeah, we are happy to help."

And another thanks from the lady, the three then left the room for the laundry room.
15213221211111122.title: Someone else comes in

152132212111111222.content:
On the way, the three conversed a little, with the two boys learning that the lady's name was Mitsuki as well as learning a few details about the inn and a bit about the staff as well. but for some odd reason the two seemed to already know more and more things about the inn ahead of Mitsuki's explanation. This was reflected in how detailed her description was becoming, revealing a few things that normally children their age wouldn't be interested in, such as the wages or schedules, but the two didn't look bothered to know these things, but for Randon, even the more specific details Mitsuki gave seemed to be familiar to him.

While walking, their socks became once again longer, as they now completely covered their ankles and were now climbing up their calves. But while Aaren's retained their white color and cotton texture, Randon's were actually growing thinner and darker, hugging his legs more than his brother's. Also, they appeared to be lengthening much faster, as they were already at the middle of his calves.

Soon, the trio reached the laundry room. There were already two washing machines that were already on, so they dropped the sheets in a hamper next to a third one.

"Thank you for helping me."

"It wasn't such a big deal."

"Now please return to your room until Sakai-san returns."

The two were ready to accept, but there seemed to be a sense of responsibility growing within Randon that made him speak.

"If it's not a problem, do you mind if we help you? We could bring the bedclothes to the washing room to spare you some time."

The suggestion surprised Mitsuki and Aaren, as the former inquired: "Are you sure you want to do this? I don't think we should let someone as young as you do something like this..."

"Please. We want to help as much as possible if we can. Besides, we already are familiar with the layout of the place. Can we?", asked Randon in a very respectful tone.

"...I guess I can let you two help. Not everyone is here yet, so we might need a little help. But only if both of you agree."

Aaren was ready to refuse, as he didn't want to waste too much time wandering around, his curiosity about the place not swaying him enough at the moment for him to accept. But with Randon looking at him pleadingly, he started to consider it a bit. Normally, he wouldn't be eager to do things he didn't find too interesting or didn't consider important enough. But right now, he is a lot more willing to help, especially if it was something his brother would ask. Together with the fact, that they still have enough time on their hands and that helping around might help time move faster, he gave out a sigh of resignation before answering.

"I guess we'll do it then... It's not like is any reason not to help." The answer put a smile on Randon's face, as Aaren couldn't help but smile a little as well.

During the conversation, the changes that affected their hands started to now affect their arms as well as the muscles got more slender and a tad more flexible. Also, their pants seemed to hug their legs a bit more now, but without causing any discomfort.

"Well then I guess it's settled then. Thank you very much for your help, I really appreciate it.", said Mitsuki with a sigh while giving out a small smile. I'll tell you which rooms should you go in."

"Thank you for accepting. We promise it will not take long.", said Randon, with Aaren nodding in agreement.

It was a bit strange as they didn't seem more panicked given their circumstances. It was true that they were only 6 years old when the whole thing started, but even then, their sense or urgency should have kicked in once the whole situation with their lie came up. But currently, the two weren't as bothered about the situation, as they even started to think it wasn't as alarming as to make them panic, with Randon even starting to like the inn a bit more than before.
152132212111111222.title: Straight to the laundry room

1521322121111112221.content:
Mitsuki pondered a little of she should go with the boys for the first room or two, to make sure they know what to do and to check on them, but as reality continued to change, Mitsuki now believed the two actually were accustomed with the inn, as they apparently came to the inn before, with Randon even spending a lot more time here than his brother.

"Okay, I am leaving a few rooms to you. Each of you take a basket and fold the bedclothes carefully. Once you've finished, return here. Even if I am not in the laundry room when you come back, please go back to your room."

The boys nodded, and after each of them took a basked and were told which rooms to go, they promised Mitsuki they will do a good job before they left for the three rooms they had to go.

The first one was near the end of the corridor, and so the boys decided to talk a bit on their way there.

"Ms Mitsuki is really nice, isn't she?", asked Randon.

"She is. I am surprised how she and Kasai are so accepting with the story we came up with. Heck, Yu even helped us make half the story without him knowing."

"True... But you know, I feel kind of bad lying to them. I mean, as harmless as the lie is, they still worry about us. It makes you feel like you betrayed them I a way..."

"I wouldn't say betrayal.... But I guess you're right. Lying like this really isn't my thing as well...", said Aaren also feeling slightly apologetic. "But anyway, why are we doing this right now? I mean, we are going to leave soon. I don't see why would you want to do some chores instead of thinking of a way out of this. If we would go and visit the town... and maybe go to a restaurant... maybe I would consider staying here a bit more..."

"Before we continue... What did you mean by "going to a restaurant"? Are you hungry? I know it was the afternoon when we left, but our dinner time would be later."

"I know, but I crave a little for some food, especially meat. I don't know why, but a steak or something like that sounds good to me right now."

"There is room service here. Perhaps they can give is something to eat later... But let's try not to eat expensive food, okay? I don't want to make it like we are robbing the people here just because we are lost.", said Randon, with his brother smiling a bit sheepishly as he nodded in conformation, neither wanting to look like rich people that like eating steak.

As they walked, their already tighter pants began to slowly crawl upwards, revealing a bit of their calves, however that space was slowly covered by their socks. But while Aaren's were starting to slow down with their lengthening, the more they got to the middle of his calves, Randon's socks continued their growth, becoming thinner and a tad more elastic as they progressed further.

"As for the reason I wanted to look around the inn is because I don't know if I will have another opportunity to see a place like this. The rustic feel almost makes you think of a historical place, doesn't it?"

"Well, I admit it is nice, but I think you are a bit overexcited. I mean, I know Yukiko is your favourite character and I know you wish to explore this place more, but there isn't anyone from the main cast even here."

"I know, but still... I feel a bit nostalgic to be here. I don't know why, but I want to see this place more if possible."

Aaren would usually raise a brow at a statement like that, but this time he just gave out a sigh before smiling to Aaren. "I admit that I know how much you like this place. It can't be helped if you wish to be here a bit more. Let's just get our job done to think about our next move later, okay?" His brother gave a small nod as he couldn't help but thank him a bit for his words.

There was slowly a new level of understatement forming between the two. While they were brothers, they really didn't ponder too much on their relationship as they knew they were close, given their former age. But currently, the two seemed like they would want to know each other a bit more than before.

Meanwhile, they felt a small irritation in their throats as they rubbed their necks a bit and swallowed a few times. Much to their surprise, the pain went away as quickly as it came, the two wondering if this was a sign of a cold, but didn't ponder too much on it at the moment. However it was to be noted that based on their breaths, their voices were sounding a bit higher.
1521322121111112221.title: On their own

choices: They finish and head for the next room
15213221211111122211.content:
The two soon arrived to the first room, and when they opened the door, they weren't surprised to see, that aside from having an extra futon and a bit more space, it looked very similar to the one they stood in before, with only a few changes to the décor and an extra bookcase being the only differences.

The two then headed towards the futons and began to take out the sheets as they sat next to the futons.

"By the way...", started Randon. "Why exactly did you crave for steak specifically? I know how like eating barbecue and sometimes burgers, but it wasn't as if this would be the first thing you would look on a menu.

"I don't know, maybe my tastes are changing. And maybe I need a bit more protein in my diet. What about you?"

"Hmm... I personally would like eating some meat, but I think I prefer something a little less heavy."

"Why? Scared you are going to get a stomach ache?"

"Not really. But I don't do as much exercise as you do, and I need to keep myself more fit if possible."

"Yeah, but you are a pretty good runner. A little red meat wouldn't hurt."

"And you don't run a lot? You say it's not bad because you actually run a lot more than me. And faster."

"Heh. Point taken I guess."

The two were too busy with their conversation to notice that they once grew a bit more in height as they aged another year, making them both ten at the moment. However they were certainly a little below the average height of a boy their age, with Randon now being half an inch taller than Aaren. But except for a slight change in posture, the two didn't notice their growth at all.

"So Rakdon, do you have other plans for after we finish here?"

"What do you mean Caren?"

"Well since you seem to enjoy being here so much maybe a little more time here wouldn't be so bad."

"Are you sure? You looked pretty eager to try and leave."

"I still do, but... Maybe you're right. There's no rush and I don't know if we would have another opportunity like this. And it would be a shame to leave like this."

"...Thanks Caren."

"No problem."

The two smiled at each other as they continued folding, first the sheets, then the blankets, and then the pillow cases, with Rakdon once again being an expert at folding as his brother had a few issues. Also, their jackets were beginning to change as well, as their white began to gain a greenish tint for Rakdon and a reddish one for Caren.

They were unaware that along with their minds and the reality itself, the presence the two had in the world was slowly changing as well. They started out as children who arrived in Inaba with the magic coin, but they were slowly starting to integrate in the new setting, as slowly, their memories of their home were starting to fade away.

But they didn't seem concerned by this. Since they didn't notice their different names, their developed vocabulary or how they seemed perfectly able to do chores on their own, without being watched by an adult, they simply enjoyed their time together, only feeling a bit confused of some things they didn't seem to remember properly before shaking their head, and accepting the new information that was given to them.

However there was something that was different at the moment. With their new age, they now believed their names were Rakdon Tamas and Caren Shanas. Despite their really close bond, their family name didn't match anymore with each other, even if they were still brothers. This didn't seem to bother the boys in the slightest though, as they still viewed each other as a very important person in their lives.
15213221211111122211.title: The first room

choices: He came to the inn before
152132212111111222111.content:
After a few more minutes, the two finished taking all of the bedclothes and after a quick tip from Rakdon, they sorted the sheets and the pillow cases in one basket and the covers in another.

"Thanks. If it was me I would've dumped everything in one basket until it was full and then put in the other."

"Well if you are doing it only for a futon or two, there isn't any problems. But if we are going to collect the bedclothes from several rooms, we might need to sort it better. We don't want the workers to have a hard time organizing as well... Also thank you again for doing this. I know it was kind of sudden with the request and the rest..."

"Don't sweat it. I am glad I can help. And we have enough time as well. It's not like there is something urgent."

If this was the usual Caren, he would try to hurry things up a lot quicker, but not only does he doesn't mind letting Rakdon have some fun, he also feels quite peaceful right now. He was still worried about how to leave the inn, but somehow spending a bit more time with his brother made him a bit more relaxed. Rakdon was also acting a bit different. Other than his now more polite way of talking, he also acted a bit more graceful. He didn't raise his voice as much as Caren, and he now seems to be enjoying helping around, even if initially he wouldn't be too joyful when it came down to doing chores. And like his brother, it felt almost relaxing doing this with him, in the sense that it was a bit more fun if he would do this on his own.

Afterward, the two left the room and were now heading for the next. While it was a bit confusing at first, as Mitsuki didn't gave them too many details regarding where the rooms are, Rakdon seemed to know exactly where it was, knowing now almost the entire layout of the place while Caren also started to gain a slight familiarity with the place.

They slowly walked to their destination, their walking also starting to change as they began to close the space between their steps, placing a foot in front of each other, especially in Rakdon's case. As they walked, their thighs began to gain a little bit of mass, as they became a little thicker. But while Rakdon's muscles didn't change much, Caren's started to tone themselves a bit, making them a little bit stronger.

The two navigated a bit more until they reached the room the room they were supposed to go in. The room was a bit smaller than the one from before, but had some additional storing space to cover for that. Once again, they went to the futons to collect the bedclothes, chatting a bit in the process.

"These rooms look really nice. I wonder if we could stay here for a night if we could."

"I am sure I can talk Sakai-san into allowing us to stay."

"Really?... Wait. Why did you say "san" at the end there?"

"Huh? It's just the formal way to address people. I know I called her "Ms Sakai" before but it seems a bit forced to say it in English when we can just call her this way."

"I guess you're right... I mean we know enough Japanese to know how to address people. Maybe we should indeed call then with Japanese honorifics instead."

"We should. It sounds a bit more polite as well."

"Not to mention it sounds more natural as well."

Unknown to them, they were now starting to develop quite a developed Japanese vocabulary. While they began talking the language ever since they arrived in the world, they didn't know all that many words other than the ones they knew initially. But with their vocabulary expanding, so did their knowledge of Japanese pronouns and such. On the other hand, their knowledge of English was now stripped away, not knowing how to speak their original language. But slowly, some basic words were starting to reappear, although they weren't as many as they once knew.

During their talk, their jackets changed a bit more, with Caren's, besides gaining a greenish hue to it, a yellow one was appearing as well on the sides of the front. As for Rakdon's the material seemed to get a bit thicker as it continued to slowly redden.

"So can we really stay here if we could?", asked Caren.

"Of course. I'm sure no one would mind."

"What makes you so sure?"
152132212111111222111.title: They finish and head for the next room

1521322121111112221112.content:
"I know Sakai-san very well. I am certain she will have nothing against spending the night together here."

"You do? But do you think it's okay? I mean... I personally don't have enough money to stay here half a day if I could..."

"Don't worry. I am sure she would understand. And she likes you a lot. But then again, most of the staff likes you."

"Now you're just flattering me...", said Caren as he blushed a little. "But if you think there won't be any issues... Maybe if we have an opportunity, I may accept."

"That's the spirit! Now let's finish up to talk with Sakai-san after we're done here."

Slowly, the initial worry about getting home that they had was evaporating. As for meeting the characters of the game, their excitement was also dwindling, no longer finding it that important, thinking they have plenty of time for that. Yu however was exception, as they still longed to see him once more. But there was something else about meeting him again that felt different to them, as something else other than excitement was starting to form, as Yu was starting to pop up in few of their memories.

As they continued their jobs, both felt their arms feeling a bit stiff, with their shoulders also hurting a bit. The two were slightly confused by why this was happening, especially Caren, but didn't voice their issue out loud, deciding that rubbing their limbs a little would help. And it sure did, as the changes progressed further. The muscles were redistributed, as their shape changed, becoming smaller, but also felt a bit stronger, noting that Rakdon again fell a bit behind when it came down to overall strength and muscle development. Their shoulders also became rounder and less broad to compliment the slimmer arms. They weren't done changing yet, but already, they didn't had the aspects of a normal boy's arms anymore.

Soon, the two finished and like before, left the room quietly as they headed for the final room, chatting along the way.

"By the way, how much has it passed since we got here?"

"For almost an hour. Why do you ask?"

"Call me crazy Rakdon, but shouldn't we be in a hurry or something?"

"Really? Why?"

"Maybe it's about going home. I feel like we should finish this as quickly as possible and then think of a plan."

Rakdon looked at Caren a bit confused as he replied: "Do we need to hurry? I feel like we have plenty of time. And it's not like there is a time limit or anything. We can think of the details later if we need to."

"I guess you're right... But I still feel like we must do something important though..."

"Actually... I do believe you're right... I also feel like we are supposed to do something after we finish our job here..."

The two began to ponder on what reason were they in a hurry, as thinking of how to get home didn't seem as important for them as much as it did before. While thinking, their T-shirts started to feel somewhat softer as along with their pants, got a bit tighter on them. On top of that, they started to slowly crawl on their necks, feeling a little discomfort in the process, but they mostly ignored the feeling.
1521322121111112221112.title: He knows Sakai

15213221211111122211121.content:
Deciding on focusing on the task at hand, the two brothers went to the final room they had to go. This one was a bit further than the ones from before, but Rakdon had no issues finding it as he and Caren inside. Just like before, it was a really nice combination of old and new Japanese décor, this chamber looking roughly the same size as the one they stood in before. But before they could begin, Caren thought of something.

"Say Rakdon... I've been thinking. What should we do about lunch?"

"Hmm... It is almost noon by the looks of things.", said Rakdon as he looked at the clock on the wall. "It is still a bit early, but maybe we could ask the chef to whip us something for us."

"Eat here?... Uh, I think we've troubled them enough by now. I say we should try and go somewhere in town to eat."

"Do you have a place in mind?"

"Maybe we can go to Aiya and eat some really good pork ramen. Or maybe we can go to Souzai Daigaku and eat some steak skewers."

"Caren, don't you think you should change your diet a bit? You seem to be eating a bit too much meat lately."

"Don't sweat it. I also eat a lot of veggies and fruits and even fish every now and then. It's not like I am a lion that eats only meat."

Normally that remark would only gain a little smile from Rakdon, but for some reason, this time he actually started to snicker quite a bit.

"Uh... what's so funny?"

"You... a lion... Just imagine yourself... in a costume... with that giant mane... Hahaha!"

At this point, the little snicker turned into an all-out laugh, which prompted Caren to furrow his brow a little.

"Okay, first of all only male lions have those manes, not the females. Second of all, how did you get to a costume? I am not like Teddie, wearing something as silly as that like it's nothing."

"Haha... Teddie... as a lion...Hahahaha!"

Unfortunately, this made Rakdon to laugh even more heartily as Caren could only sigh at his brother's laughter.

During the conversation, their hips started to spread out a little as their pelvises grew a bit wider, which in turn put a little strain on their pants. Speaking of them, they receded a bit more, now getting a lot closer to their knees as the color as the blue was starting to darken and the fabric was also starting to become something softer in the meantime.

"Can we just please start already? I don't know where to go with this talk now anymore.", said Caren as Rakdon stopped laughing and nodded, as the two went to the futons.

The two then folded the bedclothes as Caren made sure not to make another comparison or pun as he didn't want his brother go into another laughing fit. After they silently finished their task, with Caren getting a bit better at folding this time after he did the same thing twice before. Before they could leave however, Rakdon began speaking.

"But in all seriousness Caren, it really is okay if you want to eat here. I am sure neither Sakai-san or the cooks would mind."

"Are you sure? I mean, we are eating the food that is supposed to be for the guests. And I don't think I have enough money to pay for a full meal here. I can pay my share at another restaurant so..."

"Don't worry, it's fine. We always cook a bit for ourselves if we have any spare food and I know they have bought a bit more than they usually do, so they should have ingredients for another portion or two."

"I'll think about it...", replied Caren as his brother nodded in understanding before the two started to go back to the laundry room.

As they walked, their hair once again got longer, with Caren's now covering his ears as his mane got a bit thicker and the color got another shade darker. In the meantime, Rakdon's hair was now touching his nape as its color once again shifted form the dirty-blond he currently had to near-brownish shade.

Their memories once again were slowly changing. Details such as knowing Teddie, the restaurants in town or the extra food the inn had were just the start. One would think that they know Teddie from the artwork they were shown before of him, but casually talking about him like they know each other was surely something a mere fan of the game wouldn't know. And along with all this knowledge, their selves were also gradually changing as somewhere in their souls, a mysterious blue flame was starting to ignite...
15213221211111122211121.title: The last room

152132212111111222111211.content:
The two soon got back to the laundry room, where much to their surprise, Sakai already was already there, waiting for them.

"Oh, Sakai-san! Were you waiting for us?"

"Not for very long. And there is no need to apologize for coming in late, I was just ready to turn on the washing machines. I already talked with Mitsuki-san and told me about your decision to help around. She was needed somewhere else, so I substitute for her right now."

"Was there a problem with us leaving our room?"

"Of course there wasn't. I am quite thankful for your aid actually. I know I told you to say in your room, but I suppose you might've gotten a bit bored on your own... Do you want to help me as well?"

"Absolutely.", answered Rakdon while Caren nodded as well.

As the three were readying the machines, the boys once again aged up, by another two years. Their hips and thighs continued to expand as they became older, looking a little to big for a pair of 12 year old boys. Rakdon once again gained a little more height than his brother, the difference between them becoming once again slightly bigger. Also, their waists didn't seem to grow along with their frames, instead they seemed to become slightly smaller than they were in the beginning.

With this change, a few mental and reality shifts happened. Rakdon wasn't now just someone who knew Sakai, he now knew the whole staff, as he was now a regular at the inn, sometimes helping around when he would have free time. Caren on the other hand, now knew a few more kung-fu movies, and was now in his spare time training to learn how to perform them. All this came in exchange of their memories from home fading a bit more, the landscape of their home city being replaced with a more rural one inside their thoughts.

"Okay, thank you for your help once again Rakion-san and Charen-san.", said Sakai after they put detergent into the washing machines.

"Don't mention it. We were happy we could help.", said Rakion with a smile as neither he nor Charen noticed their different names, before he asked her: "Say, can we eat here if we can? It is a bit early, but I was wondering if could have lunch right now?"

"Certainly. I don't see why it would be a problem. And this is also thanks for helping with the bedclothes as well."

"Thank you.", smiled Rakion as Charen got a bit surprised and sheepishly thanked her as well.

"...Thanks a bunch."

"Not a problem. Now I will finish the job here. You two can go to the kitchen and talk with the chef with what we have in the menu for today."

The two boys bowed a little, not even noticing how compelled were they to do it, as there wasn't any resistance in questioning the gesture as they left. Sakai grinned a little seeing the two off as she continued her work.

"Those two really are best of friends. Regardless of family, very rarely you see someone who gets that well with another... And speaking of bonds, I wonder how they are faring with him..."

The two boys slowly made their way to the kitchen, with Charen thanking Rakion for the meal they just got. Along the way, their socks changed further, as they climbed further up their legs. But while Charen's not only remained white as the material became just a tad more elastic, they didn't grew much further, stopping around the middle of his stronger calves, Rakion's were now pure black as they hugged his legs much more than before. The material became thinner, but they remained opaque, as they now covered his knees.

"Do you know what they have on the menu Rakion?"

"Hmm... If I recall, they mentioned preparing a chicken meatball hotpot as today's special."

"Chicken?... Uh, don't they have anything a bit more hardy?"

"We can ask if they have. Like I said, they bought a bit more than usual this time, so they must have at least some beef as well."

"Fingers crossed then.", joked Charen as his brother gave out a small giggle, happy that it wasn't another "laugh attack" he had to deal with due to a simple topic this time.

They didn't question the new names they heard, even if for a slight second, they felt something wrong. However, as reality changed further, Rakion Tamais and Charen Shatoas, simply continued their day, as even the memories of their wishing coin were starting to fade away.
152132212111111222111211.title: Sakai was waiting for them

1521322121111112221112112.content:
During the walk, the two felt a little pressure in their abdomen, which stopped their walk towards the kitchen.

"I think I need to use the bathroom."

"Me too. There should be one not far from the reception desk, next to the vending machines."

They headed towards the restroom, but neither noticed that they entered the women's restroom without knowing. But the absence of the urinals didn't faze them as they both went into a stall. Just like the time they bowed, the brothers felt another strange urge, this time to sit on the toilet. While it was unnecessary, the two complied and sat down without pondering on it.

As they did their business, they noticed they really didn't need to use the restroom, as there wasn't too much to come out, yet the diminishing pressure they felt was enough to make them not question the situation any further. While sitting down, their waists began to shrink down even more, looking now quite small in comparison to their larger hips, with Charen's waist also seemed to tone itself a bit as well. Also, they felt like their seats were getting a bit cushier than in the beginning, but believed to be just their imagination. In reality, their butts were also expanding, starting to catch up with the hips and the thighs, which slowly continued growing.

The two were however distracted by their thoughts a little, as along with all the changes to their minds that came up until this point, their heads got a little foggy.

"Ugh... I don't know why but I feel a bit lightheaded right now. I know I slept enough last night... It's true that I stood up a little late since I couldn't miss a "Trial of the Dragon" movie, but that shouldn't make me forget what I did this morning... I know I've talked with Rakion... Was it something about a magic coin and wishes? Well, I know I would wish for all the meat in the world that I can eat, without ever gaining weight if that would be the case. Heheh... But still, I feel like there was something else too... Whatever, I can ask Rakion about that stuff later, maybe after lunch..."

"I don't know why my mind feels so muddled right now. I doubt it's from lack of sleep, but I can't deny I felt pretty tired when I went to bed... What did I did yesterday...? Oh, yes. I helped around the inn with cleaning and serving food, as it got a bit crowded last night... But why am I having issues remembering what I did this morning?.. I talked with Charen about wishes and... a video game? I don't have prior knowledge of playing something on a console... I did play a few online games on my computer recently but... I may be missing a few details, but I don't believe it's that important. Maybe the subject popped up. As for the wish part... I think may need to talk with Charon after we eat..."

During their monologues, their underwear also began changing. The material seemed to get softer, especially in Rakion's case as both began to have their legs receding a little. When they finished and pulled them up along with their pants, the two couldn't deny that they liked the feeling their underwear had on their growing curves. Afterward, the two walked towards the sink and began washing their hands.
1521322121111112221112112.title: Bathroom break

15213221211111122211121121.content:
As the two were washing their hands, they both looked in the mirror a few times, and there was something off about their appearance that was worrying them a little. For a split second, they believed it was their longer hair, but they shook it off fairly quickly, thinking they simply forgot to cut their recently, before deciding that they actually looked better now, and thus didn't ponder more on it. Still, there was something that looked different, and that made them wonder what exactly that was.

"Say Charen, do you also think something about the way we look is a bit off?"

"Yeah, I do. But I can't put my finger on what it was. I thought it was our hair, but I doubt it's that."

"I also thought of that. But I personally don't see anything wrong with our haircuts..."

While checking their appearance in the mirror, they didn't notice how their faces were starting to become a bit rounder or that their eyes were becoming almond-shaped as the color of their irises was changing as well, as the blue was starting to darken a bit, gaining a brownish tint to them, with Rakion's becoming a few shades darker.

But this went unnoticed by the two, and instead, they attributed the feeling with their memory lapse from before, worrying them that they were a bit sick. They believed that tiredness or stress to be the cause, as no matter how much they looked at their reflections, they didn't see anything wrong, and yet something was telling them the exact opposite. Suddenly, however, Charen noticed something.

"Uh, Rakion, I think we forgot to zip up our jackets."

"Huh? Oh! You're right. I am surprised we didn't notice that.", said Rakion as he zipped up his jacket, with Charen doing the same.

"Me neither. I was wondering a little why it felt a little cold. I think we got caught up with our task, and we unzipped our jackets when he felt a little hot or something..."

"Sounds plausible... I am guessing that what we felt something was off was our opened jackets."

"Maybe. But I am surprised it took that long for us to notice though."

"I think we were most likely with our minds somewhere else... Anyway, I am happy it was that and nothing else."

"Me too. Boy, we need to be a lot more aware of things like these. I don't need Yosuke or Rise-chan to tease us with this."

"Yeah, it wouldn't be nice..."

With their little dilemma solved, the two dried off their hands with some paper towels as they then left. The two began feeling a little too warm with their jackets on, but soon said feeling began to dissipate as they continued walking. Their T-shirts became that tight on them, the material split in the middle, without them noticing beneath their jackets. Then they quickly patched themselves up as buttons formed to close off the rips, with the collars of their new shirts also being now complete. The material also began to soften, the polyester gradually being replaced with cotton, while the color started to fade off from the shirts, the dark blue starting to lighten up.

The two boys however believed they were wearing shirts the entire time and weren't at all bothered by the different feel the material had on their skin. They were however still pondering about their actions prior to arriving at the inn, the memories about the coin and their wish continuing fading out. But there was something that was starting to differ. While up until now, their memories had them together up until now, with one not being seen with the other, things were starting to change, as they started to think they live separately, with Rakion actually living at the inn.
15213221211111122211121121.title: Looking in the mirror

152132212111111222111211211.content:
Deciding to focus on their meal and ask about their confusions later, the two continued heading to the kitchen. They soon arrived at the dining area, which was a combination between western and Japanese décor, as both mats as well as chairs were placed around different tables that suited the height of the sitting person. Even if they weren't told, the boys thought that Sakai mentioned something about a group of tourists from abroad were supposed to arrive tonight, thus they had to have an easier way for them to eat comfortably if they weren't accustomed to the sitting position yet. They then entered the kitchen and saw a few chefs prepping the food. Once they noticed them, one of them greeted the brothers.

"Hello Rakion-san, Charen-san.", said the man politely as the others followed suit. "Is there something we can do for you?"

"We were wondering if it is a problem if we could eat here. It is a bit early, but I thought we could have lunch, if it isn't too much to ask for, as I know you are busy prepping."

"Of course there's no problem. We have some extra produce, so we don't mind at all."

"Thank you very much. What can you do for us right now that doesn't take much time..."

"Hmm... I guess we could make some curry with a pork cutlet. How does that sound?"

"That sounds great! We take that!", said Charen a bit excited to eat some meat, to which Rakion and the chef could only laugh a little."

"It will take a few minutes to make. Please wait in the dining room until we finish."

The boys nodded and headed for the closest table, leaving the chefs cook their lunch. The two then began talking with each other as more changes happened to them. They both felt a little discomfort as they sat down, feeling the need to push their backs forward to alleviate the pain. Somehow this worked perfectly, as their backs were now in a permanent arch, without even noticing. Their arms also changes further, with Rakion's limbs looking slimmer and more delicate than Charen's as he gained quite a little more arm muscle then he had before.

"I take back all that I said about eating here. The chef is really nice and offered us a hardy meal right off the bat! I forget sometimes how kind the staff here really is."

"They are always nice to people.", replied Rakion with a small giggle. "They trained to act friendly to customers, but to those who come here often or know the staff personally, they talk to others as if they are members of the family. That's why they have no problem with us."

"You mean with me. You basically live here with all the times you come to the inn."

"That's a bit of a stretch... But I suppose you are right. I do like this place a lot... In the beginning, I tried to think that being here all the time would narrow my possibilities... but it's not like I hate being here. After all, the people here are like family... And so are you."

"N-Now you making me blush...", said Charen a bit embarrassed. "But thanks. It really means a lot to me."

That comment would seem odd normally, but in reality, the two boys started to view each other not as siblings, but as friends. This was of course just a small part of them that actually believed that. But soon, it wouldn't be just the belief that they are not brothers...

As they continued talking, the shirts underneath their jackets, which continued to be recolored, the green and yellow for Charen and red for Rakion becoming more dominant, their sleeves started to grow, currently reaching their elbows as they kept whitening.
152132212111111222111211211.title: The kitchen

1521322121111112221112112112.content:
A few minutes later, the food was already done, which surprised the two boys by how fast it was done.

"Isn't this a lot quicker than usual?"

"Hah, well we are currently cooking just for you, so there should be no problem when it comes down to time. You are lucky you came before the usual lunch period", said the chef that brought them the food cheerily. "Please enjoy, and tell us your impression on it in case there is something to change."

"We will, don't worry.", said Charen as he was ready to eat.

After the chef left, the two gazed at the meal expectantly, as both were impressed by how appetizing it looked. Charen was basically drooling at the sight of the breaded pork cutlet, before he and Rakion began eating. While it wasn't a very extravagant dish, the two were almost instantly charmed by the flavors. The rustic, yet comforting taste reminded them a bit of how their mother would cook for their child. It was a bit spicier than they predicted, knowing that it would be better suited for Rise to eat, but they didn't mind the spiciness to much as they continued to enjoy their meal.

As they were eating, the brothers aged up once again to 13 years old. They didn't grow in height as much as they did before, as they were slightly smaller than a boy their age should be as the difference in height between the two becoming more noticeable. Their butts also got a little bigger from all the eating, but the main focal point this time were the thighs. They both gained more mass, as they finally finished growing. Charen's legs not looked very toned as the muscles gave the impression of a good runner, while Rakion's didn't develop too much muscle, as they now looked more alluring than sporty, the small, soft layer of fat on top complimenting them perfectly. Their pants continued to recede further up their legs, as they now finally reached the middle of their thighs. The changes didn't stop there however, as the material darkened further as they lost their pockets.

Additionally, they both felt their throats sting a little as they ate. They both attributed it to the spiciness of the food, thus they both ignored the feeling, as their vocal chords began to tighten, while their Adam's apple continued to shrink down, as their voices rose in octave once more.

"Wow, this tastes amazing!", exclaimed Charen as he continued to stuff his mouth, his food meal being 80 percent done by now.

"I agree. This really tastes great Chaen.", said Rakion as he was eating his food slower, as he still had quite a bit to eat.

"By the way Rukion... Think we will be able to make a curry like this? It would wow the guys without a doubt."

"That would be great. But I think we will need to ask the chef for the recipe. I personally don't know the bends he uses when cooking."

"We need to only know how to prepare the pork correctly, and maybe some things about the breading. As for the rest, I am sure we can improvise."

"You're right. We just have to think of some good combinations for the flavors."

The idea of cooking something themselves didn't appeal to the two too much initially, but right now they were willing to actually try and cook... in order to redeem themselves for some disastrous results that they now remembered. Also strangely enough, they seemed compelled to cook more for Narukami rather than for the rest of the boys, as new thoughts about him were slowly entering their minds. Also, more changes happened to the reality, as their names changed further to Chaen Satoasa and Rukion Tamasi.
1521322121111112221112112112.title: The food is ready

15213221211111122211121121121.content:
The two slowly enjoyed their lunch, making sure they both finish everything. Chaen in particular felt quite hungry before the meal, even though he wasn't too much when he arrived at the inn, but that didn't seem to matter anymore. After finishing their plates, the two then went back to the kitchen.

"I see you enjoyed it thoroughly by the looks of it.", said the chef who brought them the food as he prepping alongside his co-workers.

"We sure did! Man I have to come here more often just for this!... But I promise I will bring my wallet next time I come here."

"Haha, don't sweat it Satoasa-san. You are technically part of the family here."

"...Thanks... ", said Chaen sheepishly and a bit flattered by the comment before continuing. "By the way, was the recipe for curry difficult?"

"Not exactly. We used the regular recipe for it, but we did in fact add a few more spices to it like garam masala, that we thought of adding after experimenting a bit. We also went to buy fresh peas from the market instead of frozen like we usually do from Junes. But why are you asking?"

"Me and Chaen want to try making curry ourselves and we were wondering if we could use the kitchen tonight.", replied Rukion, which made the chefs sweat a little at that answer.

While they were talking, their pant legs were gradually fusing together into one, closing the gap between their legs. However, as soon as they fused and became skirts, they became less tighter on them as the skirts were now slowly getting pleated as they kept darkening.

"Uh... Rukion-san... We admire that you want to cook something based on our recipe... but I don't know if it is a great idea."

"What do you mean?"

"Well... Your last attempt to make a boxed lunch wasn't as... desirable as you wanted. And based on your past with making curry, I do believe that if you or Satoasa-san want to make it, I suggest you practice with something easier before trying to make curry... I am not saying you haven't improved. But I think... you might need to wait a little bit longer..."

The two weren't dumb to not understand the chef's words: That they were horrible at cooking. And as much as they hated to admit, they weren't wrong. Starting from their curry at the camp, which Youske named it "Mystery Food X", the two really tried to remedy their cooking skills. But most of the times, the two didn't succeed with their plans. Most often than not, the food ended tasting either bland, overcooked or undercooked, as the rest of the times, it ended with a large mess that not even if they would pay somebody, they wouldn't eat it. And after the reaction they got from the boys when they ate the curry, the two didn't try to taste test it as much as they would want to, as even they grew a bit worried of might happen should they try to eat it. It was true that they found a little bit of solace knowing Rise wasn't better than them in the cooking department as her overuse of spicy ingredients would make anyone drink a gallon of water afterword if they didn't pass out from the heat...

But still, it wasn't nowhere near satisfactory for the two, as they tried really hard to develop their cooking abilities, believing that their skills were just underdeveloped. And they weren't doing it just to prove to the guys that they can cook, or to simply get better in the kitchen for themselves, but to impress a certain someone, who still sometimes, would test out their food to see if there was an improvement in their abilities.

The two began thinking of said person, and as they did, their hair changed further. Chaen's hair stopped growing after covering his ears, as it smoothed itself out, as it settled for a bowl-shaped haircut, losing all of its spikiness in the process. Meanwhile, Rukion's hair became a lot straighter, all the wild bangs he had being completely flattened, as his mane now reached just below his shoulder blades. They gained a look of determination in their eyes as they remembered why exactly they were asking for a shot at making curry.

"Don't worry, we won't make any blunders this time. We will consult a cook book this time... I know you are worried, but we would like to leave our image in the food we are making."

"We won't go crazy with the ingredients, we promise. We will just put normal stuff in the food this time, we promise."

The chefs exchanged a few looks among themselves before the head chef sighed and responded: "Okay. We will let you use the kitchen tonight, and we will give few a few hints about how to make it, as you said that you want your dishes to say they represent you, and we will let you cook on your own. But promise you will clean up everything once you are done."

""We promise!"", said the to in unison, happy at the chance they have.

"This will surely make him happy..."

"I hope this time he will like it...", were the thoughts of the two boys.
15213221211111122211121121121.title: They finish eating

152132212111111222111211211212.content:
The two boys were ready to ask the chefs for the tips already, but one of them spoke before they could.

"By the way... Aren't you two supposed to leave soon? Do you still have time?"

They were confused at first about the question, as they believed they were waiting instead of needing to go somewhere... However with the memories of the wish being almost gone, the two felt their heads fog up for a second before something clicked in their minds.

"Oh yeah, we almost forgot. Thank you for telling us."

"I guess we got a bit preoccupied with the lunch that we didn't look at the time..."

"Not a problem? But aren't you two going to be late?"

"There's still a little time left. We will pick up our things and then we will leave."

"Ok. I heard you were going to be busy today, so I wish you both a great day then."

""Thank you!"", said the two boys in quick succession as they said their goodbyes to the chefs and thanked them again for the lunch before they left back to their room.

On the way, their new skirts continued to darken until they became fully black, but it didn't stop there., as the skirts became pleated and gained a checkered design, together with some lighter colored, gray squares. On top of that, their underwear also started to change color, as their simple white boxers began darkening, with a slight greenish hue appearing at the top of Chaen's boxers while Rukion's started to redden on the sides and at the front. The boys did feel a little bit of draft with the skirts, but they simply shrugged it off as they were busy trying to solve the questions they had for themselves.

"Hey Rukion... I know this might sound weird but... Do you remember what we did exactly this morning? I am having a little brain fart right now..."

"You too? I thought I was the only one..."

"Really? Well, what do you think was the cause for this? I mean, it's kind of hard to believe two people don't remember..."

"Hmm... It might be because of a lack of sleep...? I think I read somewhere that other than these periods of lethargy during the day and lack of focus, people can also have short time memory loss... And if I recall, you said you were quite tired after last night, and I am a bit too."

"You think? I am not feeling sleepy or anything... But I guess it's possible..."

The two weren't entirely convinced by the argument, but they couldn't think of any other possibility, as neither of them were sick or felt lightheaded, thus deciding that tiredness was the reason. They, at one point felt their waists feel a little tight, but simply dismissed as a slight stomach ache from eating the slightly spicy food they had, unaware that their waists were actually starting to get slimmer, trimming down any trace of fat they had.

"So... Do you recall something?"

"Nothing in particular, but there was this thing about wishes and a magic coin I believe..."

"A magic coin?"

"Yeah, I know it sounds dumb. I don't know why I remembered something like that. Maybe we talked about our wishes and one of us may have brought up the subject with the coin...I don't know, I am as confused as you are about this."

"I also remember something about wishes... but there was no coin brought up. Instead it was something about a video game"

"A video game? I never thought you were the gamer type of sorts Rukion. Do you plan to buy a console?"

"Not really... I don't know why this was brought up either..."

"...Let's just forget about it for now. We may remember the details later.", said Chaen as he thought he needed more time to ponder, something Rukion agreed with.

"You're right. We have to get our stuff to leave anyway."

The two then continued walking back to their room, but they didn't notice that they started to veer off course, as they took a different turn than the one they should.
152132212111111222111211211212.title: Going back

choices: They talk a little bit more
1521322121111112221112112112122.content:
The two continued talking with each other, unaware that they were taking a different path than the one they originally came from. Although one might think they simply were too engrossed with their talk to notice, in reality, the two believed that they were walking to the correct way, as their memories further changed.

While their memories about what they did before arriving at the inn were still blurry, the two remembered coming from a different room instead of the one they were placed in by Sakai. But there was more than just this that changed within their minds. The memories of their home were now almost half-way gone as the familiarity with the big city they lived in were gradually replaced, with not just a more rural scenery, but with Inaba of all places. Despite being a fictional place, or at least it was so in the world they came from, they two genuinely remember now the times they spend with each other in the small town, not just playing with each other, but also going to school together. Even if they were originally too young to go to school, their current age and memories easily made it so there won't be any issues.

On the way, Rukion's socks continued to climb further and further up his legs, as while the material became somewhat thinner that it was in the beginning, they weren't see-through at all, currently being at the middle of his thighs, as they continued darkening, being almost black right now. As for Chaen, while his socks didn't change ever since they got to their final length, also started to feel a slightly creeping feeling around his thighs, as a black substance was starting to ooze from his skirt, something that didn't happen in Rukion's case. The substance adhered to his legs, slowly encasing them, however the sensation went completely unnoticed as he continued walking.

Eventually, they reached the room they needed to go in, and once inside, they saw that the room was quite different than the ones from before. It was slightly smaller than the one they originally were placed in, but it had a couple of big closets, much bigger than the ones they saw before, a desk with a bookcase next to it, a small vanity in the corner, a wall mirror, a regular bed and a spare futon in the corner of the room, alongside several other decorations around the room. What was special about this place was that this was in fact, Rukion's room.

"Man, your room is a lot cleaner than mine is Rukion. Other than some magazines around, it looks great."

"Thanks. But I thought your room was fairly clean too Chaen."

"You think? I kind of let my clothes out of the closet sometimes and I don't clean it too often."

"True... But it still looks better than Yosuke's. Remember how it was last time we visited him?"

"Haha. Yeah, it was a mess... It's true that Teddie might have been a cause of how it looked like as only he would do something such as throwing things on top of a closet... Although he really needs to put his magazines somewhere else, if that pervy bear is going to search for them again."

"Um, what magazines are you talking about?"

"... Nevermind. Let's just get ready.", said Chaen as he didn't want Rukion knowing what type of magazines he was talking about, as he raised an eyebrow before going to mirror.

Neither felt the need to put on any make-up, so they decided for the moment to just fix up their hair. As they brushed their mane, Chaen's hair became a sandy blond as the color almost became brown, while Rukion's was now on the verge of turning pure black, as he put on a red headband that was on the vanity on top of his head.

They both then took another glance at the mirror to check their appearance. The feeling that something was off about their look still persisted, but it wasn't as strong as it was in the beginning. Still, they once again wondered if there was indeed something different, or it was something superficial again.
1521322121111112221112112112122.title: Back to Rukion's room

15213221211111122211121121121221.content:
While they still thought something was off, not just with their appearance, but with the entire situation, they couldn't exactly put their finger on what it was, thus the two decided that this should be something they should think about later, as they stepped away from the mirror.

"Uh, by the way Chaen, where did we leave our shoes?", asked Rukion as he was searching the room for them.

"Didn't we leave them at the entrance? We were told that they were planning on cleaning the floor, so we were asked not to go in with our shoes on to not dirty the floor."

"Yeah, you're right. I don't know why I thought we left them here... Besides, Sakai-san said she'll watch for them anyway."

"Exactly. Now let's go. I don't want to be late."

The two then went back for the entrance. On the way, the two didn't notice that underneath their tops, their shirts continued to lighten, the color fading more and more, almost turning white in the process, as the sleeves continued to lengthen, currently being halfway down their forearms. Also, Rukion's socks fully encased his thighs, and were now ready to move up to his hips, while the black substance that covered Chaen's thighs stopped dripping off the skirt, as it started to conform to his legs as the material it was forming was starting to become stretchier.

Eventually, the two got fairly quickly to the entrance, with Sakai still at the front desk.

"Are you leaving now?"

"Yes. We would've stood a bit more, but we are a bit busy now."

"And please say thanks a again to the chef. That curry really was delicious."

"Hehe. Thanks you Chaen-san. I will make sure to tell him later. By the way, since tonight we will be a bit busy, can I rely on your help Rukion-san? I know you are busy this week, but I would really appreciate it if you could lend us a hand."

"Of course. But only if you are going to let me work a bit in the kitchen after dinner. I need to polish my skills... Oh, and Chaen might join me as well. If you don't mind."

"Rukion-san, you know you are free to try and better yourself at cooking. And if Chaen-san can also improve his skills as well, then even better... Just make sure you don't... use things with strong smells...", said Sakai, with the last part coming out a bit awkwardly, something the boys picked on, but decided not to press the subject anymore.

After saying their goodbyes, the boys opened the door, but just before they could stop outside, they both felt a gust of cold air hitting them. They shielded their faces from it and closed their eyes in response as well. When the breeze stopped, and the two opened their eyes again, their eyes changed color from the usual blue, with Chaen's now being brown while Rukion's now being a few shades darker than his brother's. Afterward, the two went out.

"Those two sure are close.", said Sakai to herself seeing them leave. "Their cooking really need a lot of polishing, but I know why they want to get better so desperately. I can't blame them. Making delicious food for the person you like is really a must these days... Not to mention, it also is a sign of maturity. I just hope that by the time Rukion-san will inherit the inn, he will get better...", mused the women as she went back to her work.
15213221211111122211121121121221.title: They leave

152132212111111222111211211212211.content:
At the beginning, despite wanting to explore the town and meet the characters of the game, the boys were reluctant to go off on their own. They expected Yu or someone else to join them and show them around, thinking that the idea of pretending to be tourists to be the perfect excuse to do so. But despite being Saturday, according to the people at the inn, Yu still needed to go to school for some reason, thus the two were stranded at the inn for a while. They were willing to wait a little to see if Yu or Yukiko would come to the inn... But at the moment they were getting very familiar with the town that they didn't need a guide anymore.

What started with some simple flashes of the town began to turn into actual memories of them spending time in Inaba. The growing familiarity with the place made the boys a lot less concerned about how to find an excuse to go back home, as the whole thing with the magic coin was practically erased from their minds. But it wasn't just the wishes and the coin that vanished, as their memories of their home were gradually being replaced with them living in Inaba instead. However there was one big difference that more or less was changing the whole relationship the two had.

At first, while they saw each other a lot in their memories, they didn't seem to spend most of their time together at home. Then the two remembered that they don't live in the same house anymore, with Rukion living at the inn while Chaen was staying at a local house, not too far from the inn. Together with the fact that their personalities were also shifting, with Chaen staying more or less the same if not getting a bit more expressive than he was before, while Rukion was acting more polite and refined, quite evident in his behavior and manner of speech. The two still considered each other siblings... but that feeling was also slowly fading away, as physically they were already quite different.

The two made their way to the main street fairly quickly, chatting about curry recipes on the way.

"So you are thinking about doing a seafood curry?", asked Rukion.

"Yes. I know it is slightly harder than the normal one the cooks make, but I want to test myself... But I've already decided not to add any weird ingredients this time, so sea cucumbers and clam juice are out. I may need to check the Internet later to see what exactly to put in. Maybe scallops, shrimps and maybe some crab... or maybe something a little more out there... I heard people put uni in risotto, so maybe that would work..."

"It sounds interesting... But I think I will settle for a beef curry. I must think which cut of meat to choose though since I heard different cuts have different taste and cooking method for things like curry or ramen... I also need to think about spices. Don't worry, I won't go overboard with the spices like Rise-chan, but I may need to check the list of peppers at Junes."

As the two were thinking about their recipes, they once again aged up, this time to 15 years old. They barely grew in height this time, but once again, the subtle increase in height made Rukion look taller than before in comparison to Chaen, even if he was actually a little smaller than a boy his age. Their waists also pulled in quite a bit, with Chaen also getting his abdomen a bit more toned than Rukion. They also felt a bit uncomfortable between their legs as Rukion's socks completed their transformation after reaching his hips and fusing together and darkening further as they became a pair of black opaque pantyhose, while the substance on Chaen's legs turned into a pair of black compression shorts. It felt awkward and a tad uncomfortable for a split second, but almost immediately they brushed off the feeling and continued talking about recipes.

"By the way, what time is it Chaien? I forgot to check the time before we left?"

"Uh... I think we still have about 20 minutes or so before we have to meet the guys at school. Still, getting there a bit early isn't an issue, so let's just wait for them there in case we get to the school before them.", said Chaien, as his brother nodded in agreement.

Even if the two didn't had any particular reason to go the local school, their minds shifted further along with the reality, as Rukio Amasi and Chaien Satonasa headed to help their friends for the upcoming school festival.
152132212111111222111211211212211.title: Going to school

choices: They are the first ones arrived
1521322121111112221112112112122112.content:
As the two continued walking, they discussed their curry recipes with each other.
