While they were asking one another about putting a few ingredients like squid ink or barbecue sauce to the list of ingredients, since neither knew how they tasted in a curry or wanted to create an abomination like the "Mystery Food X" they made before, the two agreed on picking more "tame" ingredients this time. They wanted to add a little diversity to their recipe, but still wanted to be edible in the end as well.

"I think we kind of settled on what to make. But man, all that talk about food made me a bit hungry. I feel like I could eat that huge bowl they serve at Aiya's right now."

"But we just ate Chaien. You even said you were feeling full after we finished eating. I know you run a lot to compensate, but you could risk getting a stomach ache. Sometimes you eat as much as Yukimura."

"You wanted me to spend some quality time at the Amagi Inn, don't you?"

"Huh?"

"When I visited you this morning Sakai-san said you wanted to spend an afternoon together. I would be happy if we could have some quality time if wish for it."

The blush from Yukiko's cheeks deepened a little, as she tried her best to not let him see it.

"What is Sakai-san doing?! She must have planned for this! But I never said anything of the sort to her! She... did this for me then? I know she isn't the type to pull out pranks like these... As much as I appreciate your help Sakai-san, please tell me beforehand what you intend to do... I don't know if I should thank her or not for this...",she thought before giving her reply in the least flustered tone she mustered. "Y-Yes. That is correct. If possible, I would like to spend a day with me if you want."

"Sure. I don't mind. I also can get a little more familiar with the inn as well. Especially since I'll have you to lead me around."

Yukiko couldn't help but smile a little at his response. "Thank you. I'll call you for a day in which I am not busy with helping around. I'll tell you when to come."

"Anytime you want."

She nodded to him before the two took a some curtains from a box to hang them. She gave a small, inaudible sigh as she held the ladder in place.

"He is pretty much clueless at how things are at this point... And yet I feel that it doesn't mean it's over if he gladly accepted the invitation... He may like me, but he would mean he is still unaware. I wouldn't be too surprised if that would be the case... Rise-chan may be a lot more bold than I am, but I still have a chance... Should I tell him about my curry recipe I thought of? No, I better keep the surprise. I just need to make sure it tastes great.", she thought as she happily helped him with the curtains.
1521322121111112221112112112122112222112.title: "I want to spend more time together."

1521322121111112221112112112122112222112.content:
Meanwhile, Chaie and Yosuke arrived at a storage room on their floor to pick up the things Yosuke wanted.

"So what exactly are he taking?"

"Some table tops, napkins and some plates and cups."

"Huh? Are we going to serve people?"

"Just some water, juice, maybe some tea or even coffee, I don't know. It's pretty hard to sit at a table and talk without having your mouth dried up. And we need to serve the people some snacks or something to it a little less tense. Seriously, it would be more like a meeting than a date otherwise."

"How do you know that?"

"Dad told me a few times. When he hosted a party or something like that, he needed some snacks to have people not feel bored of just standing in the room... Or something like that. He has experience at this, so I trust him."

"If you say so. But why do you need me? None of these are heavy."

"They are if you carry them on your own. And I didn't want to disturb Yu with his work, and Yukiko-san isn't that good at carrying too many things, so that's why I called you."

"Fine, I guess I'll help. But I'll say it again. I don't really see why you needed me for this. You could've just carry these yourself and make another trip or two here for the rest that you couldn't carry the first time."

Yosuke stood silent for a second, almost seeming like he contemplates what he should say next, while scratching the back oh his head. Chaie was curious why he was acting he way he did, as knew that he wouldn't call him just for manual labor. As he waited for Yosuke to say anything, his breasts grew to medium B-cups and stopped there, while his testes already found their way in his abdomen, and his boyhood was already starting to get smaller.

After giving out a small sigh, Yosuke asked: "Sorry if this sounds a bit strange, but... Do you like Yu?"

"W-What's that supposed to mean? Of course I do! What isn't to like-"

"I don't mean the way you like Rukiko-san, but the way Rise-san likes Yu."

Chaie's face started to redden as he answered back in a really flustered manner: "D-Don't be stupid! I-I-I don't like him like that! And besides, I am not interested in a boyfriend or anything!"

"Chaie, if you want to deny that, you shouldn't look so panicked when you say that...", he said as the other tried to regain his composure. "And besides, you were going to say that there is nothing that would make him a person you don't want to be around, right?"

Chaie was at a loss for words. Yosuke really cornered him this time, and he really didn't know how to get out of this.

"W-What makes you think I like him? You don't see me acting all giddy around him like Rise-chan."

"To be honest, I had my doubts at the start, but... I don't know if you really noticed yourself but the more we dived in the TV world, the more attached to him you seemed to get. You really seemed to like being in his company as much as Rukiko-san, who is a bit more open after we rescued him."

"So? Is that such a bad thing? Liking someone's company doesn't mean any romance."

"True, but you aren't the type to wish to spend too much time with others when Yukiko-san is available. Normally you two would just be together most of the time. I can get why he would wish to know him better after finally becoming less introvert, but I really didn't expect you spending some alone time with Yu. And you seemed quite happy after talking with him, more so than usual... And after Rise-san joined the group, the way you always try to cut her out every time she gets a bit too close to Yu really made me thinking. A simple friend, wouldn't try so hard to have a girl back off the way you do... It's just speculation, but this is what I believe. Am I wrong?"

Chaie was really stuck. He didn't want Yosuke to know, but knowing him, he will pester her until he's convinced, especially since he doesn't have any arguments to counter him and the the redness on his face still hasn't subsided right now. He could lie since Yosuke didn't had anything solid either, but... That would mean in a way he would betray himself as well...
1521322121111112221112112112122112222112.title: With Chaie and Yosuke

1521322121111112221112112112122112222112.content:
"Yes I like him.", replied Chaie reluctantly.

"I knew it.", said Yosuke with a small smirk on his face. "There were way too many signs for it not to be true."

"So? Are you happy now? Did you really call me here just to prove your point?"

"First of all, calm down. I don't have any intention to make fun of you or whatever else you may be thinking. Secondly, I never said liking Yu is a bad thing did I?"

"What are you getting at with this?"

"All I'm saying is that I wish you luck. I don't know if you'll manage to pass Rise-san on this but..."

"Hold on a second... I don't get you. First you don't stop asking me if I like Yu-kun to prove your hunch and now you just wish me luck?"

"Look, all I'm saying is that there is really no reason to not date Yu at this point... The only wall you might be hitting is his cluelessness to love, but I am sure you'll manage. I have faith that you will have a chance. After all, you are so not the type of person to give up on something after you put your mind into it."

Chaie was speechless. He expected Yosuke to tease him, goad that he knew Chaie would have feelings for Yu or straight up tell him to give up, given that Rise is his competition., but instead, he was actually encouraging him. He didn't feel as his boyhood continued to be pulled inside of him as a small slit formed at his groin.

"But... Why are you telling me this now?"

"I kind of figured out we wouldn't have another occasion where Rukiko-san wouldn't be around or Rise-san or Teddie to spy on us so I thought this will be a good moment to get out the truth out of you."

"But why?"

"Just to know. If I didn't knew how you were feeling and someone else snatched Yu, without anyone giving you a little morale boost, you would feel extremely down. But since Yu wasn't claimed by anyone yet, I guess there is still time you for you to try and get him."

"Wow... You actually sound really considerate right now. I am a bit at a loss..."

"Hey, that's rude! When I was ever inconsiderate with others? I am not Teddie you know?"

"Haha... You aren't, but that doesn't mean you don't let your mouth speak before you actually think sometimes..."

"Now look who's teasing me... Rise-san is already enough..."

A small giggle escaped Chaie's lips as he regained his vigor. He had felt inferior to not just Rise but to other girls as well due to his appearance, but it felt good to be told he still has a chance in the running for Yu's affection, especially after telling himself he shouldn't give up on just that. Not to mention that it wasn't clear what Yu's preferences were. One thing was certain though: He will not back down from pursuing his love.

Just then, a small yelp escaped his lips as the changes finalized as his new identity was complete, proven the pure flower she had between her legs. Yosuke, who noticed her grimacing a little asked her with a little concern in his voice.

"Hey, are you okay Chie?"

"I am fine, don't worry, I just felt a little weird there for a second, that's all... But thanks for telling me not to give up... In fact, I thought of a way already to start my pursuit.", said Chie with a big grin on her face while Yosuke could only worry a little.

"I don't know if I should tell her that there's a chance Yukiko-san and even Naoto-kun to have feelings for Yu... I don't think I should. Things will get really messy if I spill the beans, especially since Christmas is not that far away... I think Chie will notice at the very least that Yukiko-san has a thing for him eventually... I hope."

He decided to not say anything for the moment and simply picked up a couple of boxes as Chie helped him with the rest, as they began to head back to the classroom.
1521322121111112221112112112122112222112.title: "Yes, I like him."

1521322121111112221112112112122112222112.content:
Chie and Yosuke returned with the boxes, just as Yu finished with the decorations.

"Hey, sorry for taking so long. We had some issues finding these.", said Chie, while Yosuke smirked to himself at how the girl managed to somehow pull off the lie without any problems.

"That's not a problem.", assured Yu. "But did you find what you needed?"

"Yeah, we just need to set these things up. Let's start with the tablecloths for now."

"Let me help Yosuke-kun."

"Thanks Yukiko-san. Hey partner, do you mind tag teaming with Chie for this one?"

"Not at all."

The two groups then started putting the cloths on the improvised tables as they did some small talk while doing so. At one point, after a slight moment of hesitation, Chie mustered enough courage to start ask Yu:

"By the way, do you mind if we hang out at the movies next week?"

"Sure. But is there a specific reason why?"

"A new "Trail of The Dragon" movie came out not that long ago and it should come to the cinemas next week. And I was wondering if we could go together..."

"Of course. I don't mind it at all. We haven't been to a movie together for a while, so I would be more than happy to join you."

Chie started to blush a little as she continued: "Thanks... And maybe we could train a little later as well, near the flood plain. Like we did not that long ago."

"You mean preparing next time we dive into the TV world? Sure thing. Training with you is always enjoyable. It feels great to be able to do some exercising outside the basketball practice at school with someone as motivated as you are."

The Chariot Arcana within her gave out a small gleam as their bond seemed to deepen a bit more. This was perfectly demonstrated by the big, yet embarrassed smile Chie had right now. She managed to hide her blush however and firmly replied back: "Then it's settled. We'll talk more about it when the festival is over."

Yu nodded with a smile as they continued laying down the tablecloths.

"I might make a little snack for us for after the movie. I will tell him about the curry I will make. Hope he will like my ideas for the dish... Just focus on the cook book and nothing else. That seems like the winning strategy for this."

While Chie was having her monologue, Yu also started to think about something he noticed about Chie and Yukiko.

"They both are starting to act a little different than before. Ever since that concert at Junes, they seem a lot more eager to spend time with me. I wonder why though. Nothing major happened after rescuing Naoto... Could it be...? They are a little more bashful than Rise is, but... No, I may be overreacting. There is no real proof here. Besides, I need to discern if Rise's feelings are true or not... I really doubt she is acting... but if it's true than maybe they too are...Now's not the time for this. Right now, I should focus on the festival. I will think about this later... But I may need to ask uncle Dojima what he thinks about the situation later just to be sure... And also to find a day when her and Yukiko's schedules don't overlap."

On the side, Yukiko and Yosuke were silently watching from the side the interaction between their friends, and while they couldn't hear what they were saying, they saw Chie's mood improve suddenly before they went back to work.

"It sure looks like Chie's morale suddenly increased."

"Can you guess why?"

"Not really. Maybe Narukami-kun told her a good joke or maybe Chie told her about her new favorite movie that came out."

"...Don't you think that Chie might have another reason for getting happy all of a sudden."

"Not really, no. There are still a lot of ways to brighten her up like this, so who knows. Also, I will be busy next week. Narukami-kun wants to visit the inn to better know the staff. So sorry if one of these days I won't be able to meet up with you guys. And please don't tell Rise-chan about this."

"... I won't", said Yosuke as the two put another cloth on a table. "...They aren't even aware that they both have a thing for Yu. And how does he manage to get so well with so many girls all at once?... I guess there are questions I won't find the answer yet... I just hope my partner will still be in one piece if they do find out... Although knowing the two... you never know how things will play out. Heck, even Rise might overlook this... Guess it's a waiting game then. I am not dumb enough to involve myself in a love war between girls..."

Meanwhile, at the Amagi Inn, Sakai was cleaning a particular room when she noticed something next to the TV set.

"Hmm? Is this a foreign coin?", she pondered as she picked the coin up. "I wonder if someone lost it here. It doesn't seem to be Japanese by the markings it has... It may belong to one of the previous customers, but this room was occupied two days ago and there is nothing about someone losing something this valuable... I guess I will look into it at a later date."

She then recalled the events of the morning as she continued to hold onto the coin. "Yukiko-san did come in here for a little while... I wonder if she noticed it... But then again, she and Chie-san were surely distracted by Narukami-san's visit... Love can be such a beautiful thing when you're young... I heard they are against Kujikawa-san, but I am sure one of them will win over his heart... Still, I wish both of them had the same chances of winning him as any other."

The coin grew warm for a second in her hand, but the she didn't notice.

"Still, I would be a little unfair if I wouldn't support Yukiki-san, but Chie-san deserves a chance as well... I guess only time will tell who will become the lucky winner.", she giggled to herself as she pocketed the coin and continued cleaning the room.

1522213331.title: Tae

15222133311.content:
"All right! Let's have some fun!"

Brandon Thomas couldn't be any happier. He just celebrated his 12th birthday less than a month ago and he was now at last at the appropriate age to play Persona 5. He heard so many good things about the game recently and from his brief experience he got from Persona 4 Golden, after playing it a little with his older friends, he was thrilled he could play the newest installment in the series on his own.

However, his family didn't buy him the game for the birthday despite asking for it, with his parents suggesting he should play something more tame first. But he was having none of it. He searched for places where he could buy the game cheaper, but he didn't find any site or store that would sell it so that his allowance would be enough to buy it. One day however, he found an old man at a little store in the market, selling different types of goods at much cheaper prices than someone would expect, one of them being the Persona 5 game. The man happily gave him the game, as he said he needed some income for his newly opened store, this lowering the prices enough for most people to buy them. But there was something that the man said that caught his attention.

"I hope you like doctors little guy. Playing this game will surely make you understand the life of one, with both good and bad things that could happen..."

Brandon was confused by the man's words, but he paid little attention to them as he went home to play the game. From the moment he started playing, he was charmed by the visuals and gameplay and combat system, and was touched by the protagonist's story. After a fairly long prologue, and some awesome cutscenes, he finally got some gameplay, which he admitted was downright amazing. While he wanted to beat down Kamoshida immediately after learning of his true nature, he was intrigued by the Confidant mechanic, which allowed him to form bonds with others to strengthen your abilities.

But there was one thing that surprised him. Not too long into the game, there indeed was a doctor, Tae Takemi, just like the man said. Truth be told, she didn't look like one at first, given her attire and attitude, but he digressed, as he was curious about her character. What threw him off however was that somehow the old man knew about this character. He seriously doubted he would play a game like this at his age, and he surely didn't play his copy of it given it was unopened when he bought it. He was confused by this, but he let it slide eventually, as he continued playing the game.

Today was no different. After finishing up school, he rushed into the house and went straight into his room, not even taking off his white tennis shoes. He currently wore a white dress shirt and a pair of dark-blue jeans but no jacket, since it was still warm outside despite being November.

He then turned on his game, wishing to play at the very least until his parents got home. After loading it to just after making Sojiro's Confidant, he started to roam outside to look around. When he had to visit the doctor's clinic, he was curious to see how it would play out.

"Okay, now let's see how she is. She seemed pretty chill and cool in my opinion. I wouldn't expect that from a doctor though. They all seem pretty serious all the time. I wonder when we will get to her backstory."

After going in the clinic, and talking with her a bit, he found out Tae was working on an experimental drug and asked the protagonist to sample it out, which ended with him passing out. Afterward, she asked him to help her with her experiments with the drug and in return she would supply him with some of her medicine.

"Yikes... It makes me wonder if she will continue all these tests like this. She seems pretty shady and is a bit of a troll, but I guess she's likeable. I kind of like her playfulness."

The way things played out, it seemed like Tae would indeed become a new Confidant, but the game suddenly started to glitch and the screen froze for a few seconds.

"What the... Is this thing busted? I don't-"

Before Brandon could wonder what was going on, a bright flash came out of the TV and engulfed him. When the light faded out, he was gone.
15222133311.title: Single

152221333111.content:
When Brandon came to, he realized that he no longer was in his room. Instead, he found himself on a very busy street, with lots of stores on both sides.

"W-What happened? Where am I?... Wait a second..."

He took another glance at the street. He could clearly see that the people around him were of Asian descent, given their features, and the different signs around the place, despite not clearly understanding them, he remembered the letters from games and TV shows as kanji, the Japanese alphabet. But that wasn't all. The layout of the place, and the several stores around looked really familiar. It took him only a second to realize where he was exactly.

"T-This is... This is the street from the game! This is where the protagonist lives!... How did this happen?! Did the game do this?... But why? Everything was perfectly fine until that one scene with the doctor... Was the thing cursed or something? That old man sure didn't seem like a magician or anything like that... I need to find help. At the very least, I must find someone who can help me around. That game had the English settings on, so I can't understand a word these signs are saying..."

He slowly walked around the street, in search of someone kind enough to aid him. He knew he couldn't just ask an adult, as it would not only be a little embarrassing, but he wasn't sure someone with a job or a place he needed to go would just help him around. He decided thus to ask maybe a teenager as they might make some time for him... only if it wasn't a school day.

He walked around the street, inching closer to where Café LeBlanc was in the game. He thought he could ask Sojiro for help, since he was most of the time inside the establishment, but since he didn't knew a dime of Japanese, he knew he would have trouble trying to talk with him. However, Brandon soon bumped into a young man. He was almost knocked over, but managed to keep his footing.

"Oh, I am sorry."

"No problem..."

Brandon was shocked. While he was surprised the person he bumped into spoke English, he was distracted by who he actually was. The black, unkempt hair, the glasses and the gray eyes were way too familiar for him to miss. As the young man seemed to move away, Brandon called to him.

"W-Wait!"

"Huh? What is it?"

"A-Actually..." Brandon knew he couldn't outright tell him about how he got here, as even in the story about the Metaverse, a game that sends you to another world would be way too far-fetched. "I-I am a bit lost here. Can you help me ?"

The young man took a few glances at the boy, noticing his blue eyes and blond hair before he said: "Are you a tourist by some some chance?"

"Y-Yes... I am Brandon Thomas by the way..."

"Ren Amamiya. Nice to meet you.", said Ren as he offered Brandon a handshake, which he politely accepted.

"Is that his actual name? There was no clue about that in the game... It actually sounds a lot cooler than what I named him...", muttered the boy to himself.

"So how did you get lost?"

"Um... I somehow found myself here. I know it sounds weird, but you have to believe me."

"Wait. You mean you don't know how you got here?"

"Well... I decided to look around the area a little and I guess... I kind of lost track of where I am..."

"So you got separated from others as you strolled a bit and now you found yourself here?"

"Y-Yeah, kind of..."

"Were your parents with you?"

"N-Not exactly, no..."

"Hmm..." Ren pondered a little before smiling a little and saying. "Don't worry. I'll help you. Can you come with me? I know a place you can stay while I can get help."

"S-Sure! Thank you!"

Ren then offered his hand, and the two walked together to Café LeBlanc.

"Oh man... I know I shouldn't be as excited as I am right now, but this is awesome! I got to meet Ren and next I will meet Sojiro. I wonder if I can meet the other character as well... Though for Ren to hold my hand like that... Feels a little weird. But somehow it also feels nice..."

Inside Ren's bag, a black cat peaked out of it and looked at Brandon.

"Something off about this kid... It could be my imagination, but he feels like he shouldn't belong here.... Then again, I have to agree with Ren, that he totally looks like a tourist... Maybe I am thinking to hard about this. Only time will tell if this is just a feeling or something else..."
152221333111.title: On the street

1522213331112.content:
When the two entered the café, they expected to see Sojiro on a seat, reading the newspaper, however they found that the bespectacled man was nowhere in sight.

"Hey, Boss are you here?", asked Ren aloud, but receiving no answer. "That's strange. The door isn't locked but he isn't here..."

"Do you think he went somewhere and forgot to close the place up?"

"I would normally say no, but... He once left the front door to his house open by accident. If he left in a hurry he may have forgotten to lock the door... He did say he needed tome more ingredients for the curry, but I didn't expect him to leave in such a rush..."

Brandon was a bit disappointed. It was true that he didn't knew much about Sojiro, nor he was one of the characters he really wanted to meet, but he still wanted to at the very least talk with him a little. He found it a little funny though how someone that looked as serious as Sojiro would forget to lock the door, not only to the café, but t his house as well. His little moment of amusement was however interrupted by a little feeling of dizziness. It was in a way similar to the time his parents gave him a little bit of alcohol to drink up, although there was no migraine this time. Ren noticed the boy looked a little lightheaded and tapped his shoulder a little worried.

"Are you okay? Are you feeling sick?"

"No, I just feel a little dizzy for some reason....", assured Brandon, but even he was a bit confused by why he felt the way he did all of a sudden.

Without noticing, his feet started to grow a little bigger inside his shoes. But as they did, his toes became arched and smaller, while they gained a pedicure in the process. But what was the weirdest thing that happened was that his toenails were now coated by a red nail polish.

As soon as the lightheartedness came, it disappeared just as fast, Brandon being surprised at how everything seemed normal again.

"I feel better all of a sudden now."

"Are you sure? You looked a little out of it a second ago."

"I am fine now... Whatever that was it is gone now..."

"Really?", asked Ren, with the boy nodding in response. While he was curious what may have caused him to feel unwell, he sighed as he saw the boy looked alright now. "If you say so... I would take you to Takemi-san to give you a small check-up, but she said she would arrive later today..."

Brandon perked up a little upon hearing the doctor's name as he inquired: "Is she a famous doctor or something?"

"Not really. She runs a small clinic not far from here, but she doesn't work at a hospital. She may seem a little... apathetic at times, but she is a really good physician... It's just that she sometimes prefers to do some things her way..."

During the conversation, Brandon's sneakers started to darken, as the white became a light-gray. That wasn't all, as they lost their laces and the material seemed to overall thin out, being less form-fitting for his bigger feet. The soles also lost almost all of its ridges, becoming nearly flat in the process.

"That's strange. She doesn't seem to be that important... She is a "Confidant", but I wonder why the old man from before talked about her the way he did? Also, what did Ren meant by "apathetic" and "liking doing things her way". She did look a little playful and a little sly given how she convince him to try that medicine out in the game, but she didn't seem too different than that... That makes me wonder what kind of work she does...", thought Brandon to himself, as Ren looked at his watch in a bit of worry.
1522213331112.title: There is no one inside

15222133311122.content:
Noticing Ren's frown, Brandon asked him: "Is something the matter?"

"I am a bit busy today. I have a few appointments scheduled and I need to make it on time. I am in a bit of a hurry, so I don't know what should I do right now..."

Brandon was confused. Initially, he thought Ren had to leave for school, but upon a better look at his clothes, he saw that he was dressed a little too casual for school. A quick peek at a calendar on the wall, confirmed that in this world it was Saturday, which meant Ren should be free today. But he was having a schedule? While he played the game, he noticed that he needed to spend time with others to raise his Confidant level. He kind of got the idea that it meant that Ren had to meet others during the day as well, but to have a schedule for that seemed way too out-there. And given by how worried he looked, that meant he had to have made quite a big number of appointments.

A part of him wanted to go with him, since he wanted to meet the rest of his friends, that were not yet shown in the game, but he realized it would be too much of a hassle. Not only would Ren need to drag him along for whatever he needed to do today, but it would surely feel a little awkward, as he needed to stay close to him to get get lost, which would make his private time with his friends quite "crowded"... And there was also figuring out how to get home as well...

As he was thinking, his hair started to grow out. But it wasn't much, as his mane grew slightly thicker, without changing his hairstyle too much. But its color was what was started to become a lot different, as it started to darken, the one golden locks turning into a sandy-blond color.

After sighing to himself, and resigning to his situation, he told Ren: "You can go. I'll just wait here for the owner."

"Are you sure?", asked Ren, a bit surprised by the younger boy's words. "I know I am a bit busy today, but I think I can afford some time to stay with you a little bit longer."

"I'll be fine, don't worry. I am old enough to take care of myself. I'll just wait here until the owner comes back. Besides, I don't want to take out too much of your time. I am sure you have a lot to do today, so I don't want to disturb you from your personal time. Just tell your friends I said hi."

Ren was really impressed. He didn't expect someone who was this young to be as composed as he was. He almost seemed mature in a way... Regardless, Sojiro had to return eventually, as he wouldn't close the café on a weekend after all. Ren was sure he will get back in about 15 minutes at most.

"Okay, I'll call Boss and tell him about you. He should be coming back any time now, but I want to make sure he doesn't get surprised when he founds a random boy in here alone. Just make sure you don't cause any trouble."

"I won't, don't worry."

"Okay then. But before I leave, let me tell you a little about Boss."

Ren started describing Sojiro a bit to Brandon, and even though he knew a little about him from what he saw in the game, he was happy he could gain a few more details about Sojiro. In the meantime, his dark jeans began to tighten around his legs, showing them a little more now. Also, the material started to soften a little, as the color began to turn from blue to green.

"Okay, did you get all that?"

"Yeah, don't worry. I'll chat a bit with him before I leave... for my group..."'

"Sounds good. I wishes I stood a little bit longer, but I need to leave now."

"Don't worry. Just make it in time for your friends."

"I will. And thanks... I will tell them about you as well... So... I guess this is goodbye for now..."

After the two saluted each other, they parted ways as Ren left the café.

"Oh... I forgot to ask him how he speaks English if we are in Japan...", thought Brandon. "Oh well, if it means Boss will also speak English, then I will have no issues talking with him."

Inside Ren's bag, Morgana was also having a little dilemma of his own. "That kid spoke Japanese really well... I guess Ren got a bit used to it and didn't question it after we met that foreign exchange student from Shinya's class... I guess in the end he really was just a lost tourist... Whatever I found odd before must've been my imagination.", mumbled the cat as Ren texted on his phone to Sojiro about Brandon. "Still, why was Takemi busy today again? I thought she said she would in fact be free... Oh well, maybe something came up and Ren forgot to tell me..."
15222133311122.title: Ren leaves

152221333111222.content:
Brandon took a seat on a booth, which he was pleasantly surprised to see how comfortable it was. Not long after, he started to think of his current predicament.

"Okay, so let's see... First this old man who opens a new shop that I haven't seen before gives me a game at a much cheaper price than I ever found. Everything about the game is great and all... then all of a sudden the game crashes and the next second it teleports me inside of it. And it so happens when I get to make a Confidant with Takemi, the doctor the old man said I would understand her... This really doesn't make any sense. I really doubt that guy played the game before, he's just too old for that. And why does he specified the doctor in particular? Is there something I am missing? Well, she is one of the first people you can establish a relationship with in the game, but she didn't seem that special. Besides, she's not even here from what Ren told me. So how am I supposed to understand her life and job if I can't meet her?"

There was surely something that tied the old man to what was going on right now, but he didn't ask any questions about the game, as he was too excited to play it, which he was kicking himself right now. As he was thinking, his skin lost any traces of body hair it once had, except that one on his head, leaving it perfectly smooth. Also, he started to become a little paler, as he was gradually losing the usual tan he had from spending quite a lot of time outside.

"... I guess I can meet her later if want to. It's not like she would be away all day long. It makes me wonder though why he mentioned her specifically like that... I guess it would be cool to see how a doctor does their job and knowing a bit more about medicine might be useful later...", thought Brandon as he began getting a bit curious about how would a physician work like... as well as wanting to learn a bit about medicine in general." Still, I don't think that should be my priority at the moment... I guess I should've told Ren the truth about how I got here... Who knows, maybe he would've found a solution or something... I mean the whole Metaverse thing is more or less with magic too... It sucks that I don't know when he comes back though... I wonder what he told Boss. I guess I will find out when he comes back from his shopping..."

He then patiently waited for Sojiro to arrive, looking around the place to keep himself preoccupied. During this time, the top portion of his shoes almost completely vanished. What was left was a few straps that covered his feet like a pair of sandals, but the straps got connected by another one as it started to slowly crawl its way upwards to his calves. His pants also started to recede, as they currently revealed his ankles. After about 5 minutes, Brandon thought of something.

"Hmm... This place is currently empty. So I guess I should check it out a bit until Sojiro comes back." A part of him wanted to visit the kitchen, as he wanted to know if the recipe for the famous curry the café was selling was there. But as much as he would love to know how to cook the food from a game, there was another place he wanted to see. At first, he thought it would be a little mean to go there, but he was slowly developing a sense of boldness that made him want to know a certain person better... "I don't think Ren would mind if I look in his room a bit, right? I am not going to touch anything. so I guess there shouldn't be an issue..."
152221333111222.title: Waiting

1522213331112222.content:
There was something about visiting Ren's room that was somehow very appealing. A part of him knew it was mostly because he wanted to know more about the protagonist of the game he was playing, except this time with emotions of his own. But there was this sudden desire to know him more than just a character of the game, something more important... Brandon shook his head as he stood up and made his ways up the stairs to the attic. If things were the same way that he thought, Ren's room would be upstairs.

And indeed it was. Despite the somewhat cramped space, but he noticed that some of the old stuff inside was now gone, as it was no longer cluttered like before, while his bed, couch and improvised desk were the same way like he remembered from the game. Sure there also were new stuff in there such as an old TV, an old gaming console, a heater, some plushies and a poster, with a character he remembered from Persona 4 and another one with what he assumed to be the Phantom Thieves logo he saw before in various ads for the game.

"Huh... This place doesn't look too bad. I was a bit worried it would seem a little dull, but Ren really seems to have taken care of this place... But it still kind of looks a bit too rustic for my taste. I guess I can't complain though. It's a lot better than it was in the beginning."

As he was looking around the room, he missed the fact that he slowly started to grow in height, as he aged from 12 to 15 years old. But the increase wasn't too drastic, as he grew by only a few inches, making him tiny bit shorter than a boy his current age. This however did made his clothes a bit tighter on him, but he didn't seem to mind. Like before, he felt a little dizzy for a brief second, but this time the sensation didn't persist, thus he didn't ponder too much on it.

"There is really a lot of stuff he can buy if he can fill his room all these things. But what's with the crappy TV? It looks like it came from over 10 years ago. And this console looks prehistoric... Where did he even find all these games for it anyway? Not that I am a video game person anyway... Wait, I am one right? I play games on my console once a week... Or was it once every two days?... Okay Bandon, keep calm and focus on this", he said to himself as he tried to calm focus his thoughts, not noticing the different way he addressed himself as. "Man, do I still feel a bit woozy from before? What was that anyway? Well maybe it was some sort of vertigo or something like that... It may be a side effect of coming into this world... Well, I guess I should head downstairs now. Boss may be coming back any minute now and I don't want to make him angry by snooping around... But if it was Ren the one that came back, I guess it wouldn't be too bad..."

Before he could head down, he felt his pants and shirt grew even tighter on him, as they clung to his body a lot more. He was confused as to why this was happening, but didn't ponder too much on it, as it didn't cause him any discomfort.

There was a part of him that seemed a bit more mischievous, that wanted to play around with Ren a bit, thinking he should hide in the room to see his reaction later, but he quickly let go of that thought as he went down the stairs. He also started to improve his vocabulary, as he knew quite a larger array of words than before, the curious thing about it being that a good portion of them were medical terms. Lastly, in regards to his name, his memories changed, firmly believing his name was now Bandon Tomas. It wasn't a big change at the moment, but soon, this will have many other implications...
1522213331112222.title: Ren's room

15222133311122221.content:
Just as he reached the ground level, Bandon heard someone at the door. He quickly took a seat at one of the booths as the bell rang once the door was opened. The person that entered was a middle aged man with slicked-back dark hair and a receding hairline, a chinstrap beard with a goatee and black glasses, and was carrying a few shopping bags in his hands. He wore a pair of pale khakis, a pink shirt with its sleeves rolled up and a blazer on top of it. It took the man a moment to notice the boy, which prompted the boy to stand up.

"H-Hello. Can I help you with the bags?"

"No, thank you, I've got it.", said the man, slightly impressed by the boy's politeness. "I guess you're the one the kid told me about."

"Yes, I am Bandon Tomas. Nice to meet you sir."

"Likewise. I am Sojiro Sakura, but people around here call me Boss. I am sorry for your circumstances, but given how big this place is, it really isn't a surprise to get lost around here."

"Yeah... It really was unfortunate...", said Brandon, but since he didn't want the discussion to head to a territory he didn't know, he decided to steer the conversation to a different direction. "So, uh... I noticed the door was left open. Did something happen?"

"No, it's just that I forgot. I know it was just for only 15 minutes or so, but it is pretty inexcusable to let the front door opened like that. I guess this is one of the signs that I am getting a little old..."

"Don't worry, everyone forgets things from time to time. And you don't look too old anyway."

"Heh, thanks kid. Can you wait a little until I put these things away? It won't take long."

"Sure. Take your time."

Sojiro thanked the boy as he went into the kitchen, a she took his blazer off, while Bandon sat down again. As he waited, he didn't notice how his feet started to feel as if they were pushed upwards, a small platform forming underneath, while the color of his pants became even smoother, the fabric not being as rough as before, as they lost any pockets it once had.

"He sure seems like a nice guy. In the game, he was a bit colder, but I guess that as the story progresses, he starts to open up, huh? It's kind of cliché, but I don't mind it. Character development is important for every good story... I wonder when exactly he starts changing. Maybe after his daughter got better and started going out of the house..." Bandon stopped himself, as he realized what he just said. "Wait, how do I know that? And he has a daughter?! But there is no mom around or anything... Did she appear later in the story? Or is there something I am missing?... Did I spoil myself with some details about the story by accident?... I don't think so..."

While trying to get his thoughts together, his hands started to slim out as his fingers and nails got a bit longer. He missed the fact that the same red nail polish that was on his feet was now coating his fingernails, or that his hands became a little smaller as the same process started to happen to his forearms as they too started to become slimmer.

But before h could think further, Sojiro stepped out of the kitchen, which prompted Bandon to walk up to him, as he tried to regain his composure. Maybe he could ask Boss about the whole daughter business to make sure that he didn't remember anything wrong. But there was the risk that this was something he shouldn't know about Sojiro as well, and asking him something like that would seem suspicious.
15222133311122221.title: Sojiro arrives

152221333111222212.content:
In the end, Bandon decided against it. He didn't want to risk blowing his cover. Not to mention it would seem more like he was a stalker rather than someone from another world. And since he didn't know if Sojiro would even tell him about his supposed daughter in the first place, he settled to try and sort his thoughts out before anything else.

"Okay, I finished prepping the kitchen for when the rush hour comes."

"Does it really get so busy around here?"

"Well, not always, but I do have a good number of clients at noon and some time later. Some come here for the curry, and some come just for the coffee... By the way, do you want to take a cup?"

"Huh?"

"Well, it is a bit earlier than usual, but if you want some coffee I can make a cup for you."

"But uh... I don't have any money at me."

"Don't sweat it, kid. I am not going to charge you money given your circumstances. Besides, I am sure you need something to brighten you up a bit as well, don't you?"

While Bandon was pleased to see that Sojiro's politeness, he wasn't sure he wanted coffee. Of course, he would've loved to eat his famous curry, which apparently can also be eaten for breakfast, but this would be too much to ask. He also didn't like coffee too much either. It always seemed to bitter for him, and the only time he liked it was when he put a lot of cream and sugar into it, but he thought in his opinion, that it kind of ruined the taste as well, as it didn't resemble the former taste it had.

He was about to turn down the offer, but he suddenly felt a little sore in his throat, as his vocal chords started to tighten a little. He thought a little water would do the trick, but at the same time, an odd craving to drink a bit of coffee began to appear. He didn't understood why he would to, but he was now thinking that drinking the beverage would make him a little more mature... and also since there was no carbonated drink around, he thought some caffeine wouldn't harm him right now.

"I think I will have one please."

"Sure thing. Got any flavor you would want to try out?"

"Uh... I'll leave it to you. I am not that knowledgeable with the different types of beans you have... "

"Very well. Wait a few minutes until I make it.", said Sojiro as he put on his apron and started working on the coffee, while Bandon sat on one of the stools.

While waiting, his shirt continued becoming tighter on him as its neckline started to plunge a little. Also, the fabric began to soften a little as well, as the texture was slowly becoming similar to that of his pants. Lastly, his sleeves also began to recede, leaving his forearms almost completely bare.

But he didn't notice anything , as he was slowly analyzing the situation. What seemed a little off was that he seemed a lot more calm about his predicament, no longer feeling nervous and confused as he did in the beginning, with his vocabulary also gradually improving.

"Something feels off about all this. I wonder why Boss isn't already calling the police, given the circumstances of the story I made up. He doesn't seem alarmed at all... And he didn't ask many question about me either. Did Ren tell him enough for him to consider it's enough? Wouldn't it make more sense to ask me directly? It would seem more beneficial... Also, there seems to be something wrong with me as well. The whole family affair aside, I don't know why I wanted to drink coffee all of a sudden. The benefits of caffeine are a given, but I don't particularly remember a time when I drank... Oh wait... If I recall correctly I think I drank some before. Yeah, I think I had one at breakfast yesterday I believe. But why couldn't I remember that a second ago?... Maybe my mind is still muddled a bit after all that happened... I wonder when Ren comes back... Maybe I should ask Boss about it..."
152221333111222212.title: Sojiro offers him coffee

1522213331112222121.content:
Just before he could ask, Sojiro handed him a cup of coffee.

"There you go. It is one of the most popular we have here. I could go and tell you more about the way it should taste, but why won't you taste it first. Oh, I almost forgot. You are free to add a little sugar if you want.", said Boss as he handed you a small jar.

Bandon still didn't understand why he thought he wanted to drink coffee in the first place, but it was slowly growing on him to drink the beverage. If this was the way he would normally act in this situation, he would try to add as much sugar as he could to get rid of the bitter taste, but somehow, he didn't find it a necessity to try and sweeten up the coffee as much as he did before. He added one teaspoon of sugar, and that was it. After stirring it up for a few seconds, he took the cup in his hands. The aroma was powerful enough to enter his nostrils, and found out that it actually seemed pretty nice, intriguing him a little bit more about about what will the brew taste like.

He then took a small sip out of it, and was pleasantly surprised by how good the coffee tasted. It was much sweeter than he anticipated, and it also had a nutty flavor to it, which made him even more pleased by how it tasted. As he slowly drank the cup, with each gulp, the bulge in his throat got smaller and smaller, his Adam's Apple seemingly getting dissolved by the tasty liquid. This in turn, made his vocal chords a lot tighter and slowly rose his voice in pitch with every gulp. The cup was half empty at this point, but there was still plenty left for him to savor later.

"... That sure was nice, especially the small nutty taste it had...", said Bandon with a small sigh, not noticing how high-pitched his voice sounded, or the small seductiveness it had in its tone. "What brew was it?"

"It was Cuban Crystal Mountain. I had a feeling you weren't in the mood for something too bitter, so I chose one that was naturally sweet with low acidity.", replied Sojiro a bit proud of himself. "If this was the kid, I would go a little more in depth about the process the coffee is made, but I don't want to bore you about it."

"I see..."

Honestly, Bandon was indeed a little curious now as to what other flavors Boss had around and if he would like them as much as he did the current one. But as the topic about Ren came up, he found this to be a good opportunity to ask about him. However, he needed to straighten his back, as he felt a little stiff.

"Hmm... My posture might have determined this. I was leaning forward for most of the time I was waiting for the coffee as well...", he mused to himself as he pushed his back forward. A couple of seconds later, his spine was now in a permanent arch, making him a tad more flexible, while his chest was pushed out a little bit more.

"Are you okay?"

"Yes. It's just a stiff back, don't worry about it, it's fine now.", said Bandon in a more composed tone than before. "By the way, do you know when Ren is coming back?"

"Hm? Why do you ask?"

"Just out of curiosity, before I am to leave."

"... To be honest, I don't know.", said Sojiro with a small sigh. "These days, he is really busy by the looks of things. Other than spending time with his friends, he also plays shogi with a girl at a church, goes to a fortune teller in Shibuya and even helps a minor politician with his speeches at times too from time to time from what I hear. He does a lot of things lately, and he even has a few side jobs... How he manages to do all that, and to help me around here is beyond me. Maybe it's the power of youth, or he just knows a trick to conserve energy I don't know of."

"... And what is your opinion about him?"

"Well... I initially thought he would be a trouble maker, but I was really wrong. He is a lot more kind than I gave him credit for, and he sure has a way to draw people around him, given how hard he tries to please so many different people. Sure, he has his moments when he can act like a normal teenager, but he quite mature most of the time. Kind of wish more youngsters were like him these days."

Bandon was happy with Boss's answer, proving that the type of character he thought to be was correct. He was glad that Ren was indeed as nice as he seemed in game... In game? Didn't he mean how he was before? He was a little confused as to why he would compare Ren to a game character, when he was an actual person. It was true, that he was now in his reality, instead of the game... but right now, Bandon didn't make the correlation with the video game purchased anymore.
1522213331112222121.title: Asking about Ren

15222133311122221211.content:
Looking at the clock, Sojiro saw it was almost noon. The time for when his customers would normally arrive was approaching, which meant, he had to prepare the curry before they would arrive. However, despite Bandon not looking hungry at the moment, he thought it would be disrespectful towards him to feed others, while not feeding him.

"Say, do you also want to take lunch?"

"Huh?"

"I know it isn't quite noon yet, but people should start arriving soon, and I was wandering if you would like some curry."

"But... like I said before, I don't have any money on me."

"Don't worry about it. Just considered it a favor this time. It is not as though a plate would matter too much. The kid would come later too, so I am sure he'll eat somewhere else, so I'll just consider it as his meal. That way, you can have it for free.", smiled Sojiro, knowing full well Ren wouldn't mind giving his lunch to someone in need.

Bandon was however confused. While he didn't mind eating for free, he was surprised by how calm Boss was. He would have expected to call the police, given the circumstances of the story he made up. But not only did it seem like he wasn't concerned at all, he actually behaved like he would normally would... But there was something that confused the boy slightly.

Up until now, he used his knowledge from the game to manage to talk with Boss and Ren, but he now seemed to know Sojiro's character a little better, almost as if he knew him for quite a while,, which seemed strange for him, given he only saw him a few times in the game. Also, unbeknownst to him, he was slowly forgetting about Ann, Ryuji and especially Morgana, only remembering a few details about them. But when it cam down to Ren, he actually knew more about him than he knew Boss. While it would be impossible to know that, since he didn't even had a real personality in the game, he now started to gain memories of him and Ren spending time together, as well as gaining a sense of gratitude for him that he didn't knew much about yet...

Without him noticing, he grew older again, this time going up to 18 years old. He grew in height quite a bit, although contrary to what a teenage boy should look like, he remained quite slim, as his muscles didn't grew too much, while his legs became a bit longer than before, giving him a lanky appearance. And speaking of his legs, his calves started to morph, as they became sleeker and slimmer, and while they didn't became too toned, they nonetheless looked quite fit. As for his footwear, the straps settled to end just below the middle of his calves, before circling it three times. Also, his feet rose further, as they grew a small platform, but his heels grew even further, effectively turning his former shoes into a pair of strappy black platform high heels.

Thinking this should be a good time to clear his head, and also to eat a bit to try and ease his nerves a little, Bandon decided to stay for lunch.

"I think I will accept your offer, thank you very much."

"Okay then. It will take a while to prepare it, so can watch TV if you want to until then... I am sorry, but somehow I forgot your name already...", said Sojiro a bit sheepishly, as he picked up the remote.

"Don't worry about it. It's Banon Tamas."

"Okay Banon... Here's the remote. You're free to watch whatever you wish, just make sure not to have the volume too loud."

"Got it.", said Banon as Sojiro went back into the kitchen, while turned the TV on.
15222133311122221211.title: Staying for lunch

152221333111222212111.content:
Banon was surfing through the channels as Sojiro started to prepare the ingredients for the curry. Despite the text and language on screen was Japanese, he could perfectly understand what the people on TV said. He had a few instances where he stopped for a talent show or a cartoon, but quickly lost his interest as he continued surfing through the channels. He was slowly getting quite bored the more he searched, the things that would usually entertained him would now seem childish. He was also getting a feeling he should be somewhere else as well, but he currently brushed the feeling off as he thought it was his home.

As he was searching, his shirt completely lost all of its buttons, the fabric no longer being split down the middle. As for its color, it also started to darken, gaining a dark-green hue, as it slowly started to resemble his pants. Speaking of them, the green got a bit more dominant, as the fabric lost all of its roughness. In addition, it now got to just below his knees, as his beautiful calves were now fully on display.

After a couple more minutes of channel surfing, he found a news channel, and given there wasn't anything else to watch, he decided to watch the news to pass a little bit of time. It went through the regular things, such as the upcoming election and something he was slightly more familiar, about how the psychotic breakdowns were not as frequent as they once were. Banon had to admit, he was still blown back by how disturbing the scene with the breakdown at the start of the game was, thus he had a general knowledge of how they worked. But he was slowly starting to forget about said scene, instead remembering a few medical reports on them.

"And now, about the current topic that everyone wants to know more about, the Phantom Thieves...", said the newscaster, which drew Banon's attention. He knew who was he referring to, but he was curious what he had to say about the group. "The police still hasn't found any clues or suspects regarding the identities of the Phantom Thieves, even after the 30 million yen ransom has been made public. After the murder of the CEO of Okumura foods, Kunikazu Okumura, and the principal of Shujin Academy, there has been a non-stop search for the group, with unfortunately, to traces of them being found, as no new targets have been posted on their website. Furthermore, Detective Goro Akechi, who recently admitted a hypothesis about the thieves' innocence, decided to withdraw temporarily from public events, as he desired to get to the bottom of this case. Despite Akechi's theory, the police and the Special Investigation Unit continue to pursue the group, with them warning the people to contact authorities should they find a clue regarding the Phantom Thieves..."

The more he listened, the more confused Banon got. There were so many things that shocked him, the biggest thing being the accusation of murder that the thieves got. He immediately knew that this was the group that Ren lead, together with his friends, so hearing something as shocking as having them take someone's life was completely impossible to comprehend. While trying to understand, his waist started to cave in a little, as his figure continued to turn less muscular with each passing second, but he simply brushed it off as a small craving for food, so he didn't think of it too much.

"The Phantom Thieves killed someone? There has to be a mistake... I mean, the group decided to steal the Treasure, not kill the person, did they? And why did they choose the principle of the school and this Kunikazu guy to kill off? This doesn't make sense..." He then paused for a second as the confusion on his face was soon replaced by frustration. "It has to be a setup. There is no other way... If they really were responsible for something like this, they should've killed off that mafia boss rather than Kunikazu and that principal. And why would they do that when their popularity is at its peak?... I swear, people jump to conclusions way too early these days..."

Without him noticing, Banon has been referencing events that he shouldn't know, unless he would progress in the game's story to a certain event, but now everything he knew from a player's perspective, including the Confidants and even the game itself, was slowly replaced with memories of himself hearing about the thieves' exploits from the news rather than the game.

"And besides... Ren would never do something like that... He is way too kind-hearted to be the monster the media describes him as..", said Banon to himself, as his face softened a little and his expression turned slightly sad.
152221333111222212111.title: The news

1522213331112222121111.content:
"So, they are still talking about the Phantom Thieves, are they?", asked Sojiro as he stepped out of the kitchen, holding a plate of curry in his hand.

"Yes. I know killing a person is a serious accusation, but they seem a bit rash about all this, don't you think?"

The older man sighed, as he put the plate on the counter. "... I don't know much about the thieves, but I can't help thinking that the police is just trying to find a scapegoat... They have been losing face to them lately, so maybe this is a way to show how unreliable and distrustful the Phantom Thieves are. Besides, killing a CEO of a big company like that is a bit too extreme in my opinion. Kind of defeats the whole "changing someone's heart" thing, eh?"

"...Most likely. I just can't think they are as bad as the media says they are..."

"Heh... I guess they should be happy they still have a faithful fan like you around."

Banon laughed a little at the statement. He knew Ren and the others were respectable people, so there was no doubt that he was innocent of whatever the people on TV said... But there was one thing among his thoughts that slightly confused him. The annoyance of the accusations aside, he was somewhat feeling a bit more involved with them than he should, and there was this sensation of feeling indebted to Ren in particular for something, but couldn't tell exactly why.

As he was thinking, the shirt and the pants fully became a dark-green color, as the pants were now just over his knees and his sleeves only covered his shoulders, as any pockets he had prior were now gone. Additionally, they slowly started to fuse with each other at the seams, as they gradually became harder to stay apart with each passing second. Not that Banon noticed, as he was too busy with his thoughts. But he decided to figure things later, as he went do eat his meal.

He took a glance at the curry in front of him. It looked really tasty, but while he didn't eat anything like this before, his memories were saying something different.

"So... This is today's special?", he asked Sojiro.

"Well, it is the regular recipe, but I do mix or swap a few ingredients from time to time to change the flavour if only by a little. I added today a bit more garam masala, but the usual blend of spices that I use is still there."

"I see... I suppose you aren't going to tell me the recipe if I like it, do you?"

"Heh... That goes without saying...", said the man with a small grin.

Banon took one last glance at the curry before he took his spoon and put a good amount in his mouth. The second he tasted it, he was pleasantly surprised how good it was. The flavors were in tune with each other, and it really made him smile a little, just by how good it was. Yet oddly enough, he wasn't as ecstatic as he would usually be when he would eat something he likes, as he was now a lot more calm at the moment. In fact, there seemed to even be a familiarity with the taste, feeling that he ate Boss's curry before, but he didn't ponder on that as he took another spoon.

While eating, his waist became even smaller, but without any particular muscles developing in the area, leaving it just a little toned. Also, his hips started to push out a little, as a small layer of fat started to develop on them.

"This is as good as it usually is Boss. I just hope I won't fatten myself by eating so much."

"You? Getting fat? I find it hard to believe. There isn't anything fatty or heavy in my curry. And even it was, I am sure you, out of all people to be able to find a way to slim yourself back down."

"Probably...", said Banon as he took another bite.
1522213331112222121111.title: Sojiro finishes the curry

15222133311122221211111.content:
As he continued to enjoy his meal, not rushing to finish it, he was carefully analysing the ingredients with his now more developed palate, as he ate. It was a little cloudy in Tokyo today, but still a fair day all the same. On this day, a boy from America and his father were visiting the headquarters of the company he worked for, Sony.

Brandon Thomas was a 14 year old of average height, if not perhaps a little small at 5' exactly. His dad, Samuel Thomas, worked as a sales representative over where they worked. In fact, he was one of the top sales people, and he had gotten invited for a business meeting over in Tokyo, Japan as a result. It was quite the accomplishment for Samuel, as he had been to Japan once in the past for some good work years ago.

However, this time was different, as Brandon had been brought along for the ride this time. Honestly, Brandon wondered why his dad would be so interested in bringing him, but given that Brandon was a huge fan of video games as many boys were his age, his dad promised that he'd get a tour of the place if he came along. The idea of getting a tour of the Playstation area sounded like a lot of fun to Brandon, as he loved many of the Playstation and Nintendo systems. He was surprised that his dad offered it, but he wasn't complaining in the end.

So, in any case, they finally arrived at the building early in the morning. A bit early for Brandon's taste but he hoped it would be worth it.

"Wow, it's huge!" he cried out.

"Indeed," Samuel smiled. "You'd be surprised at how many floors there are."

With that, Brandon followed his dad inside, passing by numerous other people going in and out of the place. Obviously from what Brandon could tell, most spoke purely in Japanese. Despite watching some anime and such, he barely knew a spec of fluent Japanese. Heck, maybe that would be a perk as well.

Once Brandon and his dad got inside, Samuel went straight to the receptionist at the front, who seemed to smile in recognition of him.

"Hello Mrs. Mizuki," he smiled formally. "Nice to see you again."

"Kon'nichiwa Samuel-san. Nice to see you again," she gave a witty smile. "How long since the last time?"

"About 6 months I believe," Samuel smiled before turning to Brandon. "Brandon, this is Kana Mizuki. She's been the receptionist here for a few years."

Obviously Brandon wouldn't have known that thanks to her nametag being in Japanese kanji, so it was nice to know.

"Hello," he smiled.

"Hello to you as well. So you're Brandon?" she asked just to confirm, to which he nodded. "Okay, Samuel you know which floor you need to go to correct?"

"Yes I do," he nodded.

"Okay so Brandon...yes, your tour guide should be here shortly," Kana said and pointed in the direction of a break room. "You could wait in there if you like. Help yourself to a drink if you feel like it."

"I will, thanks," Brandon smiled before turning to his dad. "Bye dad!"

"See you later Brandon," Samuel smiled back before saying good bye to Kana as well. With that, he turned and went straight for the elevator, making sure he had everything with him.

With that, Brandon went inside to the break room, where some secretaries were idly chatting away without noticing him. Boy, Brandon couldn't help but notice how nice they looked. Japanese women always seemed to have this allure to them. Good thing they didn't seem to notice him looking. In any case, he had to admit he was pretty thirsty, though the break room seemed to have little in the way of drinks. Nothing much other than coffee.

Granted, although he didn't like the smell, he was pretty thirsty. Perhaps it would be worth giving it a small try. While the others weren't looking, he walked over and got a small cup, filling it up just a bit. With that, he began to sip and drink it, not exactly enjoying the taste of it.

"Ew, gross...." he groaned, still finishing the small bit he drank.

If only he knew what that drink did to those who drank it.

Kevin Johnson could still hardly believe what had happened. For a 15 year old, he had already become quite accomplished. He had just finished up his first year of high school, and got very high grades. In particular, he had expressed a strong desire to become a doctor, a desire that had become very well known. As it so happened as well, his school had a connection with a hospital in Japan that was known for its great doctors, and Kevin was offered the opportunity to learn from there following the school year.

It seemed a little bit strange that the school would have such a connection in another country, but everything seemed to check out. The name was rather simple, Osaka Medical, but it had risen in popularity relatively quickly. It had been up for a few years, making its rise practically meteoric. Perhaps that was why Kevin's school had such a good relationship. There was even an advertisement on the school campus. It made Kevin really excited for it all. Not just a chance to actually get to try out his dream job, but also get some world experience in the meanwhile. Visiting another country sounded pretty cool after all.

He thought back to his parents, and hoped they'd be proud. They seemed pretty happy at his accomplish, if not a little bit concerned about a 15-year old going off to another country. Then again, he had taken a plane alone once before to go visit family, so he was sure he could handle it. The hospital was finally coming into view from his taxi ride, making him all the more anxious about it. Putting a hand through his dirty blonde hair, he just hoped he would be ready.

The taxi driver eventually stopped. Kevin didn't have to worry about paying since the driver was already paid in advance to escort him here from the airport. Kevin nodded in thanks before the driver drove off, taking a deep breath as he began walking towards the hospital. Seemed pretty good on the outside, if not normal. Still, he was certainly anxious to see what awaited him. What made this hospital so renowned? Come to think of it, he would have loved to talk to others from his school that had come into the program but wasn't able to for some reason. Eh, whatever.

With a deep breath, Kevin walked inside. He walked past some people, getting a few stares. Sadly, he kind of expected that, given how things went in Japan frequently. Hopefully the day wouldn't be filled with that. He made his way up to the welcoming desk of the hospital, where some women were working. Pretty good looking ones too, which wasn't a surprise given the country.

Before Kevin could even introduce himself, one of the women looked up, smiling as she seemed to have an idea of who he was.

"Oh, you're Kevin Johnson, yes?" she asked in near-perfect English.

"Y-Yes I am," Kevin replied, a little surprised though not unpleasantly. "I'm here for the program with King Oaks High School?"

"Ah yes, I'm quite familiar with that," the woman smiled, getting up from her seat. "I'm Mariko. It's nice to meet you."

"Nice to meet you as well," Kevin replied a little shyly, but no less polite. He could see her nametag, which had the typical Japanese characters but also ""Yamazaki Mariko" underneath them.

"Dr. Yokogawa should be here shortly. He'll be your guide for the day," she smiled, offering him a seat nearby while she got back to work.

Nodding, Kevin took his seat, hugging his backpack. He figured he should bring some materials like a normal school day, including his usual notebook, a little game system in case her had free time, some books, etc. You know, the usual works. He even bought the notebook for this trip, figuring he could make better use of a fresh book. He figured that would be more than enough for the trip. He was supposed to stay a few days or so, no more than a week at most. He hoped what he had would be enough.

After about 10 minutes or so, a male doctor came through the nearby doors. His eyes landed on Kevin, smiling a bit as he motioned for him to come closer.

"Hello, I'm Hiroshi Yokogawa," the man smiled, also in pretty good English. "Glad to see you made it here in good time."

"I hoped so too, sir," Kevin smiled, returning the man's greeting.

"So, we're going to start with a little tour of the place," Dr. Yokogawa started. "I'd like for you to assist me for the most part."

"Yes sir," Kevin said with a nod.

"First things first, we need to get a place to put your stuff," Dr. Yokogawa explained. "Unfortunately, the doctor's station is full but there should be room in the nurse's station for you."

That seemed a little bit weird for Kevin, to go into basically the hospital equivalent to a women's locker room. Then again, if he had a professional doctor with him, then surely no one would raise a stink about it. Kevin nodded his affirmation as they began The doctor explained that the stations were located here on the first floor so it wouldn't take long. However, not long after, he paused.

"Oh, I forgot," he said, going into his pocket. "This nametag is for you. Don't lose it."

"Got it," Kevin said, seeing that the tag had his name put into it.

However, what Kevin didn't know was that that tag was enchanted. The doctor didn't even realize the mistake himself, having taken the wrong one following his talks with Kevin's teacher. Suffice to say, it was a special tag often given to the women who were hired here for various purposes. Not the receptionists obviously, but for others....

Kevin actually felt a tiny shock as he pinned the tag on, though he figured it was probably just him accidentally poking himself with the needle before getting it on right. Once that was done, he followed behind Dr. Yokogawa. His mind was purely on whatever might happen with the doctor, which was why he was ignoring the slight sensations he was getting, passed them off as anxiety.

In reality, his height was getting compressed from his usual 5'10" frame, pushed into a shorter 5'6" frame, making everything just a little bit bigger to him, though again he shoved that off as more nerves than anything else. He was in unfamiliar territory after all. Further down, his shoes were changing slowly. The laces were vanishing bit by bit, and as they vanished, the tongue of the shoes began to meld in more with the rest of the shoe. A very slight heel began to push itself out of the back, again not enough for him to notice. Furthermore, the material started to become more pliant, shifting a little closer to rubber or latex.

In addition to all that, his age began to jump, going straight up from 15 to 21, making him a full adult right off the bat. Come to think of it, Kevin wondered if he felt more mature for some reason. Eh, like that could be a bad thing.

"And here we are," the doctor said, finally arriving at the room appropriately labeled for the women's station.
